review_content: On a recent stay, I work for a company where we need housing for a few months at a time. With that said, we hadn't stayed at a Beat Western in awhile, and I wasn't sure about the place at first. But here are some of the Highlights and Low points during our three month stay:Low Lights: 1.) if you are a person with neck, back or nerve issues, I do not recommend the beds. They are very stiff, blankets are thin, pillows not supportive. Bring your own. 2.) No Microwave3.) Bathtub leaks/drips not fixed (we stayed in room 144). 4.) Front entry door sticks, hard to close.5.) No air vent in any of the bathrooms.6.) Rooms are small7.) No comfy chairs or couches in your room for relaxing. 8.) computer chair and desk do not pair well, as the chair is too low and your PC sits up high to type. Not very ergonomical. 9.) Room walls are thin and can hear next door people. Highlights: 1.) Staff is friendly 2.) Housekeeping is available for any extras needed for your room. However, a few times the room was cleaned but the beds were not made. 3.) Updated tile in bathroom4.) New carpet in rooms5.) Fridge is available upon request.6.) Very Clean 7.) Breakfast room is good, but wish they had more healthy choices besides carbs. 8.) Overall price you pay, is good if you want to shop at the Outlet, or got to downtown St. Augustine.After a recent stay at another Best Western I was reluctant to stay at any Best Western again. I took a chance and I'm do happy I did.To stay in town it was $70-120 higher than here. I usually stay in town but this hotel is only 15 min. away and you're right across the street from the outlets. It's the best of both worlds!It's only 2 floors and on the small side but for a place just to lay my head it was ideal.        Everyone at the front desk we're professional and helpful. There was always someone there 24 hours and there was someone to assist with my suitcases. I received the exact room that I had reserved. The room itself was on the smaller side but certainly was sufficient. The linens and decor were modern with bright lines. It was absolutely spotless in every room! Bonus was a new electrical strip to charge your electronics. Housekeeping was available if you needed them and were helpful. The only thing missing was a fridge but for one night I could do without it. What a refreshing change of pace from the last Best Western I stayed at. Make sure you make reservations early as they may be full.It is Definetly not a 5 star hotel, but it serves its purpose. They let us check in around 11 am which was awesome! And the staff was very friendly. Room and bathroom  were very very clean and no smell at all! The inside rooms look way better than the outside, we got a room with pool view which makes it better. It's located 12 min away from Castillo de San Marcos and all other attractions, so location is good. We got the hotel through Hotwire at a great price. I would stay here again. I'm giving 3 stars because the outside doesn't look like a 4 or 5 star hotel, but the rooms are definitely very good. And it's a green hotel, so thumbs up for that!!!Bathrooms have been recently updated & are Clean. Only problems: low placed shower head & no exhaust fan. Bed Linens are modern & fresh. Easy drive in to the historic district. Several fast food chains in walking distance, but the restaurants in the historic district are more than worth the drive. Check out Columbia. We were in room 217, 2nd room from the stairs and we could hear people loudly stomping on the metal stairs at 6am. Maybe when they remodel the exterior of the building, they could consider an update & install a quieter stair systemSpending two nights at this hotel, we found our room ready when we showed up early. That was great after driving all night. The lady at the desk was friendly and efficient. Our room is very basic, but there is also nothing to complain about. It was clean, no odor, and even though the hotel is pretty much full, it's very quiet. The king size bed is comfortable and has 4 pillows.  This hotel is on the outskirts of town, but very convenient to the highway. It's a 10 minute drive to get into town, no problem. They offer a complimentary breakfast, but there are other options within walking distance. I would not think twice about staying here again, great place, great value. This is not a high end establishment, but for a budget place to stay it is a great deal.We stayed here about 4 years ago and thought it was pretty good for the price. We stayed here again just a few weeks ago after their renovations and it was spectacular for the price. Clean, modern and quiet. They have a great breakfast in the morning with eggs, sausage, waffles and the usual cereals, yogurt and pastries. The staff was very friendly and helpful and again, the room was very clean. Well worth the price and just off I-95 so the entire area is easily accessible. Only about a 7 minute drive into the historic area as well. We will most definitely stay here again!Great Price and Tanya was very nice when we checked in and when we called . Me and my wife called other motels and everyone was rude but her nice demeanor sold us to stay here . We are from L.A. Cal. so we have been driving slot I would definitely stay here again.  She was probably the best one to take our call all trip long.Thank you again Tanya keep up the great work.OVERALL What can you expect from an inexpensive, dog-friendly motel? Stinky rooms, that's what...at least the rooms they allow for dogs. We stayed here because it cost less than other places, so we saved money, AND we were able to bring our dogs, saving us money on boarding. SERVICE Good. The flexible and friendly service/management made the overall experience not so bad. BREAKFAST The continental breakfast was the typical carb-fest with no meats but not terrible - there were hard-boiled eggs and sugary Borden yogurt, a waffle iron, and a selection of breads and cereals and juice. The breakfast area was mega crowded and tiny, though! THE ROOM Stunk, but we could breathe. Tiny bathroom. Damage from previous occupants' pets, including a hole in the wall. One bed had black dog fur on it and our dogs are white/cream colored, so I don't think they changed the sheets. Of course there were urine smells, but also a musty/mildewy type odor. But hey, whatever, there was a large nice TV, clean starchy towels, and overall it wasn't awful. LOCATION Not far, maybe 10-20 minutes, from most popular St. Augustine attractions. BOTTOM LINE If you need a dog-friendly cost-effective stay, this isn't your worst option.This was a nice hotel, the price was great! The rooms and bathrooms were newly updated and the beds were cozy. If you want to go to St. Augustine to see the sights, I'd recommend picking a hotel more in the city. This one is off I-95 and its a bit of a drive to get into the city. What we saved in hotel fees, we spent in gas driving back and forth. Next time I'll stay at the other best westerns that are actually in the city and you can just walk the whole time you're there, not drive back and forth.We recently stayed during a convention in St. Augustine and this place was easy to find right off the interstate and easy to get back where we were going. Very close to Taco Bell and Denny's (walking distance) and actually pretty good rooms.  Though we did have an issue the second night with the smoke detector, they came up quickly to fix the issue. Pros:Pretty comfy beds (me being pregnant this is an essential) Nice Clean roomGood free internet (didnt drop nor did we have issues connecting) Good breakfastNice well lit bathroomCons: The breakfast area is SMALL, its hard to eat comfortably unless you eat outside the area. If you can afford it, eat at Denny's which is really good.No amenities, needs more than a hair dryer and coffee maker, please to put in a fridge? All in all it was worth the price we paid for it, and they are very reasonable with pricing and offer a military discount. They didnt disturb the room like we wanted and we werent disturbed much at night so its definitely a good place to stay.Great hotel! Right off the I95 about 10 minutes from historic St Augustine. Clean and the staff is friendly. I had the pleasure of checking in with Dora. There is a Denny's and a Taco Bell next door and you can't beat the free wifi and parking right in front of your room!Pros:King sized bed upgrade was worth it (although put us in the back of the property). Staff was delightful and quick to help. Room was clean and looks like new TV's were recently put in. Wi-fi is also free but could be a little faster.Cons:They don't have fridges in the room, you have to ask for one to borrow for your stay. Bathroom is a little cramped (door comes within a hair of the toilet). Also, had to kill a huge-ass roach.Overall, it was a good stay.

hotel_name: Howard Johnson Johnson St Augustine I-95
review_content: doest get one star because i got the room for 40 bucks on hipmunk and the king bed was comfy and the hot water worked. otherwise wifi is broke, no towels in room, staff is pretty gross, and this place is ghetto. wont come backBeware!! Do not stay here!! Decided to come to St. Augustine one night earlier so we needed to find a cheap room for just one night.. We paid $110 for ONE night to stay at this trash heap. Check in took 20 minutes+ due to the employee not having a clue as to what he was doing, also talking on the phone while working. Once we finally did get to our room, the door was OPEN, my boyfriend walked in first to make sure no one was inside. It was empty but there was a screw driver next to the toilet, a rag shoved into the tub, and a plunger... It was DISGUSTING!!! We had to wait in line again (at this point there are at least five people ahead of us). It is ridiculous to have to wait in line again when it was there stupidity to give us a room that obviously has major issues. I told my boyfriend that we should just stay somewhere else but he thought it would be okay if we just got a different room. The second room did not have bed bugs (the only plus I can think of). While in the shower the light cover fell off the wall because it was being held to the wall with duck tape. The hand towel had a long hair sticking out of the weaving. Gross. I always bring soaps and shampoo/conditioner when traveling which is good because the size of their shampoo could probably only wash an infants amount of hair. Pathetic. Do not stay here!!This place was absolutely disgusting. There were stains on the bathroom wall near the toilet that looked like someone smeared poo on it . The floor near the toilet was weak and felt as if it was going to give at any time. The coffee maker looked as if it was never cleaned. The microwave was rusted out on the inside. The lampshades were torn up. It appeared that the room had not been vacuumed or swept in ages and the smell of the mildew was too much. We paid $85 for the night..it wasn't worth $8 a night. Don't even slow down near this place ..just keep going.I, like some of the other reviewers, got this hotel for a discount from KAYAK. I know the other hotels in the area are pricier, but please, just bite the bullet and pay more.First off, because I checked in early, I had to pay an additional $20. It shouldn't be my problem that they're unprepared and I have to pay more.Second, there was NO COMFORTER ON OUR BED!!! Granted the sheets were thick, but for $20 more, I could have stayed at another hotel with a comforter on the bed. I think they used the comforters to create curtains for the window.Third, the TV sucks! Some channels have lines in the TV, the audio on some channels sounds like loud white noise to where you can't hear any of the actors talking and other channels are just static. Fourth, the Wi-Fi signal is so weak that it's basically non-existent. Clearly, the owner here doesn't give a f*ck about its customers! Fifth, there were bugs in our bed. Nuff said!Sixth, the sink was linking and its a good thing I unplugged the hair dryer otherwise I would have been electrocuted. I really wish I just shelled out the additional $50 for a bay front hotel in St. Augustine. If you're looking for a good hotel, please don't take these reviews lightly. Just suck it up and go with the more expensive option. Hell, if I knew whoever was reading this personally, I might give them the money myself to go get a better hotel! (You can take that last sentence lightly, but that's all! Lol)If I could give no stars I would! The first room we got had roaches in the bed, not just 1 or 2. There was a ton of them! The next room looked like a blast from the past! They advertise flat screen tvs and remodeled rooms, we got a old desk and dresser with a box TV. Then our room keys wouldn't work so we had to go back to the office and get new ones. No house keeper ever came by so new towels? Nope! You would think the front desk would care about these issues, right? No, they acted like we complained about the color of the room. THERE WERE ROACHES IN THE DAMN BED!! Do yourself a favor and never EVER stay here!!I would say this place is laughably awful except after leaving you feel kind of itchy which isn't so funny. They come fully equipped with a TV from the mid 90's about 7 channels work well, the shower took forever to get hot and the staff in the front office was slower than frozen molasses. This place is perfect if you're a trailer trash Harley rider who's life goal was to own a motorcycle rather than a proper non movable home. Howard Johnson should cut the cord on this location.Another reviewer wishing there was a no stars option. Rooms were filthy. Did not bathe my children as I figured it would actually make them dirtier. Skipped the shower for me too. Breakfast guy utterly failed food safety 101 as I watched him wear the same pair of gloves to take out garbage, touch every handle and door knob in the place, and then handle all the bagels. Rather peeved that I paid $70 for this dump, but every other hotel was filled. At least my son threw up on their sheets last night, ketchup and bbq sauce, we had our revenge.At first, I thought this would be a fine place to stay. Once we got there, we soon realized there were cockroaches. A lot of them. Everywhere. I told the front desk and they said they couldn't comp me anything because I bought the reservation through a third party (Priceline) and "my rate was already discounted". It turns out my rate was the same as they were advertising out front so that was a lie. They offered to move me to another room but the whole place had bugs so it didn't make sense to move. I won't stay here again. Only redeeming quality was the breakfast was good.How do I give a place 0 stars?? This place is horrible. The advertised "kitchenette" is false. There was mold in the fridge and moldy coffee in the dinky coffee pot. I really wish I had taken pictures of everything. No one will believe this! Wifi does not work. It is dirty. Has not been vacuumed or swept for years! No clean towels are given and hair (and boogers. Yes, boogers) from previous tenants is everywhere! I went to get two towels from the front and it took her 20 minutes to get me TWO STINKING TOWELS since there were none at all. The "breakfast" is an absolute joke! It ends at 9am and by 8am, nothing is left and the people at the front counter don't fill anything. In one instance, the clerk lied to another saying that he had refilled the line and it was a lie because we had been there and nothing was touched. Added to the fact that he was SLEEPING at the desk(there are witnesses), he was lying. If I can attach a picture, I will! In one of our rooms, the ceiling was literally cracked around the entire tile making it unsuitable for habitation. Our family rented three rooms that were scattered throughout the premises(after being promised they were side by side) and whenever we used the phones, there was so much static, it was basically an exercise in futility. The only good thing I have to say is that there were no roaches that I could see. That would have been the final straw for sure! I honestly do not know what the cleaning people get paid for here. The linen has cigarette burn holes and stains all over it. I'm so glad I always bring my own blanket and pillow to hotels. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE. If absolutely necessary, sleeping in your car is probably better than this dump. It needs to be shut down or get new management. It's ridiculous.Checked in 3-3-14, lobby a/c broken. Cranky attendants. Asked for non smoking room, got smoking. Room smelled of mildew. Dirty tub. Empty coffee maker at breakfast. Will not be coming back.This place is a dump. The lobby was dirty. The exterior was dirty. The door to my room had a taped on number plate and looks like the police kicked it in at some point. The furniture is old and badly worn. To top everything off, the room was dirty and had a bad smell. I stayed because I was too tired to look elsewhere. There are lots of other hotels in this price range that are clean and respectfully maintained. AvoidWhat ever you do, do not stay here!! This place is not even worth $20 per night!! This is a franchise hotel so it is run by who knows who..obviously people that don't care about cleanliness, or customer service..the rooms was very dirty when we checked in.. from the walls, the the floor..they put us in a cleaner room that was non-functional..if your going to run a hotel using a big company's name..you should represent that company to their standards. .!! Got my money back for some of the days from the manager who had a "I don't care attitude" makes me think should I ever again stay at a Howard Johnson at all in the future. .!! My advice if your staying in the beautiful St. Augustine area, spend a little more for a different much nicer hotel/resort.

The hotel was clean, price was fair, and we enjoyed our stay. We only had one minor hiccup the first day due to a slamming door that our room was adjacent to. I guess the arm closer for the door broke and it would slam and shake the wall anytime someone went through it. We were able to move to a different room the next day and I saw someone working on the door to hopefully get it fixed. The staff was awesome, everyone seems to take pride in their work there. The breakfast was also very good.I'm not one to be too negative when reviewing, but this location does not meet the expectations a Club member has for a Country Inn and Suites, especially given the room's cost.On our vacation trip along the east coast of Florida this week, we stayed only at Country Inn and Suites. This night's stay was our most expensive, and yet it was our most disappointing.The interior itself seems incredibly dated and in need of serious updating. Carpet needs to be replaced, and the air is musty. The nicest part was honestly the parking lot which seemed new. The bed was comfortable, but the AC unit under the window was incredibly noisy when it ran. My son, who generally sleeps like a log, commented on difficulty sleeping because of the AC unit. Just overall it felt somewhat rundown.The pool and hot tub seemed fine, but they are outside right next to the main road out front. There were no towels there.One positive was the workers. They seemed willing to engage patrons and looked to help. Oh and the breakfast was good for the most part with the eggs and sausage being hot.The location is great in way of proximity to various sites in St. Augustine; however, I will not choose to stay at this location again.Well I agree with everyone above. Definitely a place to crash and leave immediately. Our room had a mildew smell and the bathroom was in need of alittle help. The decor was about ok. I wish I would have read the reviews on Yelp before I booked this room through hotels.com. Yelpers are usually more honest about their reviews. St George inn or The Cozy Inn are probably better hotels.Lost a star immediately for having all fluorescent lighting in the rooms. If they want to save a buck and "save the environment" then use candles and lanterns. I absolutely hate fluorescent lighting; it's cold, abrasive, horrible on the eyes, and can give some people headaches.Next, the first two rooms they gave me had door and window issues. There were actually gaps between the door and frame and the windows' locks were not secure. Many of the window locks that actually did work were not locked to begin with.After we finally settled in, we found the A/C to be a bit loud, but it was tolerable.The redeeming factors were the staff and the free breakfast. The staff was very motivated to make sure we were happy and the breakfast had a good selection and was well-maintained. And my wife was impressed that they had Pantene bath products. These three things gave them a 3 star rating instead of 2.Just make sure you check the doors and windows before you leave your valuables in the room, especially if you are on the first floor.First floor, room 108. Strong musky smell upon walking into the room, almost as if the toilet flooded and the carpet wasn't properly cleaned. The AC makes a horrible scrapping noise and doesn't retain a true temperature, so I sweat most of the night. Overall, worst hotel experience I've had in a long time. I only give it two stars because of its location. One mile away from all the shops and restaurants.Awful stay here. The fire alarm went off at 2am. We were told it's because the control panel is in the main entrance door way and someone got confused and hit a button to be buzzed in. My response was than someone should move the panel ! The cited code was the reason it is there, but that's a bunch of bull.Location is ok.Service was ok.Inside of rooms was very dated and in need a a refurb. As you can see from my pics tub was nasty.Singed a waiver agreement that the price total was 167 a night then the morning of checkout they slipped a bill for 197 dollars under my door. The added state tax.... this is in Florida and city tax on an in packaged itemFor a hotel that says they've recently undergone an update... They need another one. The hotel was clean, comfortable, but the rooms were outdated. In my King room, there was a huge gap along the wall where something seemed to be missing. The art work was a jumble of images that didn't go together and was aesthetically displeasing. The AC.. while set to 66* didn't seem to get below 70* and left the room feeling damp. I will say though, that the breakfast was amazing. There were scrambled eggs, sausage and french toast. There were pastry and doughnuts, cereal and juices, and there was no issue with getting what you wanted.I m here a lot on business and this is the best hotel for the price (on a weeknight, if you clip a coupon from a motel magazine or find a good price on orbitz, you can get nightly rate for around 100...in winter, even lower!) First-- staff is SO friendly. Conner on evenings--- OMG --- she will go OUT OF HER WAY any way she can to make you feel welcome. Even the night shift tried to help me get some breakfast as I was leaving before breakfast started (5:30 am!). The business center and workout center get the job done and are clean. The bed is very COMFY with a plump duvet as the bedspread that I love. Bathroom looks clean and updated to me. Nice complementary parking and walking distance to good places to grab food. I plan on returning to COuntry inn and Suites for vacation--not business-this summer in St Augustine and couldnt be more excited!DAY 1:Well....we usually stay at a Hampton because we find them to be pretty consistent. Checked in and place needs an update. Mildew smell in hall on first floor, parking access was not that great, room feels damp, wi-fi connection was difficult to access. Hope things improve......DAY 2:Well giving 2 stars because breakfast was good, although the space to dine is very small making seating difficult and access to the buffet difficult. Room was cleaned well but still feels damp. Wi-fi hit and miss the whole time. At times not able to access at all and other times it would just boot you off.Can't say I would recommend staying here since you can find better accommodations for the same price. Must agree with others about remodel and not that great a place to stay.This hotel is too over priced for the outdated look. The room seemed clean however the bathroom towel has some yellow stains and light gray old stains. Even one towel was damp. Called down to desk who had some unpleasant responses like "I don't know about that I'm not in housekeeping and they don't come in until ..." Had ask twice for fresh towels to brought up to room. One person took shower at night and other in morning and both times we had to run water 5 mins before it got hot and had to turn it all the way up on hot. Sink water never did get hot. Mildew in shower. Ok stay. Have seen better years ago with Country inn but lately they have failed me and my guests every time.Nasty, is the first word that comes to mind as I am writing this review. The bed is lumpy and smells of mold, the bathroom is dirtier than a public restroom at a bus station. Avoid this place at all cost Yelpers, it's a pit, let my experience save you from this nightmare.Not a bad hotel, but a bit overpriced. Our base rate was $103, but the $20 fee for an extra person brought our total bill with taxes to about $140. While we had a one bedroom suite with a pullout sofa, it sounds better than it actually was. The hotel was on the older side and a bit run-down....again, not bad, but not great. The room was clean, had free Wi-Fi and a nice, free breakfast. My mom and sister loved the waffles and sausage. In my opinion, this hotel would have earned an extra star if the base rate was in the $70-$80 range. Let's face it....when you stay at a hotel, the bottom line is cleanliness and value.

hotel_name: La Fiesta Ocean Inn & Suites with Beachfront Bed And Breakfast
review_content: A a child in the 1970's, I stayed at this hotel with my family every summer. I returned in September after 40 years to find that the atmosphere was still the same. The rooms have been beautifully renovated but the spirit of the place, and the beautiful beach is the same as I remember! The staff is caring and friendly and very knowledgeable about restaurants and things to do and see in the area. I highly recommend this hotel.Was good for the location and the price. The delivered breakfast was nice but not enough to make up for the lack of sleep. The bed was rock solid and though the a.c. was cranked all night it never cooled the room. And a working a.c. is the one thing that should be mandatory in any hotel in Florida. I loved being able to walk down to the beach, it was the best part. But the room was tiny, and even worse the bathroom was tinier. Was awkward stripping out of a swimsuit and trying to de-sand in such a small bathroom. Next time we're in St. Augustine we'll seek other accommodations.Stayed here on several occasions, and have had both friends and family stay here.  We have stayed in Suites and the Inn, and all have been superb.Great location, love the heated pool and the gardening around the property.  It's clear the owner values what he does and takes pride in it.  Highly recommended.Stayed here for 2 nights overall great stay, got king partial ocean view , short walk to the beach which is beautiful.  The staff were very nice and breakfast is free and delivered right to the door you can pick the time for delivery, they call when they are on the way.  5 min away to downtown. Only downside the room did have a moldy odor but after turning on the air it went away. Its not a 5 star hotel but its a decent place to stay we enjoyed our time.This hotel was booked by relatives from out of state so I did not know what to expect when my wife and I agreed to book there as well for the weekend. We were very pleasantly surprised. The property had a great location on a beautiful stretch of beach. The staff was friendly and attentive. The rooms weren't large but definitely served the purpose. While no beach chairs/umbrellas were provided by the hotel, it was convenient t rent them from the local vendor who delivered/set them up early in the morning.. The property was convenient to many local restaurants and the pristine state park. About the only minor negative that I can think of was the lights from the mini golf place next door coming through our back window late at night.  We will come back for sure.My boyfriend and I used Expedia to book this hotel for our anniversary weekend, and I have to say I was pretty disappointed by what we saw once we got there. There were several other locations nearby that were less expensive for what we got for this one, and I just feel as if we were a bit mislead by the description on the site. The hotel is definitely dated, and if you can catch it on a good deal night it's totally worth it for the service alone. However, this hotel is NOT truly a beach front hotel, but NONE of them are in St. Augustine. You aren't far from the beach, but it's good to know upfront that you will be walking to the beach, and you cannot see it from the hotel rooms. When I think of beach front, it means I can leave my patio door open at night and hear the waves crashing against the beach, not that I can sorta see a beach off in the distance. The other reason we booked this place is because they had a heated pool, and we knew it'd be too cold to swim at the beach. We were going to stay in town, with a hotel that had a heated pool for about $20 less per night, but wanted the romantic feel of the beach for our anniversary. Well, I stuck my foot in the pool water and it was FREEZING!!! I told them at the front desk two or three times and they told me the heater was working. NO IT WASN'T!!! Because on the last day of our trip they had a repair guy out there to fix it!We got to pick our breakfast from a menu, and that was ok, they brought it to our room. They really didn't offer much of a selection. I am not against tipping, I was in the service industry... But I am just as happy to walk my happy self up to the desk to get my own breakfast. I don't like tipping someone to bring me a bagel and a muffin... seriously. It's a ways from town but you can get a trolley ticket for $30 per person if you want to leave your car. All in all, I was not impressed and I will most likely never stay here again. The service was ok, and I think there is a better value to be had elsewhere.This place reminds me of the old days--and that's a compliment.  The entire staff is genuinely friendly and helpful.  Although it wasn't in perfect shape, the room was very quiet and comfortable.  It included a fridge, microwave, free Starbucks coffee, free wi-fi and a nice flatscreen.  In the morning, a small breakfast is delivered to your door--which was really convenient and a time saver.  The hotel has two washers and dryers and they sell laundry detergent in the lobby.  It's a very short walk to the beach and a ten minute drive to the old town.  I would certainly stay here again.Hubby booked this place on-line and had no idea what it was like. It's small. Our room was near the office so it was a bit noisy at times. We have usually always stayed in condos when we travel. Don't expect that here. On the good side you can tell the place has been renovated. It's clean. Nice bath linens. Nice pool and garden. But no beach view. I had foot surgery so the walk to the beach was a bit difficult but not completely unmanageable. The beach is drop-dead beautiful. Bring your own beach chair. You'll want to spend some time out there. Great beach for walking. Sadly I am unable to. But all in all you can't beat the beach here. So as far as amenities, the place is nice, but not quite up to my overall expensive tastesStayed here for two nights during an impromptu beach trip. The front desk was super helpful. The room was basic+...the bed was comfy, the AC worked great, the TV was nice and had good channels, took a great bath in the basic tub, there's a mini fridge and microwave. All great. Easy 3 minute walk across the dunes to the beach. Breakfast each morning is definitely a nice touch. I'd stay here again!Definitely a place to stay for a week or so, savoring the old fashioned Florida beach feeling and visiting St. Augustine at night.Friendly staff, delicious fresh-baked scones and muffins delivered to your room (part of the free breakfast), comfortable rooms, spectacular beach, easy parking and beautifully landscaped grounds, convenient to St. Augustine (the beach bus will pick you up right in front of the hotel).  What more can I say?Some things that may be a con for some: a very active mini-golf right next door (which also serves great soft-serve ice cream) and you do have to walk across a lawn and over the dunes on a boardwalk to get to the beach.  Most of the rooms do not have a view of the beach for this reason, but anyone who frequents St. Augustine knows this to be true of most hotels in the area.  The hotel has an associated bed and breakfast that is closer to the beach proper but I wasn't able to visit it.  The staff really impressed me with their friendliness and efficiency:  breakfast was delivered to the rooms promptly at the time of our choice and the scones and muffins were warm and tasty.    The rooms were comfortable and the ones we had (garden view) had nice private patios/balconies.  If you stay in the area, order from Verrazano's pizza delivery--they have the most incredible pizza!  Their salads are also fresh and a perfect accompaniment to their pizzas.My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon, and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for an affordable, pleasant, and clean stay in St. Augustine.We got our first impression of the hotel before we even crossed into Florida.  Due to a snowstorm and illness, we needed to stop in Georgia for a night on the way down.  I called La Fiesta, expecting that I would have to beg them to hold our room for us since we would be arriving 24 hours later than expected.  As soon as I explained our situation to the woman on the phone, she said she would go ahead and check us in and we could arrive any time.  (Our stay was prepaid, but I have encountered hotels that will not hold your room for you past 2 AM on the first night of your reservation, even if you have paid in advance.)We stayed in one of the queen rooms in the pool area.  These are their cheapest rooms, and they are small, but they have recently been renovated and are clean and comfortable.  For a couple, the size is perfect.  And we really appreciated that the floors are all tile--no nasty, grungy hotel carpet!  The bathroom fixtures are not new, but again, they are clean and functional, and that's all I need.The staff was always very friendly and helpful; we stopped in the lobby almost every morning and got great recommendations on things to see and places to eat in the area.  They deliver complimentary breakfast to your room every morning, and while the menu is very limited, it's worth it for the delicious, freshly baked scones and muffins (not to mention the fact that you don't even have to get out of your pajamas for breakfast!).  Our room was very clean every evening when we got "home" from sightseeing.  And when we discovered that our mini-fridge didn't work, the staff promptly replaced it.  They never treated us like second-class guests because we booked our stay at a discounted rate through Priceline.  (Again, I wish I could say this for all hotels...)The grounds are beautifully landscaped, and if you can afford to spring for one of the garden- or ocean-view rooms, I'm sure they're lovely.  Our only view was of the parking lot, but we didn't care since weren't planning to spend much time in our room anyway.  The hotel is on the ocean side of the highway, and the beach is just a short walk over the dunes via a private boardwalk.  (Keep in mind that almost ALL "beachfront" hotels in St. Augustine are really on the other side of the dunes from the ocean.)I give La Fiesta five stars because of the combination of affordability, cleanliness, comfort, beachfront location, and helpfulness of the staff.  It's not a fancy hotel, but my husband and I have no reason to stay anywhere else in St. Augustine from now on.  We will definitely be back.My partner and I stayed at this hotel this past weekend.  I decided to book this hotel based on reviews I found on Yelp and Trip Advisor.  Overall, this was a great place.  I usually only stay at chain hotels such as Hilton or Marriotts, so was leary about staying at a "local" hotel.  The La Fiesta changed my impression.  The front desk clerk was extremely friendly.  I didn't get his name, but he was working last Thursday around 7pm.  From there, we went to room 211 which was a King.  This room looked recently remodeled.  The bathroom had nice tile and fixtures.  The room was clean and quiet.  Everything worked well.  We were able to walk over to the beach and enjoy some time there even though it was cold.  My only complaint was that they only have 19" tv's in the room, instead of 32 or larger but they were still flat screens.I thought it would be pretty crappy since its one of those tiny family owned hotels. But no it's so clean, nice and a great location too. Even though only more expensive rooms have balconies and all you get is a small window , the room itself is nice even though it's pretty tiny. However there is no old furniture and everything looks new and squeeky clean. No wonder it's the winner for this year for,i believe it's, trip advicer. You also get breakfast brought to your room every morning. You can pick 2 things on the menu and pick the time you want it delivered, you'll get a call in the morning and next thing you know the food's at your door.The pool is huge and always heated, you don't need to ask anyone to open it and wait for it to heat up, it's always done. We went in winter and even when it's pretty chilly outside the pool still works even though there's noone in it.I loved the location, there's a little walkway through which you get to the beach and on the way to the beach there are benches where you can just sit and relax. Also the hotel is pretty close to different places like a couple of shops and restaurants. Overall i'm satisfied with it, and if you want a relaxing peacefull vacation, this us for you.I rented 8 rooms for one night for a church group. We got in the first day very late and everyone went straight to bed.  The next morning I asked for a late checkout and was told no.  Ok no biggie but then we were told that we needed to be off the property by the 11am checkout time.  I waited over an hour to talk to the owner and I was again told that we were to large of a group (19 people in 8 rooms) and would "tax the hotels facilities".  I asked why if check-in was not until 3pm how we would tax their facility considering most of us were going to be on the beach and she responded that I should of purchased another night for all 8 rooms.  We were not even using their parking facilities, did not use the complementary breakfast, and had not spent a moment using either their pool or beach at this point.Simply put, I've traveled with large groups for many years, several times a year and have never been told this.  We ended up moving down the street to a competitor.  When they found out how we were treated they let us use their facilities for free.The owners excuse for not letting us stay after checkout was bogus.  Either they did not want the "catholics" there or they were upset at having a number of Hispanics staying at their hotel.  There is no way having people on a beach would tax their facilities.  AVOID this place like the plague!We were treated like garbage at this hotel.  Despite the fact we had 8 rooms and had only used the facility to sleep one night, the next morning we were told we needed to leave the facility by 11am and would be denied access to the pool / beach after checkout.Often you can find a nice, family owned place that does good business...This establishment is not one of them. If you are looking for professionalism and friendly, warm management to complete your St. Augustine lodging experience, don't bother with La Fiesta. Its not competitively priced for what you get.I decided to stay at La Fiesta Inn for our last Thanks giving vacation, and I'm so glad I did! Though it's a bit of drive to downtown, but after spend almost whole day in city, I think it's nice to get away from hustle and bustle. This Inn has decent and clean room, great service (they deliver the breakfast to each room every morning, you choose your own time), nice landscape with mini putt-putt & pool (too bad, i didn't use them), and good access to the beach. There's lots of nice restaurants around the area too, so you won't have difficulties to find food once you already in Inn. They have free shuttle to Old Town Trolley tours (I'm not sure about the schedule, but you can get the schedule flayers at the front office). Definitely a nice and affordable place to stay.

My husband and I checked on a Monday evening and left the following Saturday morning. The internet stated one price and offered a discount on multiple nights. We arrived at the motel and ended up paying about $18 extra (total was $320--still a great price!). The website did not state we needed to book online to get the discount but, apparently, that's how it worked. The manager seemed preoccupied when we arrived but he was still friendly. Over the following days he seemed to be friendlier so I know the hubby and I just caught him at a bad time. The housekeeper was very friendly, too, and very attentive.Our room, 208, was very clean. No dust or dirt anywhere. No towels with stains. The TV, AC and mini fridge worked great. The motel internet worked great every day except for Monday night after 10pm. The connection kept coming and going. The shower head needs to be replaced but it worked just fine. The blanket was a little itchy, but the sheets and mattress was comfy. They offer free soap and shampoo. The free breakfast was cereal, bagels, muffins, milk, orange juice, and coffee. Though some people complain about a cold breakfast (spoiled people!), my hubby and I enjoyed it very much. It lasted from 7:30 to 9:30am. We didn't have to go out for food, so money well saved. The pool is about half the size of a regular-sized pool, so it was pretty small. It was clean and quite though. All in all, we would stay here again if we ever returned to St. Augustine.We stayed here on the first floor, for a one night weekend get-a-way. The room had a king sized bed, a micro-fridge, and a microwave. The room was clean, had no odd or offensive odors, and the bed was very comfortable.The location, if you are a walker, is *perfect* for downtown excursions. You are about 1 mile from the marina (where I wholeheartedly recommend the Schooner Freedom sails; particularly sunset sails). What better way to see St. Augustine, than leaving your car at your hotel, and enjoying everything downtown has to offer, without adding parking to your expenses (or breaking the bank to actually stay downtown?)If you book a month ahead of your stay, there is also a discount for the room fee.The man who checked us in was very friendly, and pleasant to talk to. As another reviewer said, the pool is small. About 10' by 10' and a little over 5' deep. We don't use hotel pools, so it's size doesn't matter to us whatsoever.Competitively priced, clean and convenient. Would definitely stay here again, and would definitely recommend to family and friends.Road trip back home to Jersey from west palm beach, could not resist stopping through St. Augustine. OMG what an amazing town. Needed a night to stay and found this little motel in 5 mins from town center, very affordable and very clean.A get what you pay for hotel. Clean and the price is right. Very small pool out front with 2 tables and four chairs. Only one table has an umbrella. There two floors and all the rooms face the road which is just across the parking lot. Free Wi-Fi and contential breakfast starting at 7:30am at the office. Ice maker is on the first floor by the office. TV is Sanyo old tube model about 24". Room had small table, arm chair, dresser, small refrig, tiny microwave, and small closet. I want a cheap budget place and that was close to the Bridge, Lighthouse, etc. and this fits the bill. If you plan to hang out there, it's not the place for you, but if you a clean, cheap place, this is it.Like others have said "You get what you pay for" . This is NOT a high end place. It is relatively clean. The office and maid staff are very helpful. Faucet in the shower can use some work. Swimming Pool was clean if not very big. More jacuzzi size. It is a older hotel. Short walk to Mellow Pizza (YUM) and to a very clean laundromat. If you want to use WIFI you have to be close to your room or the office... does not work by the pool area.You get what you pay for and this was worth every penny! We were on a budget and we got a clean bed, microwave, fridge and free wifi! What more could you ask for!Best thing about this hotel is its location. About 2 blocks from the Bridge of Lions, where you can easily walk to downtown St. Augustine. It's less than a mile from St. George Street, and a nice pretty scenic walk over the bridge (and you don't have to fight traffic). Also, there are several restaurants located around the hotel, including Blackfly, GAS, O'Steens, British Pub, Raw Martini, etc. Plenty of things to do. The hotel (motel?) itself is clean, but nothing fancy. I would definitely go back, but I would bring my own pillows and my own towels. The pillows were flat and the towels not absorbent at all. We visited in February, so no swimming for us, although the tiny pool is heated. You must check in before 9pm, but we were running late and the office guy stayed until 10, which we appreciated. He was friendly and helpful, giving us a map of the area and letting us know that the sightseeing train shuttle would pick us up out front if we wanted to do that. The small continental breakfast is just muffins, bagels, coffee, juice, cereal. It does the job when you are hungover! Each room has a microwave and fridge, and there's a handy cabinet to store your food/liquor so that you don't lose your bathroom counter space. Each room also has a tub/shower, but the water pressure was pretty low. Someone else must have been taking a shower at the same time as me and finished, because mid-shower I was finally able to rinse my hair at an acceptable rate. The tub has a nonslip mat inside, but it looks pretty shady underneath that. Therefore, you couldn't pay me to actually take a bath in that tub, but as long as I can shower I'm good to go. Completely served our needs of being inexpensive ($75 a night), clean, and most importantly close enough to walk to the bars and stumble home. Would stay again!I second Jenny's comments. By far, the best thing about the place is the location. There is no view from the hotel, but walk a couple of blocks and you are on the river. Cross the bridge, and you are in downtown. Walk the other way a mile and you are at the lighthouse. A little further still, and you get to the Alligator Farm, then Anastasia Park, and then the Amphitheater. There are several restaurants nearby, but I recommend going to downtown instead. The room itself is about what you would expect from an economy motel. Clean enough, but certainly not spotless. The towels were pretty scratch, and the bed marginally comfortable. The shower pressure was also just enough. The wi-fi password was the hotel phone number, but no one told us that, so we had to call the "emergency" number to get it. They didn't even have it on the wall in the rooms.The owners let us checkout a little late (45 minutes) and we were able to keep our car in the lot after checkout so we could go eat some food downtown, so that was nice. I was able to book the room for under $60 on Booking.com. So for that price, it was sort of a no-brainer.

First time staying here, will definitely be back again. Very friendly staff both in office and kitchen. Hotel is clean, comfortable, as close to the beach as you can get, easy walking access. Breakfast is included and is wonderful! Great home cooking, and baking from Janie. She is a sweetheart,  as is all the staff.We actually stayed at the sister hotel down the street and loved it!!!! Both hotels are dog friendly so that is why we stayed there... The Vilano gardens inn was a cute little remodeled old motel, rooms were very nice and clean... The breakfast in the morning is at the other hotel and is AMAZING!!!! The beach is also dog friendly and our dogs had a blast! Only a five minute car ride into old town Saint Augustine from here... It was really a perfect vacation... Can't wait to come back!Stayed at the Vilano Beach Garden Inn just down the street that is run by the same company.  Very nice and professional staff, nice and clean rooms, pet friendly hotel.  Simple accomodations but everything you need, nice linens on bed, tv, small frig, microwave, coffee maker, tile floors-no rugs to trap smells.   A fenced dog area with poo bags. The only minus was the air conditioner unit.  It was very loud and the air never got cold.  Maybe it was just the one in our room.  Made for a restless sleep.  Publix a block away, pier a block down the street and the beach a couple blcoks down the street the other way.  Five minutes over the bridge to St Augustine.My family and I really enjoyed staying here! Perfect location, great staff, great breakfast, comfortable and spacious rooms. We are looking forward to coming back and making this our "TO GO" place in St.. Augustine. We booked 3 rooms for a special birthday weekend. It couldn't have been a better choice for us. I can't wait to book a room for a girls weekend! 3 or 4 of us could totally sleep well here.I will be back!Great location helpful pleasant staff very pet friendly and the absolute best breakfast in town. Don't miss the home made yogurt.  Apartment like rooms very clean with fab ocean views. Love this placeMust update- only because I had not tried the breakfast yet. This is a must! This wonderful lady that makes breakfast should be running a restaurant! Her bread pudding is to die for and I don't like bread pudding. Scones, quiche!! And I hear we missed the banana bread? I'm ready to move here!My wife,dog and I really enjoyed our stay. The hotel seems family owned and everyone is very friendly and accommodating. Our room was very clean and well appointed and a home cooked complementary breakfast which was awesome. The hotel is right on the beach and very close to Saint Augustine attractions right over the bridge. We will definitely return for another stay.We did a short "in-state vacation" and were in Saint Augustine from Monday 06/29/2015 through Thursday morning 07/02/2015. We booked our room over the phone and Phillip was very accommodating and professional. We ended up over at the Gardens (just a short walk from the main hotel), but boy was that a blessing. The room was very large and gave us plenty of space for the dog and kid. In our room there were no closets or wardrobes, so be prepared for that. The bathrooms were small and even "tight". Furnishings were comfortable, although I would have liked an easy chair or recliner in order to watch TV (the room was lager enough to handle it comfortably). If you stay at the Garden, you have to get your ice, breakfast, and any "special" request needs from the main hotel.  One of the greatest highlights was the breakfasts cooked by Janie. My wife stated she would move in permanently just for that. Janie's cooking was very impressive, and her demeanor was fantastic; customer service at its finest. This is not your ordinary "free" hotel breakfast. The location of the Beach House and the Gardens is perfect. You are a five minute drive to down town and 15 minutes to Saint Augustine Beach. The Publix supermarket, restaurants, fishing pier and of course, the beach are in walking distance (5 minutes or less) from either locations. We were able to receive decent rates for our stay. There are cheaper hotels in the area that accommodate  pets, but this was by far the best bang for our buck.Absolutely beautiful location.My husband, mother and I drove over for the weekend with our two dachshunds. I was in the market for a beautiful view of the beach (for my mom, who was visiting from MO) and a pet friendly hotel that wouldn't give everybody fleas. I can ABSOLUTELY recommend the St. Augustine Beach House for all of the above. The rooms were spacious, clean, beautifully remodeled and had a stunning view of the beach. After checking me in, the receptionist walked me to the door and gave a short tour of the room. The staff was super friendly and eager to recommend pet friendly restaurants in the Vilano Beach area or the Historic District. Apparently we now get an additional discount on all of our return visits. I would absolutely stay here again.RIGHT on the beach! They love my doggies. Rooms are gorgeous. Love, love, love this place.Good location but very disappointing otherwise.  3rd rate hotel.  Water smells funny.  Cheap decor.  Cheap towels.  No real soap/shampoo, etc.  Plus housekeeping and breakfast service are terrible.I almost don't want to give the secret away! This hotel was perfect for us. We were able to bring out dog for a great pet fee. We were right on the beach too! I loved the balcony. We had a kitchenette and pull out couch too. Our air conditioner was acting strange and kept kicking on and off all night but I think there was a power outage to blame. We were super bummed that every time we needed ice- there was none. Our fridge wasn't cold when we got there so we had to buy our own ice at the Publix. Which is within walking distance. We were close enough to the sites to enjoy them but still had a beach view. I loved this. The breakfast wasn't too good- eggos, bagels, toast, eggs, oatmeal, cereal, pretty much it. Still glad they offered it though. I am 100% sure we will be back.Perfect location on the beach and welcoming my paw friends make this top on my list. Not to mention the friendliest, people pleasers staff ever.  They hustle here to take care of you, unlike your normal chain hotel.No breakfast but they have coffee and a kitchenette. Just steps away is great breakfast and lunch cafe.Decor is not up to date but you don't care because it is clean, private balconies you do not have to see your neighbor, rooms are big, guess they use to be condos. New owners are slowly fixing the place up and you can tell it is loved and well maintained. I am so thrilled to find this place and will def return with my furry babies.This is definitely one of the best places to stay in saint augustine. From the moment we checked in the staff was more than friendly and helpful. I really have nothing negative to say. The decor is modern, there's a kitchenette, the view is magnificent, I have direct access to the beach, and our dog was welcomed with open arms. Oh and might I add location, location, location! Easy access to everything and there's a publix just a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Needless to say we will never stay anywhere else whole visiting saint augustine.My husband, son and I stayed here for a night and wish we could have stayed there more nights but had a rental property waiting for us on the west coast of Florida. The people than run this beachfront property are friendly and accommodating. The rooms are clean, spacious and all have balconies looking out to Vilano Beach. It is an easy drive to downtown Saint Augustine and has other amenities in walking distance, including a Publix grocery store, salon and shops. I unfortunately picked up a few things from Publix, not realizing that the hotel had complimentary breakfast. The hotel's food smelled so good and the staff even asked if we would like the breakfast to go as we continued our drive. We'd love to stay here again in the future and hope we can take our dog with us next time. He'd also love it there and to play on the beach. Free wifi and parking are extra nice touches. Looking forward to returning!My wife and I stayed there for a week on a business trip. Hospitality of staff is like family. Rooms are spacious, clean, comfortable and very usable. Breakfast was fresh cooked each day (we only ate the last day but had fresh quiche, freshly baked pumpkin bread, fresh/hot raspberry muffins and tasty hot sausage). Great for hitting the road on a long drive home. WiFi worked great. We had a kitchenette. Our needs were simple so we were satisfied. Don't know if dishes are provided. Quiet, right on the beach (no buildings between the hotel and the water but there is a wide swath of grasses/natural area between the hotel and the water/sand). It is a beach that you can drive on and we saw vehicles there at all hours but they were completely quiet and non-intrusive. Pricey since there was a kitchen. But we were willing to pay since it was on the water. We are easy to please because we want to be. This hotel is awesome and we will stay there every year we go back for seminars.One of my favorite places to stay for vacation. People here are very friendly and hospitable. It's always a very relaxing vacation when we stay here.Exactly what we were looking for in a short weekend trip to beautiful St. Augustine.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The location is superb, if you aren't looking to stay in old town St Augustine, yet is only a 5 minute drive across the bridge.  The hotel is directly on a beautiful beach with plenty of access and all of the rooms facing the ocean with a small private balcony.  Rooms are large and simple.  There was a small continental breakfast as well.  The hotel is very pet friendly - no restrictions - and you can walk your leashed dog on the beach.  The hotel and rooms are not especially fancy if that is what you are looking for, but perfect if you want a quiet location on the beach with very very friendly and helpful staff.  I had not one complaint which is why this hotel gets a five star rating from me.

Absolutely amazing. My Fiance  and I have a new tradition.  . The family is by far the sweetest and most lovely and accommodating I've ever experienced... can't wait to be back next year. Thanks again for the love and hugs xoxoMy husband and I just returned from a three day stay in St. Augustine.  When I was looking on the internet for a place to stay I chose Penny Farthing for the Victorian decor and the reasonable price.  I could not be happier!!!  The B&B was quaint, quiet,  and in a great location.  We were greeted like old friends!!  The room was all that was described on the web site and then some.  So very comfortable and so very clean!  Each breakfast was amazing and was served so very promptly.  I loved the fact that we had access to the dining area during the evening for tea.  We even had complimentary brandy in our room!  I cannot say enough about how wonderful and pleasant the owners and the staff were.  I have stayed in many, many hotels, motels, and B&B's in my day and never was I hugged upon leaving.  That is just how genuine and nice these people are.Fantastic stay!  We loved hanging out on the deck with a glass of wine and hot, fresh scones and cookies and - oh, the amazing, delicious breakfasts!   The best Innkeepers any where in the world!  So warm and gracious. Perfect location to walk anywhere.  Thank you for an unforgettable birthday!Was greeted by Marie when we arrived. She was so gracious and welcoming.  We were immediately offered refreshments and wine! The home is Victorian style. If you're an Anglophile you will love it!We stayed in The Buckingham Room. Very cozy and private.Breakfast in the morning was Eggs Benedict, my favorite! They were fresh and delicious! And served promptly when we sat down. I would highly recommend Penny Farthing for a stay in St Augustine!My fiancee and I decided to spend my birthday in St. Augustine. We found The Penny Farthing Bed and Breakfast Inn to be very quaint and cozy. Our hosts, were very nice and accommodating.  Marie went out of her way to make breakfast for us as we have specific food allergies. It is within walking distance to the historical downtown area and there is plenty of parking. Our room was great and very comfortable. We had a fantastic time and we will definitely stay at the Penny Farthing on our next visit!We stayed in the York room which I found elegant.  It wasn't in the main part of the house but off the patio.  We found it quiet enough although the walls seemed thin in the bathroom.  Overall, it seemed private enough even with the French doors.The host had British hospitality.  I enjoyed the Benedict breakfast and the wine that was setup in the afternoon to sip on at leisure.  I thought the local handmade soap was a nice accent.The location was great.  It was within a nice walking distance of the hubbub of old town but enough off the beaten path for relaxation.We really enjoyed our stay here. We went for a Friday / Saturday night stay during the Night of Lights. The house was beautifully decorated for Christmas. There is hot water for tea 24/7, and a really nice snack display in the afternoon with cake, fresh vegetables, and cheese and crackers. Wine is also available from the afternoon into the evening. Every room has two small glasses and some sherry in a beautiful glass decanter. All of the owners and staff were friendly and suggested local places for drinks and food. They also let me bring a breakfast tray upstairs to my husband one morning because he wasn't feeling good. Breakfast was excellent both days. The first day was bread pudding with a piece of sausage and a yogurt parfait. The second day was sausage quiche with potatoes and fresh fruit.We stayed in the Victoria room. It has it's own private balcony with two rocking chairs and a hammock. We liked sitting out here and listening to the church bells. You can also see the towers of the Lightner museum from this room, but the immediate street view is of an office building. The room was mostly clean, but unfortunately there was some dust in the corners and on the baseboards and the walls had small holes every so often where a picture or something else once was there. The wallpaper really needed to be updated. Also, there were a lot of knickknacks on the tables in the room which made it difficult for me to lay out my things. These things are small, and while they would by no means prevent me from returning to the Penny Farthing Inn they did detract from the overall appeal of the room.Was a nice weekend at the inn.  Nice food and nice afternoon wine and snack hour.  The hosts were great and the place is very quiet at night.Me and my girlfriend went to the Penny Farthing Inn for my birthday weekend.  The house is very nice and comfortable, and the staff is very friendly and welcoming!  The room we stayed in was very comfortable, including a fireplace for cooler nights.  The breakfasts were consistently delicious, and the atmosphere was always very friendly.  We are definitely thinking of coming back in the future!This place is WONDERFUL!  It reminded us of the B & B we stayed at in England.  We arrived a little before check in time and when we called, we received a call right back that Marie was on her way to let us in.  Since there is ample outdoor furniture, we were able to use our computers and wait right on the front patio. Marie gave us a tour of the place, offered us a movie from a large selection of DVD and games and then we met more of her hospitable family every time we were in the common areas.  The room itself was LOVELY!  We stayed in the tree house and I highly recommend it if you want something romantic.  We sat out on our private balcony in the evening and enjoyed the thunderstorm. There was wine and snacks and cookies available all afternoon as well as hot tea to stay or to go.  In the morning, they accommodated food allergies and made a delicious breakfast.  I can't say enough great things about this place and the hospitality.  They literally have everything you would need an go above and beyond.  We will be staying here anytime we are passing though.  We loved it!What a perfect gem situated out of the midst of chaos, to enjoy quiet relaxing evenings on one of the many porches, yet close enough to walking distance to everything wonderful St. Augustine has to offer. The rooms were charming and decorated with period Victorian antique furniture, taking one back to an era long gone. The wine and desserts offered in the afternoons, and the amazing breakfast served in the morning are just a couple of examples of the many special touches that made our stay so enjoyable. This being said, the staff Dave and Betty, (Marie, who we unfortunately didn't get the pleasure of meeting) truly made our stay from the level of just another place to sleep, to a personal welcoming environment, where from the first moment we arrived, we felt more like returning long time friends, and not just another guest passing through. I highly recommend.Charming, comfortable ,clean and very welcoming. Penny Farthing Inn was a pleasure to stay in. We stayed in Penny's Attic and The Buckingham and both were decorated nicely and well kept, but what will truly make me return is the family that runs this B&B. Matthew is friendly,polite and genuine in making sure you feel welcome. Marie was sweet, accommodating and warm. We felt as though we were visiting family. The house is large with a lovely front porch and a spacious patio deck as the common outdoor eating area in the back. There are jasmine vines that decorate the lattices and each table is covered with linen and fresh flowers in very pretty tea cups. The ambiance is relaxing and casual. I could've stayed in the B&B alone without sightseeing the town and have been perfectly content.The place is so charming and romantic. Each room is supplied with some nice English sherry, and if that is now enough, you can go downstairs for a cup of tea, a glass of whine,or port. The owner is incredibly sweet. I felt like I was visiting England, really. The location is very good, right in the old town area. Breakfast is incredibly delightful..The bathroom had a jacuzzi and was very spacious, huge pillow-drowned bed...and some nice DVDs to watch.Check out my pics. of the rooms...We stayed at "The Dawn".We just got back from a relaxing long weekend at the Penny Farthing, Marie and family made us feel at home and we really enjoyed our stay. Our room, The York, was the smallest, but perfect for just the two of us. The bathroom was really quite large complete with a jacuzzi tub. Right outside of the York is the common deck, but we were frequently the only ones out there sipping on wine or reading a book. After trekking all over town in the mornings it was nice to come back in the afternoons, sit out on the deck and enjoy some of the wine and snacks set out.The location was perfect, close enough to the main attractions that we never used our car.Breakfast, was delightful. Eggs Benedict, french toast, and quiche on the three days we were there. It was hard coming home to just yogurt. We would be so full that for lunch we ended up just grabbing a sandwich to split at a deli so we could still have room for dinner.I can't say enough great things about my first B&B experience.This is a great little bed n' breakfast in St. Augustine. It's just a block or two west of the tourist hubs, which means you don't feel overwhelmed by the writhing masses of poorly-dressed humanity, nor do you feel like you'll have to walk forever in the searing Florida heat to reach them. The owners are very nice and accommodating people with delightful attitudes and accents. We had two very tasty breakfasts there, even though they tried to sneak ham into my croissant (I'm a vegetarian) on the first day. Luckily, my fiancee spotted it just in time, selflessly devouring it before I could. She's so thoughtful.We stayed in the 'Dawn' room, which comes with its own little balcony area with a cute little swinging bench and chairs. It's beautiful, really. What makes it even better is that swing is where I proposed to the love of my life (she said 'yes,' of course, which is why this review is positive and upbeat, rather than deranged howling). The room itself has a nice whirlpool bathtub which we filled with an ungodly amount of bubbles, as required by the Cliched Tourist Mistakes guidebook we follow religiously. There's also a lot of cute knick-knacks and paintings and such. It really feels like a home, rather than an impersonal cookie-cutter suite.Food's tasty, people are nice, rooms are pretty, location is perfect. What more do you want? Go take a romantic vacation already.I agree with everyone who wrote previously. Dave and Marie are amazing and so is everyone else who worked here.   The breakfast was amazing, the Attic was wonderful, and we extended our stay an extra night. Dave and Marie have so many touches that added to our stay. The journal in the attic is so romantic and amazing (leave it for others to enjoy). Ask about the military men in the attic. They have quite the history. The jacuzzi really helped us both unwind. They offer advice on places to go and things to see. We hadn't stayed at a b&b before and thoroughly enjoyed it. We felt like family. We will definitely return to st Augustine and the penny farthing.Very nice place, girly/romantic, close to shops and historical sites.  Breakfast was very nice and they leave out wine, sherry, and tea at all times, coffee and orange juice in the morning.  Nice DVD collection as well.I second the first review. Our family took up two rooms for two nights. We loved the location which was just near enough but not on top of the noisiest areas. The owners are extremely attentive and concerned with your comfort. The shabby chic vintage charm is excellent and it's a lovely respite after a long walking day. If you don't mind steps, Penny's attic room is tops. It's literally a little private apartment with a huge modern walk-in shower as well as a jetted tub and a private crows nest type porch with a covered spot. They offer a lovely breakfast but if it's not for you they will cook up something more ordinary. Coffee, tea, wine and sherry are always around for your enjoyment. You bet this will be our St. Augustine B&B.Our family weekend was filled with many activities including a most important graduation from Flager College.  We chose a bed and breakfast, and most particularily Penny Farthing Inn with a roof top deck for entertaining, because we wanted all the comforts of home.  Oh my goodness, what a disappointment!  We prearranged to have the key in the room because of our late arrival (yes, we missed the afternoon cocktail party), but we arrived around six with no greeting from our hostess who was fully informed that we would have been traveling all day.  No one was there to greet us and provide information about our stay...there wasn't even a fruit basket or a plate of cookies in our suite.  The lack of hospitality continued when we were informed by phone that breakfast was served no earlier than 9 AM and there would be no accommodations for anything at our 8 AM departure for the graduation event.  When we arrived back at the Inn with our guests for our roof top luncheon, we discovered to our dismay that the room had not been attended...the bed was unmade, used towels were in the bath (but there was an tip envelope from the maid).  Also, seating was sparse because the cushions had not been placed on much of the outdoor furniture.  When we inquired about this later, the owner just laughed and said that the maid must have simply missed us.I must mention that our shower was ill-equipped as well...we found no bath products save a couple of bars of soap and samples of shampoo and conditioner encased in cardboard.Although others were in the dining room on the morning of our 8:30 AM departure, we were only able to get a cup of coffee in to-go cups with somewhat of a "rush" out the door (Could she have been expecting a request for monetary compensation???)I wrote to the Penny Farthing Inn when I returned home to discuss my disappointment, but am still waiting for a reply.  Such hospitality!!!I cannot fathom why anyone would want to pay a premium price for such a lack of accommodations.This is a wonderful little Bed & Breakfast next to the Lightner Museum.  You can park your car behind the house and walk for the remainder of your stay.  The owners are friendly and cook a mean breakfast - we had amazing croissants and fresh fruit when we stayed there.  There is also a tray set up in the common area with several bottles of wine for your enjoyment.  I stayed in "The Dawn" with its own private entrance from the porch.  The room was cozy and we loved the added privacy of the separate entrance.  The Penny Farthing Inn is one block from King Street in the heart of the historic district.  I loved being able to wander through the streets as we were so close to everything.  They also offer romantic packages for an extra charge.  My husband surprised me with wine, roses, chocolate-covered strawberries and a carriage ride through town (all included in their romance package).  The Penny Farthing is also reasonably priced and they offer great specials.  When we went we paid for Friday and Saturday and got Thursday for 1/2 price.  It was a great vacation and the next time we go back, we'll definitely stay there.

hotel_name: Castillo Real, an Ascend Hotel Collection Member
review_content: I loved my stay here. Perfect location. Steps away from the beach as well as restaurants and shopping. The bed was very comfortable and the facility was very clean. I also loved having the option of going in the outside pool and hot tub.Great location and the price was reasonable.  Service was great!I love this hotel.  It has character and is decorated in a manner consistent with St. Augustine's flair.  Got a call from the front desk while we were en route, letting us know our rooms were ready.  For a small fee you can upgrade to a room with a Jacuzzi which is well worth it.  Nice touches at the reception area: water with lemon and coffee.  Pleased.An excellent hotel, beach just a short walk away.  Loved everything about it. Stayed during January, rates more than reasonable.  Nicely decorated, lots of marble and tile.  extra clean and neat.  Comfortable beds.  Large walk in shower, a sit down vanity with make up mirror.  Great pool!  A little touch that strangely, I really liked:  ceramic coffee mugs and real glasses in the room.  There is an excellent restaurant on premises, that i would rate $$$,  You can get a great breakfast for $7.50 to $9; drinks a couple bucks more, mimosas  $5.My wife booked this hotel for us and she made a great choice.  Our room had an in room jacuzzi. Nice way to relax after a long day at the beach. On premises restaurant was great too. Would definitely  recommend to friends.Ocean views from our room. less than 1 block from the beach which is sooo wide and nice. La Cochina restaurant is excellent. other bar/restaurants within walking distance. Best part for us is the hotel is a stop for the Saint Augustine Beach Bus that runs hourly and drops passengers off at different points including the lighthouse, alligator farm, and downtown Saint Augustine 20 min away. We really didn't need a rental car for this trip. I would definitely come back.Traveling to St. Augustine was really awesome for us being from Orlando because it is a short drive for a mini weekend get away. This hotel is small and very hospitable. The room was very clean and the view was nice. Close to the beach, the only down side for me was they charge $25/per person to ride a shuttle to downtown. Driving downtown is NOT AN OPTION. NO parking and very crowded. A shuttle is the way to go but not for $50 for a couple.Horrible experience.  Front desk staff not friendly and rude manager.  Dirty carpet. They charged me $40 for an early check in, I was suposed stay for 2 nights but I had to leave on day 2. It was around 1:00 pm and I asked to give me a credit or partial credit for another visit. They totally denied and charged me full price for the second night.  I paid with my credit card at the restaurant but I have a charge or $45 from the restaurant and $1 on phone (i didn't use the phone other than calling the front desk) So I ended paying $469 for one night stay. The manager has no sense of business as u explained to her that my was a business visit and I'm planning on staying one or two nights every other month. First and last time here! The highly of the hotel is the night front desk lady Lauren. Also the hotel restaurant is amazing!Purchased this hotel on an express deal, which doesn't give you the name til after payment. The hotel is a 3 star, so it is a bit nicer than many of your standard choice hotels- has stone flooring and a cozy bed. LOVED the plush floor mat in the bathroom. The location served me well and is close to the beach.The bad: VERY noisy, perhaps the most noise of any hotel I've been in. C'mon you really shouldn't be able to hear the full conversations coming from the next room. Also, minor oversights in the bathroom with some hair on the floor and in the shower.This hotel is a nice alternative to the rental condos up and down the beach. I've never been one to want to stay in someone else's place on vacation (I always turn down relatives' offers to crash at their place) as I just really enjoy the whole hotel experience when traveling. I searched high and low for a nice and affordable real hotel on the beach and found Castillo Real. The hotel itself is pretty nice. It's a beach hotel and not super classy, but the rooms were big, the bathrooms were huge with a ton of counter space (which comes in handy when the two of you are trying to get ready-they even have a nice vanity mirror for the ladies), the shower was roomy, and the staff were all very nice. My only gripe is that the inner window curtains are sheer and the outer ones don't come together. Sooooo you get light in your room the entire night from the parking lot, moon. Whatever.  We used my hair clips to hold the drapes together so we could get some sleep. I'd go back of I were in St. Aug again. I just have to remember to bring my hair clips.Definitely enjoyed my stay here! The place was steps from the beach. The front desk lady.. Which I've forgotten her name... She was so nice, so pleasant, and so helpful! The rooms were clean, the shower was huge, and the decor was different from their usual hotels. We loved it and would def stay again!If you book through priceline beware, priceline literally ripped me off for $ 460.00. Please don't trust the priceline and buy a room directly. Priceline has booked me for two rooms but only one was available. So five of us (2 couples and a kid) are stuck in one room with one bed and no refund for two nights. Please just reserve withouy priceline if you can. We contacted and they refuse to refund a cent, avoid PRICELINE at all costs.The Castillo Real has improved quite a bit since we last stayed there two years ago.  The WIFI worked perfectly and so did the fridg.  The receptionist was very friendly and provided us with pertinent info about the hotel.Although the hotel has a breakfast, you must make your selection from a list and purchase a voucher the evening before.  I don't know if I feel like french toast or pancakes until I get up in the morning.  No thanks on that.The beach is just a few minutes walk behind the hotel.
