We enjoyed our visit, and we will plan on staying here the next time we are in the area.If you are looking for a romantic getaway, this is a place to go. The jacuzzi suites are fantastic, big, clean and affordable. The walk to the beach is literally half a block off the white-sanded and pristine St Augustine coast line. The staff was super kind, friendly and helpful making sure my 5 year anniversary was as an unforgettable experience. I think they just found themselves a new loyal costumer ;-)The only downside I see to this awesome place is the service of the restaurant downstairs. They are on the rude side with overpriced/limited food choices. With good reason Castillo Real staff makes sure to let you know that they are not by any means associated.This place really was excellent. Super clean, beautiful views, very quaint, would stay again next time we visit!Castllio Real is my wife and myself's go to weekend get away place and has been for the last 10 years or so. We really enjoy relaxing on the beach and by the pool and hot tub. The restaurant is really first class, with excellent selections and fantastic deserts. We come down here 3 to 4 times a year and totally enjoy our visits. So I highly recommend Castllio Real as a Prime place to stay when you're in the St Augustine area.I LOVED this hotel! Our room was huge! Plenty of room for our family of four (2 queen beds). We had plenty of floor space, plus a desk and a table and 2 chairs. There was a nice tiled area when you walk in where you could leave all your sandy shoes and bathing suit stuff. The bathroom had a huge walk-in shower, and a separate vanity area that was large with lots of counter space. The staff was super nice and helpful. This hotel isn't ocean-front, but is a short walk to the beach. I really can't think of anything bad to say about this place! We will stay here the next time we are in St. Augustine!We had a great stay at this hotel.   The room was very clean and nicely updated.   I haven't slept that good in a long time thanks to the comfortable mattress and bedding.   Pool was small but nice.   Location was excellent.   We did eat at the hotel and although not included in stay was amazing.  Staff was very personable and accommodating.   Would absolutely stay here again.I stayed here 3 1/2 years ago, but it was such a great hotel that I thought it should be mentioned here. Great customer service, clean rooms, nice amenities  -- A bit pricey, but well worth the price. This is a great place for a honeymoon or romantic getaway. If you have a big family vacation, however, you might want to stay at a cheaper hotel. And the only thing that I did not like was that the hotel was somewhat a drive from downtown St. Augustine.Clean rooms, friendly service, and nice amenities (fridge, cable, small gym & spa). Very close to everything I needed to get to while on a trip visiting family in the area.Didn't get a chance to try the restaurant, but heard great things.
review_content_20: Great and beautiful place to stay, great staff and big and comfortable rooms. Great for romantic get aways.On the same block as the beach (not beachfront, but you don't have to cross any streets to get there) and walking distance to many restaurants and shops.  Great place to bring the family.  The rooms and common areas are all marble floors, columns, etc.  Very elegant look to it.  My family and I had a great time.  Comfortably fit the 5 of us (although one is still in a crib).  BTW, for Active Duty Military, they offer the government official travel rate even if you're there for liesure.  (Only cost us $95/night when we were there.)  We will definitely be going back!  The WiFi must've been fixed since last year's reviewer complained, because it was strong and certainly available in our room.Very nice and clean room. Everything you would need for a comfortable enjoyable stay. I did not find one thing wrong. Free WiFi worked great. Loved the complementary toiletries. They were higher quality than I have seen in a hotel room. Very close to beach. Convenient and plentiful parking. Complimentary coffee in the lobby. Very nice workout room with stem room and sauna. We would definitely return when we visit this area again.

review_content: I'm amazed at how friendly Mark at the front desk was to me and my four year old son. He showed us the room and showed me the room to see if my wheelchair would fit in the bathroom and was accepting to my service dog I showed him his papers and it was painless. The hotel across the street was very rude to me and made me feel bad about being handicapped . I would suggest this hotel to any of my family and friend it was spacious and clean . Staff was friendly too ! if I had to stay across the street and see how much fun they where having at the quality inn I would have been very upset at my self for spending more money to be treated poorly ! Thanks quality inn for making us feel good in Saint Augistine we love it here. Satisfied customerNot horrible, good and cheap, one of the online sites had it listed as a 3 star which its it allNever again this "Hotel" Motel ?? Front desk rude. Almost kick me out because i told them that the rooms are dirty and stinky like bleach and old shoes . A/C with dirty filter . And price ? 190$ a nite ?? YES A NITE :)) .. bathroom dirty never put my foot in . I bet if u will come with black light here your eyes will cry :)I've stayed in a lot of dives but this one takes the cake. Dirty everything. A bad attempt at an updated look using thrift store decor. Went to get breakfast at 8:30 am, got my eggs and sausage but by the time I made it around to the bread the staff was packing it up. There were still people eating but I guess the management didn't want people to have time for seconds. The only good thing was the location, walking distance to the beach.We chose this place bc of the low rate so we didn't expect much. We got even less. The pictures on the web site were misleading. The hotel is a half mile from the beach, not on the beach as the website reports. The room was clean enough but the carpet was decades overdue for replacement. And, the front desk staff was rude. Two staffers on two different occasions seemed bothered bc we were there and were curt with answers.DO NOT, DO NOT, DO NOTTT STAY HERE!!!!!!! THIEVES - THIEVES - THIEVES!!!!! I'll get to that later. The only reason I gave 1 star is because I can't proceed with this review without awarding something. I'm not really overly-picky about my hotel choice usually. Give me a clean room, A/C that works, a decent price, and customer service that acts appreciative that you're there. Wow - not even close.....at least the A/C worked (ok, there's the 1 star). The kicker: upon returning from the day and after getting ready to go out that night, I went to put on my nice watch, which I had packed away in my bag. But it was gone - stolen - along with my Bluetooth headset that I had "hidden" together. The friggin maid(s) had gotten IN MY BAG and stole them!! Are you kidding me? Just to be sure, I tore the room apart looking everywhere in case I was mistaken. Bags, closet, bathroom, under beds, under sofa, in the bed sheets, trash cans, in my vehicle....STOLEN.Management was absolutely no help and cared little as he told me all his people had been with him for 10+ years (the 2 girls he asked about seeing a watch were 22/25 years old - what? They'd been with him since they were 12?? Lies). Police told me later that that particular hotel contracts out the maid service. So since they're not hired by Quality Inn, those particular maids may only show up once or twice a week or less. Hmm, they've "been with you 10 years"??When I informed him that I was going to file a police report he was panicked and indignant. "I have no one here who steals - we turn everything in that's found - we ship it to you UPS - there's no need for police...blah, blah, blah.... All lies because the Officer who came and took my report said straight-up, "This is the #1 hotel we have the most complaints from and have to come to". Wish I'd known that little tidbit before booking. I will sleep on a park bench before I stay at this dump again. In case you missed me saying it earlier, DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!We wanted a cheap place on the beach, and this Quality Inn is a national brand located across the street from the beach. But it is pretty much a horrible place.The only positives are there's ample parking, the pool has a hot tub, and the tv's are updated. Negatives:The feel of a tawdry motel circa 1960.Very dirty.Smells like cheap air freshener.Itchy beds.Gross bathrooms with weird low ceilings.No water pressure.Old towels.Grungy carpet.Musty odor.Poor lighting.There are lots of hotels in saint aug. This one is terrible.DO NOT STAY HERE - SAVE YOURSELF THE TROUBLE!! Ok, so it might be a little cheaper than some of the other places astound the area and you may not "require" much to make you happy when it comes to your choice in hotels. However, my boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights and after the first day of the maids coming in to clean the room, we discovered his nice, silver watch had been stolen along with LG Bluetooth headset. Not only was it stolen, but it was taken OUT OF HIS BAG where he hid it before we left that morning for the beach. It's bad enough when something of yours is stolen, but knowing your personal belongings have been looked through by strangers is disturbing. Management was notified and his aloof and flippant attitude was disrespectful, especially after he told us, "it could have just fallen in the trash," after we knew he had hidden them in his bag before we left. You might be saving a few bucks by staying here but you're not saving yourself. Spend the extra money on a nicer hotel with better standards.I booked this hotel for the 4th of July and Was a little hesitant after reading the reviews . Decided to give it a try anyway. Everything was fine. We were traveling with 2 dogs and were looking for something close to the beach for a reasonable price and pet friendly. There was a huge side yard to take the dogs out, friendly staff, across the street from the beach, and free breakfast. rooms weren't fancy but were clean and hand a flat screen TV , refrigerator, and microwave. This hotel is great for what you pay for. When booking you know it isn't a 5star hotel so I felt like some of the reviews are unfair. Would definitely stay here again.HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE! I paid $100 for one night here and couldn't believe how bad this place was. The Motel 6 or Super 8 would have been better. The first room they gave us hadn't been cleaned and once we saw it we decided not to stay here and expose our young children to this place.The managers could care less and similarly to other reviews, just get offended that you complained and tell you that you might as well stay because you purchased a non-refundable room. The manager could not believe that I would rather forfeit my $100 than stay here and I told her that I would rather sleep in my car at a rest stop then here. Also, she couldn't check me out until the next day in her system, so I got no record that I was officially checked out and wouldn't be surprised if I got charged an incidental fee for a room I never even stepped in to. I called the next morning to verify that I had in fact been checked out.DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! In fact, DO NOT STAY ANYWHERE at St. Augustine Beach that is less than 3 stars. The 2.5 star rating may as well be a 1 star in this area. Go for paying a bit more and actually feeling safe and being able to enjoy your stay.This property is a WRETCHED MESS! Try the Best Western down the street instead! It's clean, well maintain a just a few dollars more.The only reason I gave it 1 star is that I had to give it something. That said, I will never stay here, nor would I recommend it to friend or foe. After checking in, I saw 5 rooms, which all had mold & mildew in the grout & caulk around the tubs of each room. When I told the management I would not be staying, they repeatedly said that I might as well stay since I was going to pay for the room regardless of whether I stayed or not. I reiterated that I would not be staying & asked for a business card. I wasn't given one. I asked for a copy of the receipt in case I needed to dispute the charges. At this point, I was told that they only put an 'authorization hold' on my account that would be released the next day because they would annotate the record to indicate that I had not actually stayed at the property and that no actual charge would appear. I was told if I insisted on a receipt, they would actually process a charge, so I could choose to have a receipt & an actual charge on my account or wait for the hold to be released.My party & I found the last available room at the Best Western down the street. It was $25 per night more the room, but it was clean & well maintained.After I returned home, I called AAA & Comfort Inn corporate offices to let them know of my experience & the fact that I indeed had a authorization hold on my account. AAA sent me a complaint form to submit. Comfort Inn corporate took my Complaint over the phone & submitted it to the management of the Comfort Inn. The next day I checked my account & instead of the authorization hold, now there was a 'hard charge' so I called Comfort Inn corporate again & they said that the management of the property said that they were charging me for the room because we just decided not to stay there because we decided to stay at a less expensive property.I am not happy that the management of the property not only didn't maintain it, but gave me the run around after I tried in good faith to find a suitable room at their property. More than that, I feel that I was lied to regarding their ability to reverse the charges or not impose charges on my account. Finally the fact that they lied to corporate & responded that I just decided not to stay so I could get a cheaper room when that was not true infuriates me.The only 'good' note regarding this experience is that true to their word, the Comfort Inn corporate office has issued a refund after I sent them a detailed letter along with a copy of the charge from my bank, as well as a copy of my receipt showing I stayed at a more expensive property down the street.This is where we're been staying while visiting Florida with cheap ass Skybus tickets. While it's nothing fancy, it fits the needs. Close to the beach? Oh, yeah! Close to downtown. Moderately. Close to the only Starbucks? It's right down the block.St. Augustine is severely lacking in having any decent resorts (the only one is a golf resort) and we ended up getting a really cheap deal via Priceline for this location. It's been well worth it. It looks as if it has been recently "updated", because "renovated" isn't the correct word. The bedding all looks really new, the bathroom has a fresh coat of paint, and everything functions really well. The pool is really simple, and the hot tub perfectly warm.While not having any really negative interactions with the staff, I'd hardly consider the customer service great, or even really good. The continental breakfast is decent, and the coffee was really fresh. I'd stay here again if the price was right, but I do like slightly more luxurious accommodations.I gave this place 2 stars for only one reason. They are close to the beach and the AC works well and the bed was comfortable, and the price was acceptable at 59 dollars. Now the rest of the review. I checked in late around midnight. At that point you just want to crash and watch TV. I got in my room and the first thing that went wrong is no matter what the 90's style Tube TV would not tune in any stations. After 15 minutes of dickering with it I gave up. Called the front desk and they switched me which I hate doing that late! Got in my next room and like the first one it had a funky smell. The room is not modern. The fridge did not work. The kitchen area was old and dirty!! I don't care as I did not use it. I asked for extended check out and they said no you must check out at 11AM or incur 10 dollars an hour more for each hour after that. I surfed the net which worked okay and went to bed watching HBO which was a plus. The only station with no interference. Got up and had breakfast. They had scrambled eggs and sausage. Eggs did not taste like real eggs and were cold so were the sausage. Orange juice was not sweet and had to dump it. Apple juice and coffee were okay. Made a waffle that was good. One redeeming thing is they extended my check out to 12:30 at no charge as I am a Choice Privileges member. Speaking of which they had no free paper for me. I did not use the pool but it looked okay but very small. My advice stay inland in a better hotel and drive to St. Augustine!!!!! By the way, this is not a hotel. It has all exterior rooms and exterior entrances. I am a choice rewards member and they did not give me credit for the stay. What a joke. They say my rate was low so it does not count. I will stay with Country Inn and Suites better chain or Days Inn!!!! They let every stay count!!!!Lucky I am giving 1 star! This place hasn't been thoroughly cleaned or renovated since the 80's. Leaking ac in room, so wet stinky carpet. Electrical outlet that is black and sparks. No working laundry machines, which we were counting on because it was listed on website. Rude night manager, Raj , throws people out for complaining! Don't stay here!1. So I check in around 8pm at comfort in at st augustine beach cuz i wanted a scenic view and they try to charge me. I had to provide documentation to show room was booked and paid in advance through hotel.com.2. I called front desk for number to closest pizza and Chinese delivery place. The Chinese place was closed for renovations and pizza place confirmed my payment info but didn't parrot back delivery address so pizza never came. I had to go food hunting after 10pm.3. Small fridge in room no microwave to warm up left overs.4. Time to upgrade to flat screen TV. Tube TVs are out.5. I come back after a busy day in saint Augustine only to find my room unlocked. Called management saying wtf? A six year employee and business veteran thought its ok to leave door unlocked while she washes my sheets. 6. Windows blinds open iPod, and iPad in plain site for all to see.7. Would I go back to comfort inn? Hell to the no. The price is not worth compromised security.

People are way to hard on the ratings. I completely understand that at a hotel or resort hotel you want what you want and you deserve it. However you have to consider what you are paying and the location. Could this hotel be a lot better with the right group of people providing excellent customer service? Yes!I stayed right after Labor Day weekend. September 7-14th paying about $630 for a partial ocean view all seven nights. That's pretty damn cheap. One of the cheapest places to stay in the St Augustine area. On arrival I was told that I would have to wait because the room wasn't yet ready. A short 5 minutes later it was ready.After a couple hours the room was still not cooling so I called the engineering department to come take a look at the A/C unit. He was able to replace, yes replace, the unit with a working one in under 20 minutes.The room was clean. The door to the balcony was a little stiff and hard to close. ( It's a hotel, by the salt water and sand- for everyone's rust issues) I even saw that someone complained about the door to their balcony on the third floor wouldn't lock. (NINJAS) The linens are dated. Pillows dated. Beds dated. As I said before, clean though. Housekeeping staff that I encountered was nice. I was not impressed by the front desk staff at all. Huge let down. Impacted my review significantly.Elevators are ridiculous on the weekends if the hotel is full. They have a pool and tiki bar. Staff at the bar was great. Came around asking if everyone was in need of anything. Pool could have been cleaner. The towels by the pool should be large and comforting. Not small and thin. Ok. Let's rap this up. This place was super affordable! Great location. Clean rooms. Having worked in the hotel industry, I would recommend more team meetings and include additional training. With the right guidance a team should be able to make the stay behind a dumpster a fantastic experience. Overall I would definitely give this place another stay.The rooms stinks and very UNCLEAN and UNHYGIENIC.Had to book last minute and was happy to have a ocean / beach at walking distance.The moment I entered in the room, there was a stink and it was like pee. It seems the bathroom curtains have never been washed and the stink was unbearable. The toiletries and towel quality is really bad.The bed had all types of hair including PUBIC hair and it was GROSS. Tha carpet seemed never to be clean and impossible to walk bear foot.The only good thing about it was that the beach was at walk able distance. For $87 per night, this was really not commendable as its not a small amount.The room service was quick when asked for extra towels.The location and view was perfect. The gazebo and short walk to beach was so nice. The pool area was one of the nicest oceanfront I've seen and what appealed to my kids. They ended up not swimming because the pool was not heated and the water was FREEZING.  The ocean view rooms were very out dated...the bathroom especially. Noises don't bother me but may bother someone else this hotel seemed to have paper thin walls. I could hear walking, water running, showers, suitcases rolling across floor, our refrigerator made a knocking sound. Little things that are not a big deal and may just have been overlooked, there was no trash can in bathroom and the cleaning people didn't re-stock the coffee, cups, creamer for our second day. I know they are renovating so I would come back if the room was updated and in warmer weather when the  pool would be warmer.  Definitely 5 stars once it's updated!It's Ok. Just somewhere to spend the night. Very old hotel, a lot of construction going on. It does provide access to beach. Affordable.Kinda dumpy and room were being redone.  I would not pay summer or peak prices.  They said we had a partial view of the ocean -- yes leaning over the balcony!!The carpets were old and ripped and the cement floors were cracked.No "free" breakfast here!This was a last minute reservation for 2 nights.  Room was very clean, free internet worked great,  staff is polite, beds were really comfortable.   I brought my own pillow since the last hotel we stayed at in Ft. Lauderdale was so bad, I could not use the pillows....I did not even take it out of the car this time.  In room fridge, microwave, and coffee pot.   Love the "quiet hours" from 11 pm-8 am.  The only issue we had was the huge pot holes on the left side parking area, luckily we did not hit them.This hotel is ok. We booked it as a last minute get away online. The best thing the hotel has going for it is the location. The pool is okay sized- but freezing! But man oh man the ocean! It has a private entrance to the ocean which is a huge plus!Hotel: definitely outdated. BUT doable. Our AC worked well- shower was fine and towels ok quality. Nothing special here Tons if parking. Friendly staff. We didn't eat at the hotel so no comment there. All in all if you aren't looking for anything special this place will do just fine. It's about a 10-15 minute drive into the heart of St AugustineWe had a toilet over flow at 11pm and maintenance came within 5 minutes to fix.I should have read the reviews on here before I made reservations at Holiday Isles. This "motel" is a flee bag.  You will need to make sure you are up to date on your hepatitis and tetanus vaccines if you plan on staying here.  I feel lucky checking out without getting bed bugs or lice, or tetanus from this so called "resort". We got a "deal" on a room for 2 nights and that so called deal was $107 plus taxes and a 20$ pet fee.  This place is worth no more than $50 a night regardless if it is pet friendly or not.  We could not wait to leave this disgusting place.  Rust on all fixtures, rust on doors, peeling paint, scratched and rusty tubs, tiles not clean, air conditioner rusty and falling out of the wall, the list can go on and on.  Do yourself a favor and drive past this place!!I really enjoyed my stay here. Rates were great with the AAA discount. The rooms were very standard but they were clean and had everything we needed.i think we also had one of the updated ones as they had clean, white linens, large flatscreen, and granite counters in the bathroom. We got a partial ocean view room for about $80/night. Just steps from a great part of Saint Augustine Beach and only about a 10 minute drive to downtown Saint Augustine. Seriously can't beat that anywhere in the area. Honestly, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room anyway. The poolside bar had good drinks and food too. Only downside was the pool closes at dusk, which is around 6pm in November. That was kind of a bummer, but I would definitely stay here again if I'm in the area.$120/night for being on the beach isn't bad at all. A slow ice machine is the only complaint I had. The staff is friendly and my room was clean. I recently stayed at an oceanfront hotel for $320/night and it was disgusting and falling apart so I was very pleased with this hotel.My oh My where to begin? Shall we start with the VERY few goods? Okay so the shower water is Hot! So thats a plus..The pool is decent, but no hot tub..Easy access to the beach.AC in the room gets the room cold!Beds are comfortable Fun atmosphere in the pool areaOkay so here's where you really want to pay attention...This place is super run down! The shower is literally falling apart The hotel nickel and dimes you at every turn.. Want a fridge? Shell out an extra $11 per night.. Want breakfast? That will be $10 We had to wait Entirely too long for new towels to be delivered to our room, to the point we just didn't shower after getting in the pool, and went into town for dinner. Every time you go outside the doors lock behind you, so don't forget your key... Anyways.. If you're looking for a bare bones, no frills, lay your head down and get out hotel... This miight be for you. But even you could do better.  Good luck!Absolutely hideous. This "hotel" was a glorified motel at best. They proudly display their 1 AAA star on the counter. When we arrived the parking lot was completely empty, I went insideTo check in and there were no other guests in sight and the two ladies at theCounter didn't look up until I said "excuse me" . They checked me in and gave me a partial ocean view room which I paid 120$ for. We took the elevator up (which is in the back of the building) and the second I stepped in I wanted toThrow up!! It smelled like armpit and sewage in there!!!!! I held my breath every time I had to use the elevator! The room was okay very shabby oldFurniture dusty bed the door toThe balcony was very rusted and would barely open. No central AC just those small ones attached to the wall.Cheap towels and cheaper soap and the thinnest toilet paper imaginable. Rusty tub and shower head. This is all acceptable for a motel not an "oceanfront resort", so please get it together and either upgrade this place or callIt what it is, a motel, and don't you dare charge guests more than $50 a night.Stayed here for 2 days. Not the most impressive hotel I have stayed in BUT if you have a need for something, like light bulbs for your lamps or batteries for the TV remote control they are at your door within minutes. Check-in is at 4pm and the hotel is BUSY so you may NOT get into your room at 4. So don't show up at 1230 and start complaining at 405pm that your room is not ready. Just because you show up early doesn't mean we are going to start the party early Just For YOU! Laundry room had several washers and dryers.... Unfortunately only one dryer and one washer was working.I would give Holiday Isle 3 stars if we didn't have a serious issue with breakfast on our first morning. I think the cook may have either quit or left. Our waiter "bless his heart" was having a hard time keeping up with the 3 or 4 tables he had. We were there for about 1 1/2 hours. Food was cold, apple juice was watered down, our waiter didn't know how to make hot chocolate.  When I told the front desk about the problem in the kitchen they didn't seem t concerned. $40 bucks for a meal that was inedible just "ain't right"BUT it really is a short walk to the beach and right down the road is Salt Life restaurant that we went to twice!!! In the other direction is Publix and dunkin donuts.If you want a place that has no amenities this is your place! What was I thinking????Check in staff was great, the beach was perfect. The hotel does not look like the photos. It is old and run down, elevator was ridiculously slow, the stairs were creepy, the coffee pot broken and the outlet sparked when we plugged it in. There were power bars everywhere. The bathroom smelled sour. I felt I had to wear flip flops in the shower. We stayed one sleepless night. Thank goodness we found another place to stay.My fiance and I visited St.Augustine for a weekend staycation ( we're from the Orlando area). We arrived a little early and were pleasantly surprised when we were allowed to check in and landed an ocean front room! As the weekend went on, I found myself frustrated with certain details. First of all, what constitutes a "resort"? A poolside bar? The pool is alright. We had fun despite the fact that it is average sized and lacks a Jacuzzi. Not to mention the lack of a poolside bathroom! You're expected to walk to the lobby to use the restroom. You know what that means...more pee in the pool than usual! Sorry, but it's true. We were also excited for the live music in the"lounge", which turned out to be a joke. Friday night and it was absolutely empty. Downtown historic St.Augustine is about a 20 minute drive and that proved to be a good time. As far as the rooms go...they were average. Relatively clean despite the questionable body hairs found once the sheets were folded down. The elevator ( yes there's only one) is soooo slow! Also, even though we had an ocean front room, we were located right across from the ice machine ( which is in the hallway, not its own room) and it would wake us up at night and in the early morning. The paper thin walls also made afternoon naps impossible. Overall, we still had a good time. This place is ON the beach with direct access, so you're really paying for location. Just don't expect a resort experience.We stayed here from December 14th to December 16th 2014, booked thru Expedia, and got an amazing deal for our money. We didn't even needed to pay for the reservation, they took the reservation, and we paid with cash when we got there.The Hotel is located at an amazing spot, with private entrance to the beach. We got there, and the gentleman at the front desk told us they had upgraded up to a room with a refrigerator and a microwave. Woohoo!!! It was really cold to use the pool or the beach, but we did went for a walk at the beach with my husband, at night, and it was delightful. Can't wait until we get to comeback during the hot season!We all got to relax and enjoy the short stay, we took very hot baths, beds were super comfortable, good service, very clean. Overall, it's great for families that are on the go, and want a hotel that is clean and comfortable. Will be definitely staying there again next visit to St Augustine Beach.My first experience driving up to the hotel, we were not impressed with the outside view for the price that we paid. The parking area has a lot of holes that need to be fixed. We paid $170/night for an oceanfront room. Apparently, these are the most expensive rooms in the hotel. Why in the world would you put an ice machine and soda machine right in front of the rooms?... Every time someone came for ice or soda, of course, the noise would wake us up!!! If this sounds like an issue for you, you might wanna stay away from rooms 534/535 and the nearby rooms. Same on the rest of the floors, most likely. Floor 2 for sure. The bathroom we found to be clean, upgraded, although the floor looked disgusting in both bathroom and bedroom. Those carpets need some serious cleaning or better even a replacement!!! The towels are old and disgusting!!!!! The bottom of the bath tub was messed up, it was gray.The beds are comfortable but all the pillows in our room were about a foot long. Believe it or not! Our room came with a fridge that was rusted on top and hadn't been defrosted in a long time. Well, at least we had one. The elevators have got to be the slowest in the world!!!! Took us about 10 minutes at least to get in it and downstairs from the 5th floor. The ocean view was amazing, though. The only good thing. Although the balcony door was rusted. The tiki bar was not open once in the whole weekend, we assume due to the weather. And the pool looked very dirty. They bill you as soon as you check in and charge your card the full amount. Overall, this hotel needs some serious remodeling and upgrading. Definitely would not stay here again.I purchased a deal through LivingSocial for a weekend stay. Unfortunately I was very disappointed. The place is completely run down. The walls are entirely too thin!! I could hear people walking in the hall and people in the room next to me. I read a review that mentioned this prior to my stay and they were spot on. You don't really realize how extremely annoying it can be to hear other people's interactions until you experience it. And that I did! There was blonde hairs in the bed, that definitely didn't come from me! (Gross) And I suppose it's great for those with pets to come across a pet friendly hotel but walking through the halls with people and their large dogs wasn't very pleasant. Definitely wouldn't stay here again but the location was very convenient for the attractions that we visited.We stayed in the pool/ full ocean view               PROS:-beautiful view -Super friendly staff they are there for every need. -Mostly clean it is older so some dirtiness is expected. -Close to so much putt putt, food, historic sites- pool is clean and good size. -kid friendly.                       CONS:-Room kind of small for my family - no microwave-no bathroom by pool have to go back to room or lobby. -in our case they were an hour behind checkin time and our 4 pm checkin turned into 5 pm checkin.
review_content_20: The good points are that it is in a great location directly on the beach and very close to historic St. Augustine.  Their breakfast buffet is also pretty good.The not-so-good points are that it is bit of a "tired" hotel that could use a little TLC.  There are no extra's like a drinking glass in the bathroom, or extra towels - but you can ask for the extra towels at the front desk.  Don't expect pool or beach towels either (be sure to pick up a few before heading outside)If you are looking for an easy place to crash for a night or so, you'll be fine.  If you're looking to be pampered in the slightest way, you'll want to go elsewhere.Dated but clean and comfortable rooms. Well worth the price for the area. Beautiful beach. Trolley service to the old town. Would stay here again.I recently stayed here for fur nights over Thanksgiving. Here are the pros: Great location, very nice pool, friendly front desk staff. The cons: Room had a stale odor almost a smokey smell. The next day I switched rooms and was upgraded to a room with a fridge and microwave. However, this room also had a similar odor as the previous room. Later on that night, I found out the TV did not work! I told the front desk the next morning and they promptly corrected the problem. This hotel needs to be upgraded and the rugs either replaced or seriously shampooed. They justdon't pay attention to details...On this edition of: "How saving a few bucks, goes wrong." I present: Holiday Isle Oceanfront Resort.Planning a nice, simple road trip from Miami to Charleston St. Augustine was our first stop. We left Miami at 7:30pm and would arrive there at about 1 AM. Checking out at 8AM to head up to Savannah. I figure, oh a cheap hotel, would do. Only a couple of hours to bathe, sleep, and head out. WRONG. I have had the great fortune of picking stellar hotels (even when on a budget). Always clean, safe, not in the lap of luxury, but comfortable. I should of investigated deeper. Read more reviews. WHERE DID I GO WRONG?Paid about $85 for the night WITH a discount coupon. (I have stayed in places for less, which were leaps and bounds better than this place.)We arrive at 1am to check in. Tired. Ready for bed. And check in takes close to 20 minutes. It wasn't the sweet lady behind the counters fault....she was trying. But they seem to be using an extremely old computer system and since it was a "new day" she couldn't access our reservation. this gave me a chance to look around. The place is OLD and in desperate need of renovations. They do allow pets - for an extra fee of course - which I thought was cool.Finally she figures out our reservation and we head to the room. We pass some bell carts on the way that were either extremely dirty or that was plain old mold. YUCK, thank god we didn't need them.Walk in the room and got kicked in the face by the smell. It wasn't a rotten smell but it sure was distinct. I examine the room. Rusted all around the top of the bathroom door. Carpet looks dirty. Bathroom wasn't too bad, but the towels didn't smell clean, they didn't smell bad either, just not that CLEAN smell you want when using towels. The bed board was all scratched up. WHAT? How do you not fix something as obvious as that? The TV was old and the reception was spotty. The bed wasn't comfortable, the pillows were horrible. I can go on and on.We checked out as fast as we could in the morning and headed out. NEVER again will I make the mistake of not properly researching rooms.THIS PLACE IS TERRIBLE!!!I I wasn't expecting it to be a resort or anything, but I couldn't believe how run down and gross this place was. I paid $150 for 1 night and it wasn't worth $35. Having the direct access to the beach was very nice, but the pool area and the rest of the grounds are disgusting.You can hear every word that is spoken in the rooms next to you and the front desk  does nothing if other guests are noisy. We had our young kids trying to sleep and the neighbors must have had 10 people in their room who were screaming, having loud sex and looking through our balcony window. We packed up our children at 1 am and drove 4 hours home because we felt so unsafe at this place (not to mention that we lost our entire payment). The office is in a separate building from the rooms, so they could care less what is going on in the actual hotel. Unless you are excited about being at a huge white trash hotel party....DO NOT WASTE A DIME ON THIS PLACE!!!$150 a night for a pool with broken light so no one can swim at nightRoom carpet dirtyHead board falling apartThin walks you can hear everyone around youThe Good:Great locationBeach AccessPool and outdoor areaIn house restaurant and barEvent spaceCourteous staffThe bad:I did not like the layoutAll the exterior doors lock so if you forget a key its a real painThe elevator was small-ishThe hotel nickel and dimes a little too much. You have to pay extra for fridge, mircrowave, flatscreen etc.I am only giving this place two stars due to the beachside location. The property is in poor condition. Won't be back.The location is awesome.  Right on the beach with a very pleasant deck and walkway.  The "Beach Bus" to St. Augustine picks up right in front of the hotel which makes it super convenient to get into the city for the day.  The beds and sheets were fine. But - the hotel is in serious need of updating.  Towels were old and shabby, the elevator was having issues, everything needs to be perked up.  It works because the location is so awesome, and it seemed clean.  But could use some work for sure.Is the place old? Yes but you have to experience the view. Rusty doors, picnic furniture on the balconies, missing plaster yes, but none of that matters when you look over your balcony and take in the sea breeze and see beach sand blowing off the too of the dunes. Another plus is the beds are comfortable, the a/c blows ice cold and the staff is accommodating and pleasant. This place has a pool and a time bar right by the ocean. This place has both atmosphere and patina and they co mingle nicely.We stayed here recently for two nights (Fri & Sat) as part of a wedding celebration. It's your average beachfront hotel & I feel we received the quality we paid for. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, & we had plenty of pillows. I appreciated the mini fridge too. The beachfront access was a bonus, & we enjoyed a few cocktails at the poolside bar. The bar closed at 5pm, though, which was a bit of a downer.CAUTION if you are planning a wedding celebration here. My friend got unlucky & the wedding coordinator was fired the day before her wedding, as was the chef, so none of the food that she tried at her tasting was actually prepared for her wedding night. Not only that, but she had no day-of coordinator to help take care of things, & the hotel charged a cash bar when they weren't supposed to, at least for beer & wine. Luckily, I'm told she was given a nice refund, so the hotel tried to make up for causing havoc on her big day!My sweet husband an I have been staying at holiday isle regularly for several years and have found it to be adequate and reasonably priced in the past  however this recent stay was absolutely not acceptable.  They seem to be more interested in the the tiki bar crowd than in keeping quality clientele.  We requested and paid for a room on an upper floor away from the families with children and when we arrived we were told that the only room available was on the second of the five floors which is just above the pool and we were surrounded by small unhappy children. In fact the family in the room next to us must have been torturing their infant because the child cried  and screamed non-stop for more than two hours.  The front desk clerks were unable or unwilling to quiet the disturbance.  While the behavior of the patrons is not the fault of the establishment, they should insist that patron act like human beings and not like ill-mannered animals.  We are not an old couple, in fact quite the opposite. But our parents raised us to think of others, to treat others with courtesy and respect, and to act in a civil manner.  How in the world were other people raised?  Babies cry.  We have two of our own but we went out of our way to not disturb other people and we did not permit our children to be a disturbance to others.  Anyway, enough about that.  Beyond the noise, the hotel is in need of updating and the parking is ridiculously lacking.  I wish Managent would get with it and consider reserving parking spaces closer to the beach for those who pay dearly for oceanfront rooms. We'll be looking for a more adult oriented facility for our next stay at the beach.Pit stop on the way from Key West headed North.    We had chicken salad with cashews and crab cakes ($27).Great view of the water here, usual outdoor dining problems like flies and very bold birds that will take food right off the table.    Food was good. Nothing special...If I could give it 0 stars I would....I dont usually write nasty reviews but this one just got me ticking.... I'm writing this review because I would want to know if i were thinking of staying here, I'd like to see the good and the bad! i reserved this room out of a booking agent online, pictures seemed nice "right by the ocean".I check in and go into my room, first of all its dirty, gum wrappers on the floor, didnt have ANY fridge or microwave, one microwave to share with 500 people! They were so cheap with everything including soap and shampoo! It was me and my other half and we had to share 1 little soap and one tiny shampoo! Thought it was a mistake the next day, they left the same amount!The shower wall gave me shivers because there was bloody, red, stains all over it, it was somthing out of a horror movie, not exagerating!Here comes the big one! The first night we were there the outside transformer caught on fire, they let them know in the front, they didnt seem to care because apparently they are used to things like that happening! 1/2 of the hotel lost power including the side of the elevator! good thing there was no one there, or else they would of got stuck!  it was completley rediculous and unacceptable. This was one of the most unpleasant hotels if you want to call it that, more like an old home, no offence. They are just so cheap to their customers! but hey the rooms arent cheap to book, look at that! funny... **** they also charged my card an extra amount of money which i have yet find to find out about.pros:they have a cafeconscafe is overpricedpro: try an awesome place call "Leroys" its down the street, awesome inexpensive food :)Hotel was "good enough"...for what we paid for it.  (around $90/night)Was royally peeved when housekeeping went knocking on doors at 9am the morning of check out just to slide the receipt/bill under the door.  Is it really necessary to knock?  Not only do I hear them knocking on my door, I heard them knocking on every door down the hall. Obnoxious.  Partial ocean view is really that - you need to lean partially over the balcony to see anything.Ice machine was plentiful. Good location.Wonderful view if you have an oceanfront room! Needs a little better upkeep, but everything was clean and the staff are all extremely friendly and helpful!We stayed 2 nights here. the room was nice , clean and had a great view !!!!  The front desk was welcoming. The pool area was clean and nice!!! The beach was just footsteps a way !!! I had dropped soda on our bed and had to call to get clean bedding, no problem i was told, with in 10 mins we had new clean bedding !!!  I just saw minor things like maybe need to upgrade a bit, but didnt effect or take away from our stay. The WIFI was strong and were surprised to have a microwave and refrigerator in our room since the web site didnt mention this .   For the price and location  . ..  we will stay here again !!! just wish since they are listed as a resort had resort type activates  why i didnt give 5 starsThis used to be a holiday inn, it now goes by the name holiday isle. Well, this place is no holiday.  It is pretty old and requires a lot of TLC that it does not get- there are many negative aspects- we would NEVER stay here again. On the plus side, they seem to have a friendly staff.This is an old hotel so it isnt the nicest, however we enjoyed our stay.  the pool is nice right on the beach with an awesome beach access.  if you like to take a late night swim, the pool appears to be open all night.  the staff is friendly and the oceanfront rooms have a great view.  the rooms are a bit noisy. the hotel is dog friendly up to 50 lbsDon't bother... this hotel needs to close down and completely renovate, rather than stay open... or tear down and re-develop. It does allow pets, but does not welcome them. It's got a great beachfront location, but is not worth the price. The furnishings are nice enough, but the public areas are worn out and dirty. The pet rooms are ground floor, parking lot view, with windows that don't open. Look elsewhere!

review_content: I really didn't know what to expect. I wanted to take my Paramour away for his 45th birthday, and since he'd never been to my favorite city, St. Augie was the destination. Problem? All the hotels & B&B's wanted a 2 night stay because it was the city's 450th birthday. That is All but the Cozy inn. The cozy inn is a throw back to a different era. It's a road side inn from the 40's or 50's and it appears untouched by time, however the rooms are updated. We had room 12, which on the inside was absolutely beautiful. A very Floridian theme with a tropical bed spread, and a little table. The bathroom was quite tiny, but sufficient. The hospitality of the innkeeper was beyond par! I mentioned why we were there, and she offered us a bottle of wine, we declined, but thought that the gesture was quite nice.  I would totally stay here in the future.Just what the sign says.  We only stayed one night but perfectly charming + comfy bed, good shower, adequate wi-fi.  I love the 50's architecture & scale.Thank you again Cozy Inn for a great stay. This is our second time there and we will be back. Love the location, convenience,  cleanliness and wonderful people.Cute little place we stayed at for 2 nights. The best part was that we could bring our little doggie. The room was clean and bright and close to shopping, restaurants and most anything you'd need. We'd definitely stay here again!A perfect little roadside motel/inn that reminds me of what my family used to stay in when we traveled across the country when I was a kid. If you're looking for a fancy hotel with a gym and spa, or an exceptionally quaint bed & breakfast, this isn't it. But what it does offer is good accommodations at reasonable rates. The room we stayed in was had a queen bed, a small table with chairs, and a small but serviceable bathroom with a shower.  Our room was set back from the road a bit, so we did not notice any road noise as others have mentioned.  Everything was clean and orderly, and we never felt like we were needing anything more.  For well under $100/night, this is a great value in a fairly pricey tourist town.The downside of the great value is the distance from old town.  It's far enough that you won't want to walk, and parking in St Augustine is a hassle, especially with 3-4 hour street limits.  Your best bet is to call for a cab. as it costs maybe $5-7 to get anywhere. You could also bring your own bicycles if that's your thing, as it's free and parking is plentiful. Overall a great little inn that offers everything you need, and nothing you don't, for a great price."Very much enjoyed!"My father and I stayed here in a one bedroom suite while visiting friends in St. Augustine. It was perfect for us! I gave my father the bedroom - and I slept on the pull out couch in the living room. We only stayed one night - but it was so nice. Christine was delightful on check-in, and we were delighted to find our suite was more like a small ground floor apartment, directly across the street! Our suite included a lovely front porch with wicker furniture. The kitchenette was a full kitchen actually - though we didn't need it. We were quite comfortable and I could have enjoyed staying here for a week.... \  I did greatly appreciate the coffee maker - ready to go before we headed off to our breakfast with friends.  I will say - I read another review talking about the street traffic on the main road right in front of the room where we stayed - but HONESTLY - we did not notice any annoying level of  traffic sounds. We stayed on a Friday night - so perhaps truck traffic was lower - and on Saturday morning there was little traffic until around 9:30 (just as we were leaving) - but it was delightful.The bed, my father reported was most comfortable - and while no pull out couch is great - my night's sleep was just fine.  There were televisions in both the living room and bedroom - so we each enjoyed some late night tv.  The bathroom, I'll admit, was a bit small and in need of an update - - but over all the accommodations were really quite nice and a tremendous value.Our friends were part of a (sell out) convention group at the Renaissance at World of Golf roughly 20 minutes north. - We could have stayed at MANY hotel/motels closer to them - however I chose this for the reviews and the 'suite' set up and price and I am so glad we stayed here! It was so much more relaxing - and spotlessly clean - just a far better experience than any 'typical' hotel/motel experience.  Next time I'm in St. Augustine - this will be my home away from home.I am so glad that I found and booked our stay at The Cozy Inn. I surprised my husband and upgraded at the last minute to the Honeymoon Suite for our 8th Anniversary. I called and spoke to Christina the morning of our arrival and asked for the upgrade. I had originally booked on Expedia so I wasn't sure of the process. She held the room for us and when we got there she had everything ready. Our Suite was located across the street from the office in the historic house portion of the inn. The suite was called "The Royal". We had the entire second floor of the home to ourselves. When we arrived at the top of the stairs and first laid our eyes on our suite, my husband and I were pleasantly surprised. It was very clean, spacious & bright. There are several skylights throughout the suite that let in natural light. We entered the kitchen to find a bottle of wine from a local winery and two glasses with a personalized card for our occasion. The kitchen, dining and living area are open concept with a small nook with a desk as well. The only thing that area was lacking was a three prong plug for electronics. They had a little extension cord running behind because there's no outlet on that wall. The bedroom had a King bed and traditional furnishings. The tub was in the bedroom to the right as you entered the double doors to the suite. It is tastefully situated in a way so it is somewhat off of the bedroom but open to it. There we found his and hers robes. The only suggestion I have here would be some bubble bath or bath beads/crystals. The bathroom off of the suite was spotless and bright. A nice bright skylight in there as well. A heads up, The shower is really small. One person at a time for sure. Not long after our arrival, we decided to go in to the shopping district. We were locking up and we're greeted by the owners of the cozy inn. They asked if we found the accommodations satisfactory and wanted to welcome us. Very nice couple. They also suggested some local favorites for us during our stay.After a long day and a lot of walking, we came back to our suite. It was almost too quiet. In the morning it was not so quiet though. This was really the only annoyance for me. I was woken up to a dog continuously barking. There is a vets office next door who does some boarding. This is not something that would keep me from staying again. Just thought I would mention it.Check out was quick and easy. It was a great stay. If we stay in St. Augustine again we plan on reserving this suite. We really enjoyed it.. My husband was pleased and that's not an easy task! Our next stay will include a 10 percent discount. Thanks For making our 8th Anniversary a memorable one.The name of this motel is cute, but nothing is cute about highway traffic at 4 A.M.Situated on top of a busy main road, semi trucks and cars with loud stereos whiz past at all hours. If you are not bothered by that type of ruckus, then the Cozy is a great bet. It's close to the main areas but not down in the historic district, and the rooms are clean (as in, smelled like the chemicals they'd used to clean it - so it must be clean, right?) and comfortable. The window air conditioners could stand to be upgraded (they're the kind that blow the window curtains up, thereby defeated the curtains' purpose), and there was loud hammering on the exterior of my unit at 8 AM. Overall my stay was fine though - my earplugs and white noise machine did the trick. The free WiFi was a nice touch. My travel companions did not have hot water in their room in the morning, however...This place is the best!!! Rooms were affordable, impeccably clean, bed was very cozy, and the staff was so so friendly!!! I will for sure be back to stay with them!! For the rest of our road trip we will be avoiding big hotel changes and will stay at small family owned hotels. On a side note I learned this place extremely pet friendly!! For an extended stay I like the fact that the pet fee is a one time fee.Stayed here a couple years ago, so things might be different now.  The parking lot is a bit on the small size and we drove a van, so parking was tight, but I am really good at backing in, so I didn't truly have a problem.  The effiicency room we rented was nice.  Bed was soft enough.  Nice bathroom.  Small, but adequate kitchen.  The microwave plate wouldn't spin, so we burned the microwave popcorn, but eh, no big deal.  The place is located in a decent area.  The trolly stop isn't far.  Someone else mentioned the chemical (clean) smell in the room.  We noticed that tooo.  Not too overpowering, but strong.  Our room was underneith another room and I think the people living there were moving out the next day because they were very loud.  Moving furniture and walking all around up there at very late hours of the night.  At least till midnight.  We were tired from touring the city, so we were trying to sleep at midnight.  We mentioned this to the office upon checkout and they were super nice and apologetic.  They told us we should have said something to the office staff when it was happening.  We didn't because we figured it would eventually stop.  They gave us a nice bottle of wine for our troubles.  Would stay here again, if our favorite accomodations were not available in Crescent Beach !We love it here! We always stay at the cozy inn on our weekend getaways. The place is very clean which is a must for me (I guess for most people), the staff is helpful and friendly. It's a home away from home for us. We walk to all the attractions from our hotel. It might be a bit long for some older folks or people with children but just fine for us. We usually dine at the at the Raintree Cafe which is a few blocks away. Definitely walking distance and definitely worth checking out. Can't wait for our next getaway to visit the Cozy Inn.Our second time staying at The Cozy Inn in St. augustine. There is nothing that I could ever say that would be better than "wow"!!  The best of the best!  My husbands birthday weekend we traveled from Fort Lauderdale to spend another stay at this beautiful little piece of heaven and were welcomed again like royalty!  Our daughter in law and granddaughter came over from Tampa to join us for a day and evening and the owners of the inn made sure our rooms were right near each other and treated them so well.  The rooms, all of them are charming with modern decor and updated appliances for the little kitchenettes that come with all the rooms.  All the conveniences that you need for a stay over are here.  Of course pets are welcome as long as you make the inn aware you have them.  I could go on and on, but I think everything has been stated.  If I could give 10 stars, I would.  We are looking for a home in st. Augustine and will be making a few more trips up here, we will stay here each time we come, without a doubt!  Thank you, don't change, we love your hospitality, see you again soon!This is by far the best hotel I've stayed at. They do allow dogs which is perfect. The location is 1.5 miles from shopping, restaurants and the castle. The hotel was extremely clean. The sheets smelled like Downey fabric softener. I will stay here again and highly recommend it to everyone.Place was clean and pampered. No problems. Has free wifi. Had great time.Having spent many vacations at 5 star resorts around the country, one of the main things I am looking for is cleanliness and service, and this is the CLEANEST place I have ever laid my head. The staff was top notch and went above and beyond for my wife and I to accommodate us and make our stay a great one !!They would have received 5 stars except the shower was a little small for my 6ft. 200lb body to get around in ... oh well, thats my only complaint here. Within walking distance from a couple of other chain places that were more expensive and looked a little run down for my liking. This is a family owned, quiet little gem that deserves the high rating it has received from me and several others from the trip advisor (which is how i found the Cozy Inn)Just a short walk from the Fountain of Youth and from 2 of the starting points for the tour trains that take visitors around town. We took our bikes with us on the trip to be able to bike up and down all streets to see things up close and go at our own pace. 5 minutes from Cozy Inn to anywhere you want to go via bikes.This is a true gem !!!!Awesome find! We were looking for an affordable, clean, convenient location in St. Augustine and this is it! Walkable to downtown, or a very short car drive. Extremely clean (we were wondering how you even get showers so white)! Really nice staff. I wish we could find Cozy Inns everywhere we vacationed. The rooms aren't very spacious, but for the price, location, and amenities, we couldn't care less!Stayed in the Cozy Inn Motel for a weekend getaway and when I first saw the pics online I thought how small the rooms are but I figured it was affordable and close to where we want to be. When we got there it was late and the lady at the front office was very helpful and nice and had a cool dog that had its hair shaved like a lion, it was awesome! When we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised at how much bigger the room was...the pics online doesn't at all show that! Our stay was awesome and would definitely stay again and also recommend the place to family and friends!!this place is so clean....everything is pristine....the staff were so accommodating...family owned business...support the locals and stay here you will not be disappointed!!

Excelent, place, excelente breakfast!  Glenda the owner is super nice. We come back for sureMy husband and I had the pleasure of staying in the Peace & Plenty Inn as our first Bed & Breakfast experience.We were warmly greeted at the front door upon arrival and given a quick tour of the common areas and then taken to our room where Glenna gave us a map of the area and explained a little about some of the places and offered to make any dinner reservations etc. should we need them!We stayed in room 7, the Happiness Spa Suite which was located behind the main house in the Carriage House. We couldn't have been more pleased with the room! The pictures on the website of the room are lovely, but the room was SO much more beautiful in person! It is SO clean and modern and very quiet with it's own exterior entrance, which we found we liked the best since we tend to stay out a little later than most people do! But the entrance to the room was still inside the B&B's courtyard area, which was also beautiful and serene.The courtyard area featured several seating areas, all equipped with very attractive outdoor furnishings that looked like they were brand new. There was also a gas fire pit under the pergola, there was an adorable little greenhouse and two huge fountains that were very so calming to sit and listen to!Complimentary soda, beer and wine are available at all times, which we so appreciated! Then cakes, sherry and port are served every evening at 6pm. We couldn't get over how delicious all of the goodies were! The coconut and carrot cakes were our favorite. We also had never had port or sherry and were a little intimidated at first, but came to realize we love port!Breakfast was also phenomenal each morning! We got to enjoy fresh fruit, quiche, strawberry waffles, eggs benedict and the most delicious turkey sausage we'd ever had. They also had some very unique fruit juice blends that were excellent!The staff was very pleasant and did a great job of providing us with everything we needed! We even accidentally locked ourselves out one morning but were back in immediately after Glenna gave us a spare! Glenna, the innkeeper, was genuinely warm and pleasant. She made herself easily available but was not a nuisance. (We didn't expect her to come tuck us in at night, as I fear some other reviewers may have desired?) She greeted us by name each morning at breakfast and asked us how we were and we would pass by her a few other times throughout the day as we were coming and going. We enjoyed a nice conversation and a good farewell as we left at the end of our stay and were made to feel as though we were family.Soon after leaving, I even received a call from Glenna that I had left a piece of jewelry and she mailed it back to me right away!But most of all, the location of the Peace and Plenty Inn was perfect. It was located right in the historic district, just a few minutes walk from many of the sites and attractions and a block or so away from one of the Red Train stops, which was how we did most of our traveling in St. Augustine. The Peace and Plenty is right next door to a few other bed and breakfasts but I genuinely think the Peace and Plenty was the nicest looking (and had better parking!)For the price, this place is unbeatable! We will probably never stay in a hotel again, we are now B&B fans!My husband and I, along with our two dear friends, chose St. Augustine for our annual Christmas get-together.  We spent 4 nights at Peace & Plenty the weekend before Christmas, and just checked out today (Christmas Day).  I miss it already!The location is perfect, in Old Town and in walking distance to everything. Over the course of our 4 nights/days we never moved our car (one parking space for each suite).  We strolled everywhere!Glenna is a wonderful hostess, providing thoughtful insight into places to visit and how to get there. Each morning, she'd ask us about our plans for the day and if we had any questions, and in the afternoons she'd welcome us back. We really felt like we were "at home" in her home.My husband and I stayed in Tranquility Suite #4, and our friends were next door in #3.  Both are upstairs in the main house (as is #2).  We loved #4 as we had a full private balcony with chairs and table to enjoy our mornings with coffee and our evenings with wine.  Our friends loved #3 for the super comfy King-sized bed.  Their suite was very light and airy with windows that really brought in the light, and I especially liked the size of their bathroom.  While our bathroom in #4 was smaller, and our bed was a Queen, the balcony is the reason I would book this room again.  If it was the dead heat of the summer, however, I doubt we'd use the balcony much, and would probably opt for another room instead.We also toured #2 while there was no guest staying in the room.  This suite has a large sitting room with TV.  There was no TV in the bedroom, so the TV watching would really need to be done in the sitting room if this is an important feature for someone.  Other than that, it was a spacious suite also, and very nice.  Legend is that this suite is where Sophie Decher is sometimes seen.  Sophie was the wife of Conrad Decher who purchased the house in 1895.The breakfasts changed each morning, and were another thoughtful touch to our stay. Food was served elegantly, and we appreciated the quality of a gourmet breakfast as opposed to a continental breakfast anyone can find in a hotel.Each evening brought us to the living room to create small plates of desserts and pour a glass of wine (red or white wine, Coke, Diet Coke, bottled water, cans of beer were all available at all times with port and sherry only available in the evenings).  We enjoyed the space here with the Christmas tree, but most often enjoyed our goodies on our balcony before retiring each night.Some have said the carriage house is more private, however, we did not feel any lack of privacy in the main house at all.  There are only three rooms upstairs, so there is no foot traffic to speak of.  The house is a quiet space, and you can see the commitment to "Peace" in everything from the scents, the light music playing at breakfast, the artwork in the rooms, and the overall decorating schemes which varied from room to room.There is no doubt in my mind that we will return. I really wish it could be sooner rather than later!SPECIAL NOTE -- The Peace & Plenty Inn is one of the houses on the Holly Jolly Trolly route during the Nights of Lights.Booked a room on a whim and got an excellent deal on a room (three room suite!). The staff is very cordial and polite, but not the overfriendly type that intrudes or is too involved. We were given plenty of privacy, but knew they were there to assist if needed. The house is absolutely beautiful and decorated in the most charming way. We were in love with all of the decor and little trinkets found throughout the inn. Be sure the checkout the garden which has a lovely fountain that practically sparkles at sunrise. Breakfast was a tad disappointing and felt rushed, but the waiting staff was very enthusiastic. There is self serve coffee in morning and sherry/wine/beer at night! However I recommend going out for coffee instead if you are a coffee snob, because their brew wasn't very good. If you are the type to sleep in, I would strongly advise you to not get a room on the first floor. There is a lot of ruckus between the kitchen prep and the stairs as early as 6AM. If that's too early for you definitely avoid room Harmony #1 and book one of their other wonderful rooms.All in all we had a lovely stay and would recommend it to anyone! Great location, view, and value!This was a stop on our honeymoon trip, and it was phenomenal! The folks here were more than accommodating and hospitable, and the location is in perfect walking distance to the main sites. We stayed in a suite in the carriage house (behind the main house) and it was breath-taking. The garden courtyard was beautiful. The freshly-made breakfast was delicious. It would be hard to beat this place! We will definitely be going back.My boyfriend and I stayed at Peace and Plenty for two nights. We were in the Serendipity Suite, which is a pet friendly room. The room was quaint and lovely. The room overlooked the beautiful garden area and fountain. The amenities of the room were average, including TV/cable, small iron/board, hair dryer, and travel sized soaps, etc. The bathroom was big and included a hot tub (you want to bring your own bubbles) and you can't use it after 11pm. The bed was comfortable and so was the couch in the small living room area where the TV is located. The only issue we had with the room was that both my boyfriend and myself were very allergic to something in there. Perhaps a cat was in there at some point, even though the owner attested that cats weren't allowed, but that's all we're allergic to. Even our dog was sneezing and had watery eyes all weekend. That was really the reason for 4 stars. I think because it's all carpeted and fairly old, there may still be pet dander or fur buried deep into the fibers. I did find pet hair on the blanket. Thankfully we found some Claritin in a nearby store. Breakfast was served until 10am, which is a bit early to end for us people who take advantage of sleeping in. Also, not much of a variety. You either eat what they're serving, or have cereal. Our first meal was a cheesecake crepe with fruit and blueberry sauce. I am a vegetarian, so I didn't get any sausage links. I did appreciate that they took that into consideration. There was also juice, coffee and an array of hot tea to choose from. The house itself was lovely. We did not go upstairs to check out the rest of it, but I'm sure it was nice. The dining area was large and had various neatly decorated tables. The parlor was my favorite area. Each evening, cake, sherry, and port was set out for people to enjoy. It was a great place to chit chat with other guests. The cakes were store bought, but displayed nicely. The sherry was tasty and we enjoyed having it while classical music played in the background. Also, complimentary drinks were provided throughout the day and night including water, sodas, beer, and wine. Overall, our stay was good. Glenna, the owner, was nice and helpful. She answered all of my questions quickly and accurately. I definitely recommend this B&B to anyone wanting an affordable and comfortable place to stay. The house is only a couple of blocks away from the main area in historic St. Augustine, which made it easy to come back and forth.We stayed at the Peace & Plenty over Christmas weekend.  We arrived on Saturday and left on Christmas Day.  We were greeted warmly by Glenna who was an amazing hostess.  She was a great source of information about the town, places to eat, things to see, and details about some of the towns history. You could ask her anything and she probably knew the answer.  The house was a charming historic home and had a cozy holiday feel to it as it was wonderfully decorated for Christmas.  This made our Christmas just right and exactly what we wanted.  We really got lucky that we were on the best decorated street in town.  So much so that the Holiday Trolleys pass the house every day.  We stayed in room #3. Our room was very comfortable and the king bed was extremely comfortable.  We stayed in the main house and I felt right at home.  We really enjoyed the complimentary wine and treats offered every night as well.  The breakfast changed each day and the menu was displayed at the front door each night so you knew what to expect the next morning. Everything we had was wonderful. Next time we are in St. Augustine we will definitely return to the Peace & Plenty B&B.  Thank you for making our holiday so special!My husband and I wanted to get away for a weekend after the start of the new year. We felt so, so fortunate that we found availability at such short notice. We stayed a Thursday and Friday night at the Peace & Plenty Inn and could not have had a lovelier time. We were greeted by Glenna who took very good care of accommodating us. She showed us around the inn and took us to our room, which was waiting for us with two (Hershey) kisses! She was extremely helpful in explaining as the error, as we really hadn't done our research. She provided us with a tourist map which turned out to be a life saver and also gave us coupons. She recommended us trying the Ice Plant for dinner one night, and that ended up being a highlight of our trip. We definitely would not have known about it without her. The house itself was perfect. We stayed in the Serendipity #2 room. It was clean and well decorated.  My husband kept walking around saying "this is so fancy!' In fact, my husband asked Glenna right away if she happened to have availability for an extra night (unfortunately she did not). We couldn't get over the fact that we were in a house. We were never disturbed by the other house guests and didn't even know they were there (except at breakfast of course).The breakfast we had each morning was meticulously prepared and so delicious. The first morning we had strawberry waffles and the second morning we had quiche that was to die for. Whoever is doing the cooking is doing a great job! Each night there was port, sherry, and cake served in the sitting room which was really nice. Unlimited beer/wine/soda is always a big plus, too. The location of P&P is ideal. It's within walking distance of just about everything. You only have to drive if you want to go over the bridge (such as to the lighthouse or alligator farm). While staying at P&P we never moved our car once! We saved going to the Lighthouse til our day of checkout. I only have two small complaints (and they clearly didn't take away from my rating). First, the beer/wine/soda is kept in a small refrigerator downstairs. The fridge wasn't very cold at all. We would grab a can of whatever and stick it on ice in our room for awhile before drinking it.  Second, the shower in the room (we stayed in Serendipity #2) was laughably small. It was smaller than a cruise ship shower! You couldn't  even bend over - in fact, I don't think all people could even fit inside. This might bother some people. We didn't really care because of the fact that there is a giant jacuzzi tub in the bathroom to make up for the small shower and that was very nice.Great place to stay in St. Augustine.  We stayed in the Nirvana(I think that's what it's called!) suite.  The bathroom is totally updated with an amazing shower with rock wall.  There is an outside seating area with a small fire pit and chandelier.  There is a cute cat that stays outside named Starsky.  There is complimentary beer and wine and great breakfast. The inn keeper is really nice and she gave us a coupon book and tips on where to eat.  My husband and I can't wait to go back.We have stayed at seven other bnbs in St Augustine... this will be our top choice of return picks!  Location is just as good as any others, but quieter than on A1A.  A five min walk to historic area at the most, but the decor, finishing touches and amenities put this at the top. Although there were three small negatives, we would not call them downfalls or anything worth passing this by.  There was construction next door and at the carriage house during our stay which took over parts of the garden area but it was done with by evening...still a heads up would've been nice since those rooms were still ones we had considered and were available.  The hostess was nice and very helpful but there was some warmth lacking for some reason.  Last of all, we would have liked to hear what was being served for breakfast before it was out in front of us, which the other guests benefited from...only because of dislikes vs allergies....of course we could've asked after the fact for no apricot/ sauce but hated to be a pain.  Now, back to THE reasons to stay here... location of course is very good, price is very competitive and actually a benefit to consider, ambience is lovely...all the perfect touches and then some, they know what they are doing he like a well piled machine.  The amenities of help yourself to the soda, water, beer, wine, ice, etc anytime is such a pleasure.  The pre dinner or post dinner dessert time is long lasting and delightful,  but it would be nice if the hostess socialized if no other guests partake at least when it starts like other bnbs.  The rooms were luxurious.... quaint, comfy, nice amenities, beautiful view if you get a balcony, great beds and fireplaces.All in all, we would pick this again over Casablanca, City House, St francis, Powder House, etc. Its a winner without question.  Enjoy!! p.s. Dinner at Collage was the very best in st Augustine, bar none!Peace & Plenty is a solid 4 star Bed and Breakfast. It is one of the cheapest B&Bs in the area, and you get most of the perks of the other places. Here's the breakdown.ProsCost: We paid $89 plus tax off season for a nice room with a full kitchen. Now most people don't want to cook on vacation, but I love cooking, so to have a kitchen I could make a small meal at 2 am was fantastic. But even the other rooms were not much more if you don't want to see a stove during your romantic get-away. Comfort: The bed was nice. The room was pleasant. The bathroom was cozy. There was a little courtyard that was somewhat enjoyable. Location: The house is two blocks from the Lightner Museum and four blocks from the river. ConsService: The owner is pretty stuffy and definitely not warm. She runs things more like a hotel than a B&B. I am not saying she was mean, but don't expect a hug when you walk in the door. Food/Drinks: There is free wine and beer available in the main house all day, but it is really low quality. There is evening snacks with port and scotch, but also the drinks were not good quality and the treats were ok. The french toast for breakfast was very good, but somewhat small portions, and the accompanying sausage was Jimmy Dean-like frozen sausage. Again, nothing was bad, but just not stellar.
