But for the cost, it was to be expected.Ants: There were a few carpenter ants that were on the wall in the bathroom next to the tub. This is an old house, like everything in St. Augustine, so it is no surprise. But still, I would have preferred no ants. Overall, this place is a great deal. If you are comparing staying here to staying at the Hilton for the same price, I would take this place in a heart beat. But if you are looking for an uber-romantic stay in tranquil St. A, then there are better (though more expensive) B&B options in the area.Hands down the best B&B to stay in St Augustine. Very close walk to historic square, Lightner Museum, Flagler College, shops and restaurants- plus free parking. Furnishings were elegant, cozy atmosphere, very warm and kind innkeeper who answered all of our questions and made some great recommendations for local restaurants and sights. Plus the room prices are very competitive- you get a lot for your money here. Complementary beer, wine, sodas, coffee, tea and snacks in the parlor- and a tasty breakfast in the morning which we had delivered to our room. Jacuzzi tub was quite nice and we had a great view from the balcony. A real gem for romantic getaways. We will definitely be back!My boyfriend and I decided to stay at our first bed and breakfast for Valentine's day this year and oh boy did we make a good decision. After hours of researching we landed on the Peace and Plenty Inn. We were greeted by our hostess who was very informative and knew just about anything you wanted to know about St. Augustine. She gave us a tour of the Inn and then showed us to our room, which was lovely. We even had our own private balcony and Jacuzzi. She gave us maps of the area and recommended places for us to have a romantic dinner. She then left us to get settled and we relaxed on our bed for a little before sightseeing. It was so big and soft, we wanted to take it home with us. The bed was not complimentary but there were complimentary drinks such as beer, wine, soda, water, coffee, tea, as well as after dinner desserts and sherry and port. We were the first ones to break into the desserts and it was all done with so much love and care. Also while we were snacking our hostess gave us a Chocolate Heart as a gift and said "Happy Thanksgiving". It was so funny, such an odd mistake to make but we all had a good laugh over it. After the laughing and during the snacking I was able to look at all of the records of the house. A thumping good read if I do say so myself. Really neat to stay in such an old place. And our B&B was not advertised as "Haunted" as many are but it sure looked it. It looked like one of those places you see on the ghost TV shows, but I didn't want to know until we were leaving because if it was I didn't want to see something everyone else said they have seen. I wanted to see it on my own.Our room came with everything we could have needed from soap to bath-robes. There is a great view from the balcony. The decor was very nice, I got a chance to glance into other rooms at the end of our stay and it seems as though they all had different themes. There was a marching band suit outside of our door and it freaked me out a couple of times but I got used to him. Also some dolls I wasn't really a fan of but it was nothing personal, I just don't care for dolls.The next morning we had breakfast in the dining room, we were treated to a variety of breakfast foods like cereal and fruit, but the real treat was the Waffles! We had to wait for a little bit because I'm pretty sure there were only two people back there tending to everything. But it was so worth the wait. It was like they found a way to batter and deep fry butter. So crunchy on the outside and soft and buttery on the inside. It was perfect. I wish I could have them for breakfast every morning. Also I loved the back round music and the art on the walls. Very classy. Another great thing about B&Bs is that the majority of the patrons are older. So even though we are in our early 20's it's nice that everyone else is 60+ because that way you don't have to worry about loud drunkenness while you're trying to relax, which I'm sure at first they were concerned about us being that way but we ended up making quite a few friends from this trip. So the answer to the big question, is the Peace and Plenty Inn haunted? Yes! But just in one room. Which room? Well that's for me to know and for you to find out. But don't worry. She's very nice. :)I love this b and b. Breakfast is great. Close to everything. Free alcohol is always a plus. Wife is dairy free and they accomodated her with no issues all week. Cat on site, but not inside. His name is starsky. Grouds are nice. Room was clean.For the price you cannot beat this B&B. Great location, walking distance to almost everything. The room was nice and room service cleaned everyday. The breakfast was good, my wife says great. The fridge was stocked with soda and other drinks for free. Cake and drinks in the evening, we don't drink, but the cake was good. For around 100$ during the weekdays you can't go wrong...we stayed in the carriage house and liked the extra privacy..My wife and I stayed here.I think I liked it more than she did. We had a nice room, the bed was comfortable, and while the appointments were old / antique, that goes with the whole B&B atmosphere. It is practically in the downtown square of St Augustine, so all of that stuff is easily walkable. The B&B has free parking. The breakfast was quite good.This was the first bed and breakfast I have ever been to. It was so neat not having the typical hotel experience in this great city. The Inn is very well kept and during Christmas it is well decorated inside and out. They offer breakfast in the morning which can also be delivered right to your door so you can have breakfast in bed. I would recommend staying out in the carriage house on the second floor in Rhapsody Suite #6. It is absolutely amazing. I will definitely be back in the future. The staff is caring and willing to accommodate any request, such as birthday cakes, champagne, wine, dinner reservations, tours, ect.. Parking present right outside.

I enjoyed my stay at the Jaybird's Inn. I got the recommendation from Yelpers, and I made my reservation on Booking.com. They attempted to call a few days before to confirm my reservation, but they didn't leave a message. I called them back (just in case), and everything was fine. I was only there in the evening to sleep, so I can't comment on anything but that.LOCATION: It's located 1.7 miles from the heart of St. Augustine's historic district (I.e. Flagler College). It wasn't hard to get there, and I Ubered most of the time. They said it was okay for me to leave my car there. It's located near some train tracks, so as some Yelpers said, you'll hear the horn until around 11 PM and beginning at 7 AM. I'm not a late sleeper, so that didn't bother me. If it does, bring some ear plugs. Also, this is not too far from a main road, so you will hear some traffic at night. No big deal to me.THE ROOM: I stayed in a room across from the restaurant. They were nice and renovated. My room was a bit warm/humid, but I ended up turning on the AC and that solved the problem. The rooms were clean, and the beds were very comfortable. For the price, you're getting a great value. I didn't have any issues with getting hot water within 15 seconds. They have a lot of amenities, such as a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. SERVICE: The front desk was very helpful. Everyone was nice.There's breakfast included. I was able to watch Netflix on the wifi, just make sure you are connected to the wifi that has a stronger connection to where you're located. I'd probably stay here again.I stayed here with my GF when we were in St Augustine visiting her family. The inn was nice with a very helpful staff. The room we stayed in was clean and comfortable. I don't usually like staying in motels in the middle of a bustling city, but this place was okay. The decor in the rooms was updated, nice tile floors made the room feel cozy. The lighting system was well done, with backlit wall features and a good color palette.The motel is in the on the corner of two busy streets, so you will hear road noise all night. A train track is also very close, so at least twice we are awoken to a loud rumbling train speeding theough the night. The continental breakfast is mostly self-serve waffles and yogurt. Not bad, but nothing special.We enjoyed our time here and the staff made us feel quite welcome for the three nights we spent with them.TL;DR: Good staff, okay amenities, bad location.Pros: the staff was very friendly and helped us get to our touristy destinations with much grace.Cons: the toilet was it bolted to the ground; it's good that neither of us got drunk, we may have broken the toilet trying to take a poo. The bed had no headboard and was not bolted to the wall; every morning we woke up about a foot from the wall with our pillows on the floor. All the pillows in the hotel were so tiny that we ended up buying some at Walmart.Super cons: finally, the art. These hideous vulture pictures hung on the wall and watched our every move. We had to cover one of them with a Walmart bag to keep our sanity.Hotel was really nice the parking is really cramped but the rooms a re well worth it rooms are clean and appear to be recently remodeled and the hotel was decently quiet it is close to the local attractions and it is decently pricedThe stay I had at the Jaybird's Inn was pretty mediocre until I had a problem. The staff at Jaybird's Inn is getting the 1 out of 5 stars here. Their ability to deal with a problem is absolutely horrible. The rooms looks fine but the walls are paper thin so if you plan on watching TV, you had better turn it off before 9pm or the noise complaints start coming your way. I could only recommend this hotel to someone staying by themselves with the intention to go to bed as the sun goes down.St. Augustine is a fun place with lots to do, but please don't waste your time at this hotel if you want to have a great time.Cannot say enough good things about this place. Wonderful staff; wonderful rooms and a wonderful time. We have returned three times and all three times we were impressed. The restaurant there is wonderful too.Any time I can enjoy a sound sleep while away from home goes a long way towards making me think favorably of the place where I am staying. And a good night's sleep is exactly what I enjoyed here.Jaybird's Inn is a moderately priced, conveniently located and all-around solid place to stay while in the St. Augustine area. Perched along the busy multi-lane Ponce de Leon Blvd., it might be wise to request a room far away from the heavy traffic. It helped alleviate some of the sound from the surroundings. A nice neighborhood and another commercial strip is just behind this inn so there are lovely places to stroll and run nearby. Nice not to be locked and blocked in by a network of high speed highways.The inn has bikes or you can bring your own which might be the best way to really get around this somewhat compact city. I saw a good number of folks leisurely cycling which suggests the area may be more bike-friendly then most.I liked the overall look of the room which featured flooring rather than carpeting, lots of lights, a good size desk with comfortable chairs, a coffee maker, microwave and mini-frig, spacious shower and a stylish color scheme. The room charge includes a continental breakfast which was basic but quite adequate with baked goods, yogurt, make-your-own waffles, cereal, oatmeal, coffee and juice. There is a lovely pool area and even a fitness room with some weights, bands, stability balls etc. on site. This would seem like a great place for people who don't need room service or a lot of luxury but want a comfortable, contemporary place to stay that can be the perfect hub for a day of sightseeing, outlet shopping and taking day trips to the beach.Big plus and points for the quantity and quality of the bathroom towels that were thick and plentiful.From the Outside this place looks ehhh and the parking is tight. But on the inside this is a Fantastic Hotel. Clean Rooms, Quiet, and affordable. Its about 2 or 3 Miles from the Historic District but extremely easy to Uber or walk from. Would definitely stay here again.Don't let the motor court exterior fool you. This IS A MODERN boutique Inn. Fully updated, totally clean, very comfortable with lots of space in the King rooms. Upgraded beds and pillows! Activity center is sparse, outdated and in almost fair condition. If you are here to workout, then consider run on beach or state park trails. Friendly helpful staff from check in to dinner. Food is very good, oversized portions, reasonably priced and quick in/out. Good lication, quiet rooms aside from a once daily train whistke. Definitely recommendWe got this room through a Priceline Express Deal. They run a great motel. It is a motel, so there is some road noise, but it wasn't bad. The breakfast was excellent and the staff was extremely helpful. The room was clean and well furnished. The water was a little slow getting hot- but if that's the worst thing you have to say about a motel, you're doing pretty good! We had a great time in St. Augustine.What a great find!! We stayed here for a wedding and were very, pleasantly surprised!! Our room had ample parking spots available directly in front of it. The room was very spacious and updated. Most importantly, it was clean & fresh!! We had a great stay. The staff was very friendly and polite.Excellent place to stay. Just short of 2 miles from Historic District, The room was immaculate ~ very clean and comfortable. Shower was a bit of an issue as water got all over floor. Need to adjust that and was advised management was aware of issue. I would also like to see a curtain or some kind of door at the bathroom vanity to provide more privacy. With a family of 3 or more staying in a room, there was really no where to comfortably dress/bathroom very small. Wifi is a little weak.Other than that, we were very pleased with the motel and the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly.We were advised the motel is expanding as well.I would stay at Jaybird's Inn again ... Exceptional value for the money.I love jay birds I'm only sad that they no longer allow animals due to health compliance - the atmosphere outside was supposed to dog friendly. I sincerely hope they change that because really was a plus!Exactly what we were looking for. I was never a fan of exterior door hotels but would definitely do this place again. Recently renovated and well worth the $80.I was shocked at this place. Room was like new renivated. Restaurant was great. I will return.Pros: redone not so long ago looks neat inside,Can bike to everything in st Augustine.Breakfast was nice.Pool is. Nice Restaurant was nice next door.Cons: bathroom or AC kept making a loud noise every 5 mins.Near train heard a loud horn through the night.Shower leaked all over place they need a bigger certain.If you're looking for a clean comfortable place for a couple of nights, stay here! It was well kept and recently renovated. The only cons were the shower curtain was a little too short and water came out all over the floor and the train noise which most people have mentioned. We didn't try the continental breakfast but jaybirds restaurant right across the way has awesome service and food! Upon check in at the inn they give you 10 dollars off your Jaybirds breakfast for every day you're booked which was an unexpected treat!There aren't many absolutes in this world. Most of life is a balance of art and science. But there are a few basics when it comes to lodging. There's cleanliness and comfort, the ability to sleep in peace, and basic services like making the bed and changing the towels. Jaybird's fell apart on two of the three. Here's the story.When we arrived at the Jaybird's we were surprised at a few things. First, they bill themselves as a "Boutique Hotel" but are, in fact, a motel. There's nothing "boutique" about the Jaybird's that I can tell. You'll also note that, though some booking websites say the motel is in the historic district of St. Augustine, they're a bit more than a mile and a half from the the central square on the larger of the two highways that run through town. It's not really walkable by any normal standard - you have to either bike or drive into town, or take the tourist trolley, which does stop at Jaybird's.Reception was friendly enough, and fairly simple. They do have you sign an agreement not to smoke in the rooms, which is fine - though when we got to our room there was a burn on the bedspread. It was either an iron or a cigar - hard to tell. The room itself, on the other hand, was way less than what we expected. It was clean enough and the bed was okay, but we had the pleasure of some piece of mechanical equipment above our room that let off a loud buzz every 2-3 minutes. The best way to describe the sound is to have you imagine the buzzer at a sporting event or on a game show. Buzz. Buzz. Buzz. all night. We rang the front desk, but there was no answer and it was unlikely that they could do anything about it, so we lived with it. For two nights.And then there's the housekeeping service - or I should say lack of service. After the first night we got up, showered and dried off with the sandpaper towels. As we were ready to leave a young man knocked on the door and asked if we wanted housekeeping. We said that we did, and to give us a minute. We left and assumed, wrongly, that we'd have housekeeping. When we returned at 10pm we found our bed unmade, towels unchanged and everything exactly as it had been left. And the Buzz was still there. I so wish I could post an audio clip of this noise. It's unbelievable. But since the housekeeping staff apparently doesn't visit the room, they probably don't know about the noise.One other note - the wireless network is very slow and wide open. Do not do anything on this network unless your computer is well firewalled and you're using https:// websites. The fact that this place is #8 of all the hotels in St. Augustine is shocking. Either the other hotels really suck, or this place needs a few more reviews.----Postscript: Having read the other reviews after posting my own, I see that there's one other that references the buzzing noise. It's apparently a widespread issue through the hotel. This is clearly a problem for the Jaybird's. For this reason I strongly suggest steering clear.Second Postscript: On checkout I let the manager on duty know about my complaint. He did confirm that the buzzing noise is a known issue and that there is an A/C setting that sometimes helps to resolve the issue. He credited me $35 (I would rather have had the sleep, but it's a nice gesture). Recommendation to avoid stands, however, until this issue is resolved.Judging from the outside, I was wondering what I got myself into! I was pleasantly surprised when I walked through the door. Clean, modern and spacious. No cheesy carpet, duvet covers or wallpaper here. It's a few miles from the city center, but only a 5 min drive and they have free bike rentals (4 hours). Great value for the price.My family and I just came home from a 2 night stay at Jaybird's. I did have some reservations about staying here because of the mixed reviews, but it definitely exceeded my expectations for a non-chain hotel. As other Yelpers have shared, the lobby is gorgeous and the rooms nicely decorated and spacious. The room did feel very clean. They are all outside entry, which I usually avoid because of paranoia. The doors need an extra push/pull to be sure they are shut and locked and they do not have chains or those locking brackets that I usually see in hotels. I never felt unsafe, but I thought it was worth mentioning. The beds were very comfortable and I had a great night's sleep. I heard no buzzing (mentioned in another review), but we were on the 2nd floor on the odd side. I did, however, wake up to the dump truck and train on Monday and Tuesday. That is no fault of the hotel, but just know that the outside rooms makes outside noises more noticeable. The Inn is about a mile and a half away from historic downtown, so the free bike rental was an added benefit. We remembered to bring our daughter's little bike, so we were all able to ride downtown together. There are other sites very close to the inn that can be walked to easily, such as the Fountain of Youth and the Old Jail, as well as Fort Menendez. There are Trolley Tours that will pick you up there, too, so there are plenty of options to get around. Jaybird's is not very close to the beach (about 10-15 minutes by car), so if you're planning on doing a lot of beach going, this probably isn't the place for you. They do have a pool, which is small but sufficient. It was very cold, so I don't think they have a heater (unless it just wasn't on). As mentioned by other yelpers, the breakfast consists of waffles, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, and other standard continental fare. We appreciated having that meal to start the day so we could start site seeing earlier than if we went to a restaurant for breakfast. As their motto says, it's for active people. If you are planning on lounging resort-style in the hotel, I wouldn't recommend Jaybird's, but if you're looking for a good night's sleep in a clean hotel after a day of site-seeing and shopping, this is the perfect place!
review_content_20: You will get your money's worth because there are little things that mean a lot -- and there are also little things that you should be aware of. Jaybirds is considered a "boutique" hotel, but that might be because it is not a chain. Beyond the spacious lobby and books and magazines for rent, it's not boutique. The hotel looks more modern on the website than in person.Rooms: It's clear the rooms were updated recently in many ways but more work needs done. Doors are warped, bed frames and headboards make lots of noise and this is a two-story hotel with no elevator. Our A/C blew ice-cold all night, the TVs work, there are plenty of outlets for device charging. And -- not to be overlooked -- our room was very clean. Plenty of towels, nice soap and shampoo. Some rooms have balcony chairs and tables (good for smoking or a nightcap). The King Suites have no views. The windows are high on the wall and are there only for natural light. Otherwise they're bunkers (which isn't all bad).Service: No complaints at all. Everything was prompt from reservation on.Location: It's near a train track. You're going to hear the whistle and train roll through at 7 a.m. It's not "My Cousin Vinny," but you probably won't sleep through it. If you stay at the front of the hotel, you'll get some road noise. Pool: Yeah, well . . . it's located around the backside of the property next to a road. No rooms overlook it. The pool itself is small, has umbrellas for shade and an underneath area for shade. No one would stay here for the pool.Food: Breakfast buffet is less than standard fare (waffles, cereal, muffins, pastries -- no eggs). The restaurant next door is a major plus. It's a classic diner that also does a lot of pizza. Food is good, not great, service is excellent, and there's a full bar.Jaybird's Inn is a small paradise in a sea of shifty looking or overpriced hotels on Ponce De Leon. The rooms are fairly large, very modern, and extremely comfortable. I also really like how the rooms have wood floors which just gives the rooms a styled look, like they really put a lot of effort into making this not be the normal motel you might encounter. The beds are super comfortable, it doesn't feel like a million other people have slept in this bed before you. The breakfast is continental and nothing to write home about but sufficient. There is also the hotel's restaurant right next door that I have yet to try but has great reviews on Yelp.  Overall this place is great and I will absolutely be returning! The only reason it got 4 stars instead of 5 is while there is free wifi here, it's poor and I get a faster connection just leaving it off. Either way, thanks to Jaybird's in for a great stay and a lovely weekend!Fresh, clean and spacious, and newly remodeled with Eco-consciousness in calming colors. Cozy beds and a nice bathroom with a powerful shower. Mini kitchen area with microwave, fridge and coffee pot with Starbucks pods. Some road noise was an issue, but it is a motel, so that is to be expected. Not sure I would stay again as I am a light sleeper.Really enjoyed the free bike rental. Cool lending library and office center in lobby. Breakfast was just ok, mostly bread/cereal, some fruit would be nice: styrofoam is not a good choice for a "green" hotel.Cheers-The hotel staff was not only rude, but outright mean. The room smelled musty and the fitness room stinks. The wireless was out. Highly recommend avoiding this place!!Quite unusual nice & modern interior design, very affordable price :)Truly recommended.I see why there are excellent reviews on Yelp and Trip Advisor. Great place, clean, friendly, cold, comfy. My daughter and I are driving from Fort Lauderdale to South Carolina and wanted to make a pit stop in St Augustine. We found this inn on trip advisor. Glad we took the chance and booked it. Funny story: when we made the first turn into the parking lot, which we thought was the Jaybird, there was a motel that looked a bit run down and we thought "oh it can't be as bad as it looks, the reviews were excellent." We parked and walked around but could not find the office. We then looked across the street and there was the very nice looking Jaybird Inn. Phew.  So glad we pulled into the wrong lot first. We were cracking up and so worried the place was going to be a dump. We drove across the street and told the girl our story. She said it happens to a lot of people and then we were all laughing. The staff here is great!  Close to townI stayed in this hotel three times during biking trips to Saint Augustin. I have been happy with the service and cleanliness of the Hotel, but what has turned me off is that they have shared my cell phone number with marketing companies and now I received unsolicited phone calls to my personal device. When I tried to denied access to myself, they have asked me if I am the person that stayed at Jaybird's Inn on such and such dates and then they go on to offer some special package or prize that I have won. I don't need this kind of aggravation to my personal time and consider this a disruption to my privacy. I will not stay at this hotel again and I am sorry for it. If you do, please be aware of how they handle your personal information.Charming and clean, some tech problems like crappy wifi, and it seemed like the cable would go out every 15 min. The breakfast is coffee, cereal, and self made waffles, these were all good. Beds were very comfortable and the AC didn't smell like musty when turned on, that's a big plus for me. I would stay here again, in fact when in St. Augustine I wouldn't stay anywhere else, affordable, close to everything, and bed bug free ( we looked close with flash lights and magnifying glass)Just OK, nothing special.  Room had a musty odor from the air unit.  Complaint at front desk went unanswered in the four days there.Very clean. Very friendly staff. Lobby has books, coffee, huge tv. Great price. Convenient parking. The restaurant was super close, very friendly staff. We had the lox bagel and we got $10 off from our vouchers. If we are back in the area, this will be where we stop!Walls are very thin and the even numbered rooms have a musty dampness to them. My sister stayed in an odd numbered room (on the opposite side) and it did not have the same issue with smell/dampness. Also loud near the road and had strangely small pillows for a king bed. The price is reasonable, however.We booked this hotel based off a friends recommendation. We were nervous because it seemed like it might be too far away from Old Town. In the end, it didn't matter. The floors was so beautiful, the rooms, blankets, and shower were so clean, and the overall decor was just beautiful. We slept like babies last night, and for $100 I couldn't ask for more out of a hotel! Also, Starbucks for the morning coffee was an extra nice touch! Kudos, Jaybirds Inn!Very cool retro motel that's been redone with all modern amenities. Those who may be dissuaded from staying in an outdoor entrance hotel, fear not. It's away from the downtown scene, so it's quiet at night, unlike staying in a B&B in old town. It's a bit of a walk to the historic center, but certainly doable.Went with the family and we were very happy. Just needed a place to crash one night so we could check out St. Augustine the next day before we continued our road trip. Everything is new and clean. It looks like what it was-- an old motel that's been very well renovated. My kids loved the shower-- it's huge. The price as right and it really was exactly what we needed.Lovely job of upgrading an old motel, rather Euro-style... modern, lots of plugs and USB ports, large accessible walk-in shower, fridge & MW. Free loaner bikes. If you want more than a muffin, pop across to the same-named resto (15% off for guests). Friendly. Location means a bit of road noise and maybe too far to walk to old town for some.I needed a place to stay that was handicap access for my mobility deficit and within a budget. Found it!The Inn is updating rooms and they look very nice. Bed and pillows were really comfortable, they had coffee maker, tea and coffee, and fridge. NiceThe only issue I had was the accessible shower stall did not have a place to put soap/shampoo etc. Accessible showers helps people  like me, who have a difficult time stepping over side of tub and not necessarily have a chair.  The water also got all over the floor despite all efforts to point the shower head different ways and curtain closed.This is the first review I've ever written for yelp, because YES it deserves one! For the price (super reasonable) you get way more than you pay for (around these parts anyways).  I've stayed at five star hotels around the globe, and I'm not above staying in a dump if the price is right, but this place is a win.  The rooms are spacious, super clean, and the floor is tile (not dated), so there is no gross carpet to worry about.  The bathrooms are a little small (walk-in shower good for old folks), but uber clean and stocked with more than enough towels from my son, me, and my hair! They have wifi, a business center, and I plan on renting a couple of bikes (free) from their activity center. The pool, though a little small, has 2 entrances with steps and even has a chair lift for the not so mobile, and it's clean. They also offer a continental breakfast that isn't too shabby, waffles, yogurt, fruit, cereal etc... Other little goodies, they have a book exchange if you run out of things to read while on vacation, they have a wall of books people have left behind for other guests.  You don't even have to leave one or return it.  These business owners took a likely once seedy motel and turned it into a respectable and nice place to stay, they have earned my business and a review!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites St. Augustine-Hist. District
review_content: We had an awesome time. The staff was friendly and attentive to our every need. The bartender was nice, we enjoyed a full bar. Hot buffet breakfast also good and only $12.99. Rooms are spotless. Definitely returning.I do love Holiday Inns.. I've come to expect nice staff, a clean room, and a nice, comfortable bed.Our room was clean.. but that's just 1 of 3 key ingredients.  Clean room is great though; it looked nice and fresh, and spotless.  The staff here is mediocre. They don't give IHG members water at checkin (the little things do count, you know).  They don't smile.. and they're not always at the front desk.. someone should always be there so people aren't waiting around forming a line. The worst part?  The sheets.. soo bad.  Scratchy as hell.  Seriously, I woke up several times in the night just because of those darned awful sheets.  Those are not normal Holiday Inn sheets.. they can't be.  They're tone-on-tone white striped, with 1 green stitch across the top.. and they feel like sandpaper. I didn't take a photo of the bathroom.. It seemed mid-renovation.  Pretty ugly - Mismatched.. I'm assuming that will be fixed soon because everything else was clearly newly renovated, looks fresh, pretty, and clean.I'm writing this review from my phone using its 4G, as there's no internet at the hotel. There's been no internet in the last 40 hours that I've been here. The front desk constantly say the technician is on the way. I think the technician is driving here from California. The front desk staff are not very nice. They aren't flat out rude, but they make it clear calls about the internet are unwelcome. I give them two stars for two reasons. First the rooms appear recently renovated and second the staff in the restaurant are super nice. I highly recommend staying elsewhere.More like 3.5 stars. This place was undergoing a painting session when we booked this hotel so the room smelled a bit funny. The overall look of this hotel is great. The sheets are nice, has updated furniture, and breakfast was amazing for the price we paid. The bed was not as comfy as I thought it would be - kind of hard and I sort of felt the springs a bit. The pillows weren't that bad, but not the best. There was a fighting session with the toilet because it would not flush and it would take forever to flush. We were afraid it wouldn't flush. These rooms need a big bathroom makeover and the carpet was gross. We wore our shoes in the room. The linens were clean and they give you a wipe to clean off the remote which was a huge plus for me. Paid and extra $10 for 2 people for the breakfast which without question is worth it - bacon, cereal, eggs, etc. I thought our stay was OK. The staff was nice and check in was easy. I would not pay more than $125 a night to stay here though. Pretty close to downtown area. You could walk (long walk) but I wouldn't unless you know for a fact that there's not going to be ANY parking.125 night a year traveler. This hotel is very clean and close to the city. The rooms are clean and the service is excellent. The man at the front desk was very accommodating. I am a spire member with IHG so your accommodations may vary. We had a late flight today and he gave us a later check out with out issue.If you were to come here for any reason come to eat Derricks food I hope the management realizes what they have here. The man is a true chef his food is off the charts Roger the bartender  is a real great one also. But did I mention Derricks foodThis seems to be a running theme in my hotel reviews lately: Cheap, clean and convenient. There is a lot to be said with those three C's though when you are trying to save a bit of cash, but still want a decent place to crash. Looks like this location is doing a bit of renovation, and it was looking pretty good! Even better, there were no loud noises or construction happening while we were there. Which, is was a super short stay, as we were only there for a quick sleep. We were down in St. Aug for the night, for some dinner and drinks, and wanted to be responsible adults, so we booked the room and hailed a cab. As I mentioned, room was clean, bed was comfy and I was a little surprised to see Bath and Body works travel size products in the bathroom. (No weird off brand stuff that leaves your hair feeling like straw!) Yay. I think this room was about $60 a night and is fairly close to downtown. If you are a tourist looking for more of a beachy stay... this won't be your spot, but probably about a 20 min drive to the beaches. But downtown is super cool, and only a few minutes away. (I wouldn't recommend walking though.)Absolutely awful experience. Had to book here last minute b/c there was nothing left available in St. Augustine. Now I know why! There is not enough parking to accommodate all the guest rooms. I saw black fungus around the sides of the pool. And then my wife found a mushroom growing out of the carpet in our room!This hotel is definitely not to the quality we normally find in a HI property. It is definitely not in the historic district. We checked in at 8:30 ready for a quick swim only to learn that the pool was "closed for maintenance". We asked how late breakfast was served and were told 11:00 AM. We slept in and were at breakfast at 10:30 to be told that they were no longer serving (other patrons were still eating). Never ceases to amaze me when a hotel spends the money on new carpet and paint and furniture but doesn't bother to replace the bathroom floor. Grout is filthy and TP dispenser is covered in rust. My advice.... Skip St. Augustine and go to Savannah. HI Historic downtown is fabulous in Savannah!I stay here frequently for work and all of the room doors seem to be installed upside down, as each of the handles to the 10+ rooms I've reserved could only be opened by:-tactical training -psychic powers -HoudiniHowever, the cleanliness of the place and the friendless of the staff (thanks Qabid) more than make up for the nightly tug-o-war I have with the door to my room!Their wifi only works in 20 second spurts (then out for 10 minutes), I've been using my ATT WiFi this whole time (3 days straight). There's other reviews about this so they've obviously not taken any action to resolve it (not fix it, resolve it). There are tiny ant-like bugs everywhere. You can tell there's fresh paint on top of nasty doors and walls. The breakfast is not free (this is the only holiday Inn that I've been to still doing this). You can hear people talking in the hallways like their standing at the foot of your bed, crazy loud...maybe the doors don't close properly since being painted over? The comment about the toilets not "flushing" is true, it just sort of swirls around (hope you're not planning a romantic trip). The location is at the very edge of where you'd want to walk from, about 1.2 miles to the edge of the downtown area (don't walk on ponce). In the dark, it looks like a shady area with homeless people popping out of the dark spots. Worst, we booked a king room and they lied telling us we didn't, just to put us in a double queen (they over booked and didn't want to apologize), I have an online booking receipt that says king. The rate was high for comparable holiday inns I've stayed at, but oddly good for this area....which is overpriced compared to spots like even charleston or savannah... Im always trying to convince my wife that holiday inns are great value, but this stay set my argument back a lot. Along with the nasty food (everywhere, no matter the price, it was nasty) this whole trip gets two stars. Sad because there's some nice history here to see. Glad it was only a weekend trip and not longer.I stay at Hampton s all up and down the east Coast ... NEVER NEVER have I been in a room where another bed was put in the room I assume for more money.. You just about had to crawl over the bed to get to another one. ( See pictures) so the story is..A few nights ago I stopped at the Hampton Inn on Ponce de Leon in St Augustine. I asked the rate and because, the rate was reasonable I said great 2 nights please . Later that night I checked my bank account and I saw that I was charged much more than was stated lets say about $120.00 dollars more per night. I called the front desk placed the phone in the room on speaker so that my wife could hear . The front desk Associate said  " I have no problem correcting that" . The next morning I checked the charges again and nothing had changed . I walked down to the front desk and spoke with a Associate that said " he was not working and he would" check on that" later that day I stopped by the desk and was told that he "spoke with everyone concerned and they knew nothing about that rate"  Not to mention this but the room was so small that you had the crawl over the bed to get to the other side of the room. I have stayed at Hamptons for years near have I seen a room like this. So far I am being cheated out of over $100.00 a night and had a cracker box room. If they are doing this to me they have /will do it to other Guests.?STAY AWAYI wish I had taken photos because this hotel was recently renovated/remodeled within the past year or so. Friendly staff, nice sized rooms and great rates all close (1mile) to the attractions. It's a bit farther than other hotels so keep that in mind if  you plan to walk.Picked this hotel because of its proximity to the touristy part of St. Augustine. We weren't more than 5-10 minutes from anything we wanted to see. They also offer a government/law enforcement discount which includes a daily pass to the hotel's buffet. The only reason I'm not giving this hotel 5 stars is because our AC  wasn't working correctly. We walked in the room and it felt like it was at least 75 degrees, but the thermostat said 65. (It was set at that and would not go lower.) We closed our blinds to cool off the room, but it wouldn't get cold until the night time.The TV's are nice with a good selection of channels, including HBO.I'm not sure if this is the case in every room, but our shower/water faucets were set opposite (cold was hot and hot was cold). My husband burned his mouth on the water because we weren't aware of that.The buffet was decent, but I don't think I would have paid $12 for it. The waitress at the buffet was nice and attentive. Perfect for those people wanting to explore and not spend much time in the hotel room.Overall a nice hotel. I've noticed some insects roaming around, some not so small, which isn't good to see. The biggest thing that I can not stand about this hotel is the absolutely terrible internet speeds. Both wireless and wired connections are almost unusable because they are so slow. They advertise "high speed" internet but I can load pages on my cell phone twice as fast without wifi(which doesn't even work on my iPhone, actually makes it slower).The marketing of this Holiday Inn says Historic District, but that is pushing it at best. It is nit walking distance to the Spanish Quarter, so prepare to battle & pay for parking each time you go to the main attraction area. The staff were friendly, but this location needs major work to update its rooms and the basic functionality of the amenities.The hallways smelled of smoke and the breakfast was, well, a hotel breakfast. Kids under 13 eat free, which is nice for families with multiple children. The beds were comfortable and the towels were nice and thick.The wall-mounted hairdryer overheated after ~3 mins of use and the front desk does keep extras for back-up; my hair was awesome for dinner out :/!! Maintenance came by and said they could not do anything because they have a full house. The lights built into the headboard did not work, which is a minor annoyance. The pool was under-filled and probably too warm because of a combination of FL heat and too little water. The ice machine was also constantly empty or not producing ice on the first floor. We reserved a suite because we have four kids. It sleeps six, but when we pulled out the hide-a-bed couch it was broken and ridiculously un-sleepable -- even for a small child. My daughter slept on it in the couch position; luckily we did not have our fourth child with us. For the price, more than $200/per night, I expect a higher level of accommodation from Holiday Inn.I can't  say enough  good things  about  this  hotel. From the  moment  I walked  through  the  doors  and saw the  beautiful  lobby, to the  second great  impression  by George, who is the Manager and checked  us in himself,  set us up  with beautiful  rooms, and proceeded to offer  a  smile and a  hello whenever  we ran into him. The fruit  infused  water was a  very nice touch, the buffet  breakfast  and staff were perfect. There is  not one thing  I can think  of  to improve.  This is by far the best  Holiday  Inn I've ever  seen.  I would  absolutely  return! But most especially, thank you  George.  :-)I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff were warm and accommodating (yay for checking in early), the interior was fresh and clean (newly remodeled), the available Wi-Fi was good, and this hotel was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see. I would definitely stay here again on a future trip to St. Augustine.The cinnamon-apple air freshener in the rooms was overpowering. We were allowed to move to a different room but it was just as bad. Otherwise clean & good location. But seriously the air freshener was THAT bad....I've stayed here twice, both times with our two small dogs. It's not a super fancy place but the location is good (within walking distance of the historic district - like 0.5 a mile away), the price is ideal and the staff bend over backward for you. And if you have pets it's ideal (nice big grassy area next to the property). They also have free breakfast and computers you can use. Love it!
review_content_20: Unlike the other reviewers we thought the hotel was clean and well maintained. Its centrally located to downtown, Flagler College and the historical attractions. Much to our surprise, the breakfast buffet was good. The food was well seasoned and there was a good variety of options. The "concierge" was an uninformed salesperson, she provided no assistance to us. We gained much more information from the front desk agents who were very knowledgeable about the city and its attractions.Not what we expected from a Holiday Inn. A huge mistake on my part doing a on line booking. Pictures are deceiving and the room is Dirty from the carpet to the bed cloths. Even several pieces of the furniture is dirty, surely won't walk bare footed on the carpet. The hall carpet is clean and looks great and the entrance is nice but the room is a dump. The broom closet style room is small enough that one would think it would be easy to keep clean. My first experience was a snobbish one from the desk clerk and the lemon juice that was available was a jar of warm water and a few sliced lemons tossed in for color. First sip went to the trash, that was alone an insult. Pictures show a nice front of the Hotel in actual reality there is an auto repair facing directly in front of the hotel on Ponce De Leon Blvd. The Hotel is directly behind the repair shop like an alley cat hidden from sight except a huge sign that says Holiday Inn and Suites. These pictures on their site is not showing this in the photos. There is a Days Inn next to it has a corner lot with a Denny's  included. Well we are stuck here for four nights and am not a happy camper. This Holiday Inn is not a three star Hotel I would not have given it a one but that was the only choice. Last time I shall stay in any Holiday Inn anywhere, over rated and over priced.This hotel was about a mile away from the downtown area of St Augustine where we really wanted to stay, but it was priced so low that we couldn't make the argument to spend $100 more a night to save ourselves a little walk.  The hotel is gorgeous and the room was very comfortable and nicely equipped with coffee-maker and mini-fridge.  Convenient parking and friendly staff.Friendly staff, good location.Beds were hard and the noise from the next room through the connecting door of a couple in a domestic disupute as well as one of them sobbing all night long made our stay there less than enjoyable.It's on a busy road and not close to the main attractions. It's a long walk to anything worth seeing. My customer experience was an all time low. There are many other quality choices for the money.A fine hotel if you're spending a night in St. Augustine.  Standard rooms, staff was helpful when I needed them, but the location is slightly far away from the fun stuff in St. Augustine (or what I perceived to be fun.  I was only there for a night!).This hotel was nice the room was comfortable.  We got the king jacuzzi tub room, the bed was comfortable and the tub was also great.  The room was clean also.  The tv did Stop working but we didn't really need it.  The staff was very nice from check in to check out.  We needed toothpaste and they gave us a travel sized tooth paste for free.  It is decently close to the historic district, the website made it seem like it was my much closer.  I would come back here If i needed but I would try to look for something more walking distance.Good location, decent rooms. The breakfast buffet was pretty good, but not free. We didn't have any problem with the internet connection.This is your standard Holiday Inn property.  Nothing special or out of the ordinary.  You would want to stay here for the great location.  It is within a 15 minute walk to the historic area of St. Augustine.  The staff was nice and no problems staying here. Some people may prefer a location a little bit closer to the action in the historic district.  But if you don't mind walking and the price is right, this is a great property.3 1/2 stars.  This hotel is in a good location.  It was a short drive to the area with all the cute restaurants and bars.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, which is the most important thing to me when staying at a hotel.  I would stay here again.Too many (loud young) school groups and internet connection just sucks.Clean rooms, great location, nothing special but hey, it's a Holiday Inn.Room was clean and smelled good. Bed was probably the most uncomfortable I have not slept in for a while! Staff were friendly, breakfast was excellent and the location was good. It was a little far away to walk to the attractions but there was a free taxi (tips only) which we used many times. The 'concierge' is a sales rep for RCI - don't get taken in. Overall the hotel was good and not overpriced.I'd agree with 3-1/2.  Very pleasant personnel, perfectly nice  room, good experience.  Nothing particularly high-end or memorable.

hotel_name: Howard Johnson Inn - Historic St Augustine
review_content: Okay look. Let's be honest here. This hotel isn't pristine by any means but for theLocation and price it's perfect. The rooms are very clean and extremely spacious. Yes there is rust in the shower. Yes maybe the hallways are rundown. We have stayed here a half a dozen times and everything is always clean and fresh. The staff is wonderful. The continental breakfast is lovely. The location is awesome. Stay here every time we come to town.If they spent as much time on their rooms as they spent on the front gardens this would be a great place to stay. If, but they don't. The rooms are dingy. The bed was uncomfortable. The bathroom faucets, tub and sink were about coming off the wall. There is no door between the tub, toilet room and sink room. Tile is grungy throughout. This place is in serious need of a makeover. We stayed here for our wedding at the Fountain of Youth two years ago and it wasn't great then. We stayed again for sentimental reasons on 5/18 & 5/19. They started working on the roof at 8 AM on Tuesday! This could be a great place, could be, is not. Needless to say we will not be back.Location wasn't in the heart of downtown but within walking distance of the Fountain of Youth. Both trolley companies (on/off tours) stop at hotel because of a tourist attraction on the hotel grounds. We got a room with 2 double beds. One was squeaky and one was fine. Found dead bug near A/C and a daddy long leg spider in the bathroom. Common I guess. Room was clean and yes it's old but for the price...very reasonable. Closest ice machine broken but one near lobby worked. Didn't try the pool. Continental breakfast was meh with yogurt, cereal and fresh fruit. Coffee was so bad we had to go elsewhere. I liked the orange and apple juice best. They have ice water 24/7 seasoned with orange slices served in 6 ounce plastic to go cups. Housekeeping always happy to provide extra towels or soap. Didn't watch much flat screen tv but did use the wifi. Had to login daily though.This hotel is old, old. This is the historic HJ near downtown, not the other one closer to I95. Rooms have not been renovated probably in 20 years, no kidding. Bed was clean, pillows lumpy foam rubber. Bath tub was stained gray from dirt in the room. Took a shower, walked across the carpet and feet felt dirty. I wiped them off and showed my husband. Told him not to walk on the carpet or set anything on the floor. CARPETS ARE FILTHY. The shower curtain must have been hung by a 10 year old. It doesn't even close on either side because the bar is on crooked. No where in the bathroom to put toiletries as there is only a small sink with no counter space. Towels are hard and scratchy and the size of a small workout towel. But, it is close to the action and downtown. They got you as far as location. But, I wouldn't recommend this place to my friends or family, period. Complimentary breakfast is minimal. Go out for breakfast if you want to eat well. The only cool thing about this location is the 600 year old tree on the property.First off, I would like to say that it was nice we were able to find a hotel on such short notice on a Friday evening. However, it was NOT worth almost $80.To begin with, the room was decent enough. Two beds, and it smelled of bleach which let me know it was clean. What I did not like, was the hair I found in the thicker comforter. EW.The most awful part was the bathroom. A broom closet was bigger than this thing. Being pregnant, I could barely get in there to sit down and every time I tried to stand, I would hit my stomach on the sink, which was LITERALLY six inches away. If that wasn't bad enough, there were no floor mats, or warning signs to let guests know that the floors get EXTREMELY slippery when wet with steam from taking a shower.Because of this, my husband took a shower, and ended up slipping, and because the bathroom was SO SMALL, he fell on his back on the step leading into the shower and hit the wall. The bathroom was LITERALLY 3.5 feet wide and hard to maneuver in. His back is completely bruised and cut up from falling and he was barely able to walk the rest of the day OR day after!!! I thank GOD that he took his shower first, because if I would have had the same luck and fallen, I could have lost my unborn child!When we went to management about this the next morning, she was barely apologetic and didn't even offer to comp the room. She just tossed us an incident report and gave us the hotel business card, instead of maybe putting down the hotel information. I was APPALLED that she didn't comp the room or even give us a bit of a discount after what happened to my husband and how he was obviously hurt(he could barely walk due to being in so much pain!). We will NEVER go back to this establishment EVER. I am tempted to file a lawsuit, but the problem is, I'm more worried about it happening to other people than actually suing. Like I said, what if it had been me, or even an elderly couple and one ended up with a broken hip or dead? Or what if my husband had cracked his head on that step and not hit his back??On top of it all, the "continental breakfast" was just stale cereal and stale bagels with crappy orange juice and metal tasting hot chocolate.NOT $80 worth and NOT EVER worth a second chance! And the absolute WORST customer service!Well, you are located in a great spot and right next to the country's oldest tree. Ripleys Believe it or Not is a short walk and all of this town's best eateries are not a far walk at all. We were greeted with respect and given a quick summary of the hotel. Roughly 30 minutes after we checked in, the front office called us in the room to see how we were making out. They informed us of all the coupons in the lobby we could use during our stay in st augustine. Talk about great service!The room we stayed in was the one king bed, but might upgrade to something fancier next year. The bed is soft and, the room seems clean. Amenities in the room include free WIFI, refrigerator, microwave. One issue was that many of the outlets did not work in the room to charge your cell phone. There is also a nice swimming pool, laundromat, continental breakfast and coffee provided 24/7. For the price, you can't beat it! The room could use a few upgrades. Not the prettiest bathroom, with minor rust, chipped mirrors, tiles dirty. I'm still glad I lucked out in choosing this hotel and would strongly recommend it to anyone who stays in St. Augustine, not concerned with staying in a high end room.This place is a complete and utter crap hole... I didn't make reservations for this place and I would not recommend it to anyone. the toilet seat in my room must be at least 40 years old. The time has not been cleaned out since the previous occupants and they have the nerve to charge over $90 a night. ... I have paid a lot less for nicer accommodations. Looks nice from the outside but leads me back to the old theory of not judging a book by its coverAfter trying to get a room at a less than honest hotelier in the area (read: ECONOMY INN) we drove up here at 2:45am just looking for a place to stay one night since our reservation to Casa Monica was for the next day and we got here a day early. They gave us a great deal that included breakfast. OK so breakfast is only cereal, bagels and some interesting looking oranges, but it tides you over until lunch. It is within walking distance of the Fountain of Youth, and has free parking, a pool and is clean albeit not updated. The one con is that housekeeping walked in without knocking first as we were all trying to get ready. OOOOPS!-Safe.-Clean-Modestly priced; -ADA bathroom available.-Easy to find; on trolley route.Safe.Parking just outside our door. Well lit. Enough folks walking around to feel safe.Clean.Sheets were clean and fresh. Plenty of pillows. The towels clean but well worn but not yet frayed. Beds firm but not hard; slept well. No smoke fumes apparent. Modestly priced.ADA bathroom for 3ppls @$60/+tax/etc. There were other hotels w/ same or a bit cheaper pricing. Bathrooms were updated and easy for ADA needs. Nice heater/fan that helped during crisp morning. Heater worked well and wasn't too noisy during chilly night. Simple breakfast - modest bagel/bread offering, cold cereal, oranges, coffee/teas. Easy to find; on trolley route.Located near downtown but not really walkable to downtown.Trolley is a bit pricey ($25ish/adult for 3day pkg) unless you are staying a few days but there are maps in lobby to aid with public parking. -600yr old oak tree in parking lot (they should really clean out the crotch of the tree - another tree is growing in the debris)-Nice chairs/tables to sit under tree and enjoy the weather.-pool looked nice but it was way too cold for our use-manager was welcoming, informative and phoned over to ask if our room was okay within 10min of our getting situated. Everything was ducky.The Oldest City in the Country, 2 Florida Beaches within 15 minutes or less a Pool ,a Jacuzzi, a great location and a great rate! Oh yeah, did I mention, there is a 600 year old tree in the parking lot? A tree that was there when Juan Ponce De Leon discovered Saint Augustine's famed Fountain of Youth. Sounds great right? That's what I tell myself every year I come back as do many others! Every year while in the pool I talk with people that come year after year from Australia to nearby Jacksonville! Is it a Five Star Hotel ? No? Its a Howard Johnson's! Sure you could pay more than a $100 Dollars or more a night at another Hotel or a stuffy B&B but, why? I would rather spend my money on dining or attraction's. Or the flight.So.... check out the pictures and the facts about this place maybe I will see you in the pool next summer or before....For the price, it was big, clean, and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast was lackluster, but everything was okay for the price.this place was perfect for the price.room/sheets were cleanbathroom was cleanit was nice and cold in the room. a/c worked properly....KEY for florida. this is close enough to St. Augustine to walk but i probably wouldn't. there was a small pool. didn't use it but looked ok.The boy and I wanted to spend a quick night out of town. I looked for a B&B, but most of them were expensive and would not let you book for just one night. I checked out some of the other hotels, but they just seemed too much to spend for one night. We settled on the HoJo after a great rate on hotels.com. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and the parking was FREE! It does have more a motel feel and not so much a hotel feel, but for the price it was fine. Beware - the trolleys do come by beginning at 9 a.m. and might wake you up. You may not be in such a good mood if you are sleeping off a dinner of wine, wine and more wine.Great value for the price! - Room was spacious and clean- Laundry facility convenient- free wifi- free parking- convenient to downtown... and surrounding areas- beautiful historic "Old Senator" tree in the parking lot!- free continental breakfastPerfect place to stay if you're site-seeing in St. Augustine.Reserved a block of 20 rooms for my wedding in September. Signed an agreement stating that my status was definite, that it expires on 8/15/13 if there are remaining rooms not booked and I put my credit card on file to act as a guarantee. Within a matter of days, my whole block was given to "another wedding party that needed additional rooms" and there was nothing available to me. There were 3 reservations already made which I stated not to cancel and they were canceled the same day. I was then told again that nothing was available, only to go online and see a few rooms available for $258 a night. They were charging me $60 a night. Convienently Mumford and Sons just announced a concert that weekend when they cancelled my reservation.. sounds like they just wanted more money! Regardless that is absolutely no way to do business and now I'm screwed out of a hotel for my friends and family unless I want to pay double or more.review due to reservations being cancelled for wedding.Older motel right on the edge of the downtown core. It's really an easy walk to everything you want to get to in St Augustine even if you're an out of shape 40's guy like me. The rooms are good size, clean but not fancy & the AC works but was a bit loud at times. We didn't use the pool but it looked clean, there was a free breakfast of sorts (bagels, muffins etc.) and the trolleys stop right in the middle of the parking lot so easy access if you buy a pass. Overall very good for an economy motel, please note ECONOMY MOTEL. If you are accustomed to the finer things you may want to look elsewhere.DON'T GO TO THIS HOTEL EVER!!! It's nasty, smelly, dingy, grimy, old, inconvenient location. You cant ride trolley without the stickers. Had to drive to old jail anyway. Rooms are disgusting and smelly. The layer of dust on lamps. The heat lamp in the bathroom was useless unless you want to start a fire. I felt like I was in a super 8 motel. Maybe that would have been better. I have stayed in better places for $54 super sale dollars a night! Not worth the money if ur looking for any kind of comfort. Staff was not friendly. The indian guy at the counter barely said a word to me since he was always on the phone that did not sound like business calls. Nights are usually over $90 a night. Please go somewhere else!

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Saint Augustine North
review_content: The room was pretty nice and the bed was comfortable. The place was clean. The maid did not leave us cups for the morning coffee so check to make sure you got all you need before turning in. The breakfast was okay but I personally prefer waffles to the pancakes they had. One word of caution, stay away from the eggs, they tasted spoiled.I stayed at this hotel a number of times and have always been happy with the accommodations and service. It's a few blocks away from the historic district, but I think they make up for it in price and ease of getting in and out very quickly. The rooms are always clerk and are well kept for a typical Florida, high humidity location. Not a bad location, you can't go wrong by staying hereUmmm...weird check in manager! Went out to eat came back in, waiting for elevator he came bye and said hey room # not kool for woman standing alone with take out plate!I always look for details.  The staff was nice, the price was right, the indoor pool was great, the b-fast was OK, the location was fine.  What I did not like and I told them:1.The shower faucet was backwards or plumbed backwards.  When you turned it to cold it was HOT and HOT was COLD -- irritating.2. There was an uneven poured floor straight down the center of the room. It was about 1/2 inch lower on one side than the other.They owners also own the Courtyard down the street.  The project manager did a poor job of checking out the building of this 3 y.o. place.But whatever ... I did not go to St. Augustine to sit i the room!Great hotel and friendly staff. In-door pool and great breakfast. Matter of fact. They have a pancake maker. You press a button and a minute latter, you have two hot pancakes.Oh, yeah! Bonus for me... There's a Comic Book & Toy Show here!!!Clean hotel right off 95. Much nicer than anticipated. Fourth floor room was quiet and a nice free hot breakfast was included. No complaints.Holiday inn express has great prices and alway keep things simple. Decorated really nice..love the metallic flooring and furniture. Hot breakfast is included and tasted great. Service refilling stations should improve though. We had to wait for coffee to be refilled and lines were way too long. Room standard..sort of musty..very cold. Clean though. This hotel good for stopping off the highway.Our recent stay was very much enjoyed.Check-in: pleasant, quick and professional.Rooms: spacious, very clean, large bathroom. Bed was firm (quality), sheets crisp & clean. Bathroom had lots of soft towels, and well laid out. Carpets clean and in excellent condition.We made of the use of the guest laundry. All machines were $2.00 each so stock up on your quarters. VERY clean with no lint anywhere.Complimentary breakfast: large room with a great variety of foods; french toast, scrambled & hard boiled eggs, sausages/biscuits/gravy, oatmeal, cinamon rolls, and assorted cereals. Coffee was fresh. Room attendent was very attention oriented by ensuring everything remained clean & stocked.Check out quick & efficient - just drop off the keys as you walk out the door.Will definately stay here whenever we come through this way again!We were in town to see the Christmas lights and found this reasonably priced hotel.  I wasn't sure what to really expect but I was pleasantly surprised.  It's a new hotel and the rooms are spacious, nice big bathrooms with granite counter tops etc.  The staff was very nice.  The kids liked the indoor pool.  The free breakfast was great.  They had eggs, sausage gravy, bacon, cereal, fruit, fresh made pancakes, juices, bagels etc.  Something like that would have cost a family of 4 at least $40 at a casual restaurant so it was awesome to just go downstairs and enjoy it.I would recommend this hotel to you if you are looking for a nice casual hotel.  I will go back next time I am in town.Standard HIE. nice clean rooms, free breakfast, and good location.  Close enough to the historic district, but cheaper than the HIE in the historic district.Great front desk service and it's located next to a restaurant within walking distance.  Great pitstop on my Southern tour.Very nice hotel for the price.....even during spring break.  Indoor pool was good if you don't want to get sunburned.Very clean and updated hotel, which happened to be conveniently located near our our business in town.  We were the only business travelers though. Wifi didn't work, unfortunately, and my room smelled a bit musty like a locker room until my nose got used to it (maybe this is a southern thing due to the humidity?).Very nice hotel.  Clean everything. Nice Pool.  The internet was soooooooo slow.  I don't think I have ever seen wireless or wired internet that slow.We stayed here for a weekend trip to St. Augustine and this HIE is as good as it gets!  Everything about this hotel is VERY clean and well maintained.  True, that may be because the hotel is relatively new, but nonetheless it made for a wonderful experience.  The front desk staff was extremely helpful and very accommodating.  The room was very well appointed and had a modern flair to it and included a microwave and mini fridge.  The hotel also has a mini market in the lobby that has a great selection of snacks and microwave dinners.  There are also complimentary breakfasts every morning which includes more than the typical Continental Breakfast.  The location of the hotel can't be beat either.  It's right off I-95, directly next to the Prime Outlet Mall (which can be good or bad depending on how you look at it!), and within 10 minutes driving of downtown St. Augustine.  By comparison, the price is a few dollars more than the other hotels in the area, but it's definitely worth the extra $2-3 to stay in a place that's clean, comfortable, and close to everything that matters!  One thing I will say to watch out for is the limited parking.  There seems to be JUST enough parking, and if you come back late from dinner, you may find yourself without a spot.  Luckily, we didn't have that happen to us, but we did take the last spot in the lot at 11:30 pm.  Other than that minor issue, this place will get my business again.  Loved it!

This hotel provides easy access to the outlet malls, Starbucks (very important!) and the downtown area.   We stayed 4 days here for a family weekend.  At first we considered staying downtown but I am soooooo glad that we didn't because the parking and traffic congestion in the historic district and surrounding areas is ridiculous.  The hotel is super clean and new looking. We had a king with a super comfy mattress and very fast free wifi.There is no breakfast included but you can get an overpriced bite to eat at the Starbucks cafe in the lobby.  Cracker Barrel is an easy drive, too.Lastly, the staff was super friendly. The hotel sponsored this free craft night in the lobby.  I thought we had to pay but the couple running it said the hotel paid for the price so we figured, "why not?"  It was a great activity for kids and their middle-aged aunties!  Lots and lots of parking. Free. Easy.If you need to stop on your way up or down I-95, this is a good option.   Location is at the same exit as two outlet malls, 5 miles from World Golf Village, close to a Starbucks and just 6 miles to downtown St. Augustine giving easy access to the many restaurants there.   The hotel is either new or newly renovated with all the features of the latest Marriott Courtyard.  There is no complimentary breakfast but you can order what you like from the restaurant.  The lobby is very large with a TV section and several areas to chill out.Super nice staff, even e-mailed my bill upon request. The room had a really high pitched hum the whole time I was there, which was pretty loud. I turned the tv up pretty high in an attempt to drown it, unsuccessfully. Also, the location of the tv with it's roll out stand made it a really awkward location for watching tv in bed. Otherwise, very nice play to stay. Oh and free wi-fi, which is always awesome!I being a Marriott platinum member I found this hotel to be a little disappointing. Upon our check-in we were met by a somewhat rude receptionist. To make matters worse, we  discovered that our reservations were incorrect and the hotel would not find a way to get the rest of my team on site with a military rate for the duration of our stay. So we all decided to check-out early and move to the Renaissance. The rooms at the courtyard were clean and well kept, with exception of the dirt glasses and ice bucket in my room.This place was phenomenal not only did they have great customer service but the rooms were super clean. All accommodations were met on every level I wish I could have stayed longer however I was in town on business.  The hotel is right down the street from a mall outlet so all needs were met.beautifully decorated. nice kitchenette in room. lobby cafe with good food. right off route 95.Okay, I have stayed at Courtyards and many other brands for many years as a business traveler.  I have to say that this place was very clean and I was impressed with the accommodation and room and staff.Why do I give it a 3*?  1. I don't like the expensive Bistro concept - they used to have an expensive buffet, but the Bistro is really expensive and while nothing was wrong with the food ... the McDonald next door was just as fine of an option.2. They offer NO "free" always available coffee.  Yes, they do "sell: Starbucks coffee for $3.00 a cup, but "no free coffe?" Come on....I've stayed here a number of times. And twice in the past 2 weeks. The suites are large and very quiet. In fact I needed shampoo and was yelling at my husband from the shower but he'd shut the door in the suite between the bedroom and living room and he couldn't hear me. (Or that was his excuse!)I'm weird about germs and wipe down the remote, switches etc when I stay in hotels and the wipes didn't pick up any visible grime from any surface. It's not a super fancy place but it's clean and quiet and I'm always happy with it.This was our first time staying at Courtyard..Room was nice, except for the super hard mattress... spent 3 very uncomfortable nights....like another marriott that we have stayed at, they have a couple of bottles of water in the room.. I thought,, what a nice touch !! Until I saw it was $3.50 a bottle..  we brought our own water.. no free breakfast like so many places have, but that was ok...theres a Dunkin Donuts just down the street. When I gave the woman at the desk my key at checkout.. she just grunted at me... thats ok too... we wont be back !!!!There were two deciding factors for choosing this hotel on our trip to Saint Augustine:1. My husband had accumulated several free nights on his Marriott rewards. 2. This was the only Marriott hotel with rooms available over the new year holiday. What earned this hotel 5 stars was that they serve Starbucks coffee.  And they are the only people serving Starbucks within a million miles of downtown Saint Augustine... or at least within like 40 miles.  My GPS and Yelp search didn't find any other. The hotel was clean and newly remodeled. The staff was great- very child friendly and accommodating.It was less than 10 minutes from all the fun tourist attractions.Pros:Great staff.Beautiful, clean, and spacious rooms.Complimentary breakfast for rewards members.Awesome gym.Cons:Breakfast gets busy and there seems to be only one person taking orders, cooking, and serving.Tv channels are limited.Not much close by within walking distance.Newly decorated, friendly hotel. Convenient lovation with 5 star service. The breakfast was delicious and I appreciated the Starbucks coffee!WOW! Simply loved this place. Great price for what you get. It's a BRAND NEW hotel, everything is new and clean. The decor is modern and refreshing. There is a [modern] asian theme running through the entire place. The front desk is updated and simple. The room we stayed in was very clean, neat, and looked new. The bathroom as well. Service was perfect. Everyone was very nice and helpful.The hotel is located one mile from the Outlets. It's right off of I-95 and it's very easy to get to downtown St. Augustine. Just ask the front desk, they'll give you a map and show you exactly how to get there. Didn't try out the pool or fitness center. They have a bistro open for breakfast and dinner. They serve Starbucks coffee. I really loved this Courtyard. $87 for one night. That is damn good if you ask me [at least for a NEW, CLEAN, and MODERN hotel]. Will definitely come back and stay here.Nice hotel. Newer, clean and nicely decorated. Impressed with the service by the staff at the Cafe. Beds are comfortable and rooms are quiet.This hotel is very clean and close to the outlets. The staff was extremely professional and courteous. I must say that I was impressed even with the manager who asked me if I had any issues or problems with my stay. He wanted to make sure that his customers were completely satisfied with the hotel. Nice dining area in the lobby that stays open pretty late if your craving for a snack or a beverage.We have been coming here occasionally now for several months. The staff is great, professional and friendly. Rooms are always very clean and lobby area also. Some renovation going on now, but they try to make as small of an impact as possible.This hotel is legit, ya'll. I've stayed in a variety of mediocre hotels in my day and for the under $100 a night price point, this is your winner. The location of the hotel is less than ideal for those visiting downtown St. Augustine and the beaches, but for the price I'm willing to take the hit. The interior (of the hotel and the rooms) was beautiful and the front desk staff was exceptionally friendly. Unfortunately, the cleaning staff wasn't so up to snuff and left a note saying they "couldn't make our beds due to a laptop on the bed." Really? REALLY? I understand that people are very nitpicky about their items being handled and are worried about theft, but come on. Somedays all that was done was the toilet being cleaned. Oh well, at least the beds felt like heaven. Otherwise, the hotel was fabulous. The gym is a little small, but they do offer weights and a few cardio machines (all with personal tvs) and it was never busy. The food downstairs was delicious and they offer a nearly full Starbucks menu. Most importantly, the wifi was always fast and reliable!I am proud to call myself a Marriott girl because I always seem to have good luck with them (NO! I don't own stock in Marriott - and I am quick to whine on the rare occasion I do get a bad one).   This hotel is one of the reasons I stay loyal to Marriott.  I usually stay a block down the street at the Fairfield Inn, but I got a better rate here (altho a tad high), so I gave it a try. I am glad I did. It's a pretty new hotel (3 years old) and very well kept. It's conveniently located right off the interstate, and about 5 or 6 miles into downtown St. Augustine. Plenty of free parking at the hotel.The room was very nice, bigger than older Courtyard I have stayed in. The bathroom was very nice with lots of towels, and the vanity was inside the bathroom. My room had a mini-frig, coffeepot, and microwave.The bed was firm and comfy with clean, fresh linens and lots of pillows. There's a workdesk and flat screen TV. There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel. The front desk staff was very nice both when I checked in and when I asked some questions. I have no complaints at all.There is a coin operated washer and dryer on the first floor.This hotel had something different. Rather than the usual Courtyard restaurant with the buffet, this one had a counter where you could order breakfast. It closed at 11 and reopened in the afternoon for sandwiches and such. It was nice, but the breakfast is not included in your rate unless your reservation says it is. I had the breakfast included, and it was made to order by a nice lady who ran the place very well. There were plenty of tables to sit out and the breakfast was delicious! Again, it is made to order. I like this new set up for Courtyards; it seemed very efficient.
