Everything was very clean and new looking. There was a hidden mini-fridge and a coffee maker with two mugs and two travel cups. We thought that was neat. The room had a nice plasma TV, but it's wasted on crappy standard def channels. My biggest gripe overall with the room is that the air conditioner is VERY LOUD. Every time that sucker kicked on during the night it woke us both up. Unfortunately it's still 80 degrees here in FL even with Christmas two days away, so it was kicking on and off a lot. Overall we enjoyed our visit and when we were asleep we were comfortable and cozy. I'd recommend the hotel for a nice overnight, but I'm not sure it's great for extended stays (especially with that daily parking fee). P.S. Beware, they will charge your credit card $20.00 to cover any incidentals you might rack up. We assume this is to cover PPV movies (which run at $16.99 a pop!) but still it's inconvenient to have $20.00 locked up for "3-5 days."Really a nice hotel with a great location.   Parking is $21/day but your vehicle is safe in their underground garage.   Just wish the front desk staff were as helpful and friendly as the valet parking guys. We checked in ~ noon.  I've been a rewards member for over 20 years and just wanted a room with a balcony.  You would have thought I was asking for the the moon.  They finally admitted there might be a balcony room available later in the day.  So, we left our stuff in the lobby and got a call that they had one for us.   They did - overlooking the entrance/parking area...  Won't be back -the other hotels the B& Bs offer more for your money.I got married a few weeks back, and since the reception was held downtown, my wife and I wanted to get a hotel in historic St. Augustine, so we would be able to go out on the town and enjoy our night, and not have to drive anywhere. Like most places downtown (and since it was a holiday), the Hilton required a two night minimum stay, but it was still less expensive than the Casa Monica or other hotels in the area.Check in was easy- the gentlemen at the front desk was VERY friendly and helpful. Room was very, very nice. King size bed, recliner with ottoman, flat-screen TV, HUGE bathroom, and an awesome balcony which looked out over the bayfront. Had an amazing view of the Bridge of Lions and the Castillo, and it was a great way to enjoy your morning cup of coffee.Room was clean, well-stocked with a TON of amenities, and the bed was super comfortable. Pool was relatively small, but looked clean and well-kept. Also had a cool memorial where they had kept steps that was the location where Dr. Martin Luther King Jr was arrested during a protest in the 60's. Nicely decorated hotel that fits in nicely with the downtown historic motif. Price for the room was definitely not cheap, however for the location, the fact that it was a holiday weekend, and it was my honeymoon, it was definitely worth it.Restaurant located in the main lobby, as well as the room service, was pretty pricey, but they offered up some nice food selections- but with all the great restaurants in downtown SA, you shouldn't really bother unless you want straight room service. Parking is mandatory valet, and at $24 a day, that's upsetting to a lot of people- understandably so... also remember parking downtown is a NIGHTMARE and can be VERY expensive if you don't find a good spot, so as long as you're not driving anywhere, it's cheaper and easier to go that route.Had a great stay here- everything I wanted and more. Would definitely recommend for anyone staying downtown- if you're willing to pay the price. There are other hotels up the road, you'll save money, but definitely won't be as nice, and the location of this place can't be beat. My only complaint is knowing that some of my money has made it to Paris Hilton's pocket for some reason, but I had a nice enough stay that even that won't bring me down.

review_content: We stayed here for a long weekend, for my sister's wedding. The inn does have an amazing location! The breakfast was good, but isn't necessarily included with your stay though...you get a credit towards it that doesn't cover all of it. We stayed in room 12 and it was kind of a strange room. The front room with the gigantic jacuzzi and furniture crammed in it was completely useless. The shower was teeny tiny. I will say, the bed was super comfy!!We enjoyed our stay, but compared to other bed and breakfasts I've been to...this one just lacked the charm and luxury.We came to Casablanca inn on the bay for Brunch after a night in St. Augustine. It was a lovely place to arrive at, but there was just Something ... off... Not sure. Our server, Bryan was good. But he wore his sunglasses for every interaction.. except when he dropped the bill off. I ordered the omlette and it was tasty, but the potatoes were cold. The boyfriend ordered something else, and his eggs - which should have had liquidy centers were hard. That was disappointing, but the coffee was good.  What's really sad is that they charged $2.00 for toast.1 star because no high chairs at the restaurant  and no changing table in the bathroom. Breakfast was ok, a little pricey. The restaurant has a hint of dirty. Beer bottles and cigarettes lined the flower beds and the corners of the patio dining area.Had a relaxing stay here. Location is close to everything downtown!We got a "special" for our room at $200 a night (supposedly $269 a night) however I think they say that to everyone.Either way it was an okay price since you get $15 in bar credit per night and $25 in food at their restaurant, Brunch, each day.Overall though, for the convenient location and perks of the bar and brunch place being connected, we enjoys our stay.The rooms were a bit outdated but they have been renovating. We stayed in the Coach house so it was an easy in and out of our balcony to the main road. The bed was a sleep comfort bed and it was comfy! Our room had a jacuzzi in it. It's not a huge one, but enough for two people.Parking is not on site, but they have a parking lot for guest to park their cars for free. It's about a block down. This isn't a problem because once you park you never really use your car anyway since everything is walking distance!This place is also pet friendly. We didn't bring our dogs, but it's always nice to know they have rooms that accommodate to this option.Thank you Sandra for assisting us this weekend!!!This place deserves negative stars! I booked at this place because it is supposed to be a nice waterfront B&B. There is no parking near it. You have to park blocks away in their reserved area. Not only that but there is a huge tree in the middle of it so I had to do a five point back-in turn to squish between 2 cars while avoiding a tree. Now I'm all about saving the trees but get real if you are going to put a parking space there. Service SUCKS!!! This place is run by a bunch of dumb college kids who are more concerned with their social life on the clock than attending to paying customers. Myself and several others got no service after being seated out front and when going inside to the bar to order got yelled at for not sitting at a table. Sorry kids! Tried that! Sat there for 10 minutes waiting for your lazy asses to stop chit chatting at the bar. The room is nice but not secure. Got into my room & housekeeping left the exterior door unlocked so the whole city could walk in. Then went to get ice from the ice machine, and slipped and fell on the tile floor because it was wet due to dropped ice that had melted on the tile and they have no rug in place. STAY AWAY FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY & SECURITY!!!Oh, by the way Cassablanca...thanks for the bruised knees! Thanks to your reckless incompetence I now get to "enjoy" my vacation walking around on 2 bruised sore knees. NEVER AGAIN!!!!Good service and good menu. Great view of the water. Tried the beignets, good but a bit dense. Tried the croque madam which was very tasty but missing the "crunch" of the bread since normally they are toasted but flavor was really good. Nice way to spend a morning in st. AugWe had an extraordinary time at the Casablanca Inn. Beginning with calling late and needing a room and Katie being wonderfully nice, above and beyond, we just loved it. Everything about the place was great.Katie behind the desk and George running the bar were excellent and made us feel very special as guests. The room was great, and cool, and clean. They give you a breakfast credit and a bar tab credit. Additionally, they give you free parking. If you are a bourbon and scotch drinker, the bar has a very good array and selection. I personally loved the decor, woodwork, and art.We read a few negative reviews and noticed they were older. Apparently, if some things had gone wrong before, they were addressed and corrected.Kudos and many thanks to Katie and George especially for the outstanding service, and we will most definitely be back!The Inn is at a great location, maybe the best in St. Augustine. We arrived in our room to a chilled bottle of champagne.  We thoroughly enjoyed sitting on our balcony, out of the traffic and the river of people on the sidewalks, watching the activity. The view of the bay and the carriages across the street was lovely. Our room was great, very clean and well decorated. There is also a "carriage house" in back of the main house where the rooms are literally one step off of Charlotte street and looked like they could be fun to stay in as well. The free breakfast was good:eggs Benedict, potatoes, sausages and pan cakes.The downside: The price. I don't think the normal price is all that bad but due to the time of year and the particular room we stayed in I thought 400.00 was a bit much for what we got. I paid more to get this room because of the "private" balcony. Unfortunately, the balcony is also accessible from other rooms along an out door walkway and because of a broken divider chain, most of the people staying in those rooms thought the balcony was for their use as well. After my husband rigged up the chain again we didn't have anymore unexpected visitors. Also, one of the locks was broken on the balcony door entry and while the maintenance person was made aware of this, he did nothing to fix it. There was a second lock on the door that didn't look too trustworthy so before we went to sleep I pushed a chair in front of the door with a lamp on it which would crash to the floor if anyone opened the door. (My homemade alarm system!). Parking is somewhat inconvenient. The lot is actually about a 3 minute walk from the Inn. But I really didn't mind. It is a very old city after all and things were just built differently back then.  As for the staff, the housekeepers were very friendly ladies. The bar staff on the other hand, were very rude and would practically yell at you if you didn't take a seat quickly.While I actually overall enjoyed staying there this one time and only because of the location, I  will not choose to stay there again on my next trip.We were greeted and given a beautiful table but it took almost an hour for the breakfast to arrive. The menu sounded delicious but the food all arrived cold and frankly, just fair. Disappointing and frustrating. (We didn't stay in the hotel but just came for breakfast....) waitress was lovely but clearly overtaxed by the concept of taking orders and remembering who got what. PS the toast basket sounded like a cool concept but it was boring and cold. Bummer. Oh, and skip the smoked trout Benedict. Gross!What a disappointment. We arrived at the Casablanca Inn and was told that our room wasn't ready. Front desk stated they would call us when room was ready.  Not a problem. We decided to grab some lunch and wait for a call. Four hours later we still had not received a call so we checked back with front desk. They said that the room had been ready for a while but forgot to call. Was given an information sheet for the different amenities at the Inn which including Wifi login. Attempted to logon only to find out the password didn't work. We called the front desk to see if there was a problem with wifi only to be put on hold until we finally hung up and went to the front desk. She stated that wifi password had been changed and she wasn't aware of it until we inquired. Disappointed coffee maker not included in room especially for those rooms not attached to main house. We did have breakfast at the inn. The food was cold and over cooked. Poached egg like a golf ball and omelet was like rubber. The potatoes included in each meal were over seasoned hard and dry. We expressed our dissatisfaction to the server who offered no help to remedy the problem. About the same time we overheard the table behind us expressing dissatisfaction with their breakfast as well. Parking is free however the designated parking lot for the Inn is about a block away. Pick up and drop off is behind the Inn in alley way which accommodates 2 cars at best. We were excited about staying at the Casablanca Inn based on their website however looks were deceiving.Avoid.  This is the first review I've written with this warning.  So much fail in one place.We decided to try this place on a Sunday morning.  The hostess was totally, completely clueless and did not have the first idea how to greet guests, seat them, get them menus, and notify the server that they had a table.  So, after failing to even say "hello" the hostess wandered inside (we were out in the al fresco porch area), then wandered back out, showed us to a table, and wandered away again.  She did not give us menus.  About fifteen minutes later a harried server (not ours, apparently) stopped by and asked if we'd been helped.  "Not yet," I replied.  "Did you seat yourselves?" she asked.  "No."  She bustled off and a few minutes later the hostess brought us *one* menu.   One.Finally our server stopped by.  He asked us what we wanted to drink and if he could bring anything.  "Another menu would be nice," I said.  He told us that a large party had just come in and they had all the menus.  Eventually he brought another one out.I must say, the coffee was good.  That is the one redeeming feature of this visit.The food took a while.  When our server brought it out, he asked if he could get us anything else.  My BF had ordered breakfast, but his toast was missing.  He said, "My toast."  The server turned to get it, then came back to the table.  He said, "I forgot to ask, did you want white or wheat?"  (this was at food delivery!)My hamburger was well done.  I always order hamburgers medium.  I realized the server had not asked how I wanted my meat cooked.  The pickle was dry.  I don't believe I've ever seen a dry pickle before.  It makes me wonder how long our meal had been sitting under heat lamps.My BF did not have a knife with his silverware.  The server did not reappear until we had nearly finished our food.  My BF spread his butter with his fork.I would have complained to the manager but I suspect management, or lack thereof, is the source of the problems.  We will not be back.Heard a lot of good things about this place.  Walked up no greaters told to seat ourself. We got the French toast it was ok but they served with cold syrup (not a fan of it cold) we also got the Cubano it was pretty damn good. Service was ok had to ask for the standards sweet n low, ketchup (cold) etc... Mayo was on the table sitting in the sun kinda scary egg product and all.Champaign waiting in room upon arrival, all the comforts of home and more, and a view of the bay that is to die for. First B&B experience, and we love it here. Super location, close to everything and the Tini Martini Bar and outdoor seating downstairs is hoping at night with live entertainment. $15 credit at the bar each night you stay here. Could it get any better? Probably not.The Casablanca Inn really is very charming. The location can't be beat, free parking, credit at the martini bar, it's fantastic.  The staff were all VERY kind and helpful.  Even at 10:30 at night when I couldn't seem to figure out the AC/Heat combo window unit in my room, the bartender stopped running around to help me.  The con? Room #2.....it's RIGHT next door to the kitchen.  Until well past midnight there were banging dishes, people talking really loud and things being slammed. Outside of my room is a small deck walkway and someone dropped something that sounded like it weighed a thousand pounds, right outside my door.  I was up anyway from a late evening so I ignored the noises, but if you get in early or want a quiet getaway, do not allow this room to be assigned to you.This had to be one of the more interesting experiences out to eat. Took over an hour to get brunch. Eggs and bacon? The excuse was "the cook walked out"... Right... In sure. Anyways bill came and they took 25% off. Really?!?! As someone who runs a restaurant I'm ashamed there was even a check after the long wait and sub par service... No manager in sight.I rented room 5.  I knew it was small and I was ok with that. We had to call 3 times to find where we were supposed to enter, park, check-in. Website said there was a loading zone in front. Nope. I stood in front of the Inn for almost 20 minutes waiting on someone to speak to me.  No one did.  I made eye contact with the same server 3 times. Nothing. I finally walked around the block to the rear where I still had trouble finding a proper entry or signage directing me. Parking was a nightmare. I went in what seemed to be a back door to a bar propped open for ventilation and climb through 2 different parties of people to find the check in desk. I asked that a manager speak with me in the morning about my troubles. The room was advertised with a private porch, which was a small chair, table and ashtray crammed into the corner on the entry stoop, which was slippery from the dripping patio above. (Not as shown in photos) The entry door was in what seems to be the utility courtyard, adjacent to the bar back entry/exit very near the trash. (Assuming since the clanking of beer bottles never ended)  Of the 2 keys only 1 worked for the room. The wood floor has a giant water stain in the entry. The room smelled of mildew and rotten fish.  The bathroom floor wasn't very clean with a rather gross something in front of the shower. No hot water.  The last thing for me was when I discovered the sink doesn't drain.  Gross.  We were here for a grand total of maybe 3 hours, half of which we were gone to dinner.  The 2 staff members I had interaction with were clearly young and immature and in no way deserving of "managing" such a bustling place.  When I went to turn in the keys and say we were leaving I was told a manager who could authorize my refund wouldn't been available until Monday.  You are a bar, a restaurant, AND a bed and breakfast, yet no one with the authority to refund my horrible experience or apologize for it is available until Monday? Glad I live in Jacksonville and the hour drive home was totally worth NOT having to sleep in your establishment or even try your food. (Website says breakfast is included but at check in that's not the case, its a food voucher for their restaurant).  I feel super bad for the people who came and had to endure the farce that is The Casablanca Inn On The Bay Tini Martini Bar Jubilee...We didn't stay at the B&B but in regards to the restaurant, the food was mediocre at best, overpriced and not as warm as it should have been when it arrived at our table. The hostess failed to inform us before we were seated that there was a "backup" in the kitchen and the waitress only told us about it after we had ordered drinks. In case you were wondering, there are no beers on draft at this place and they can't serve liquor on Sunday until 1 pm. The smoked salmon Hemingway eggs Benedict barely had any smoked salmon on it and it was $14. Also, the place had a pretentious vibe. Overall, not a good value for the money.What a romantic place! The bay view is wonderful. I stayed there during the boat regatta at Christmas. I will definitely book a beautiful room there as a,holiday tradition!We spent our last morning in St. Augustine here.  The inside of the restaurant was packed, so we took a risk with the 50-degree weather and braved the empty patio.  The wonderful manager came out and pulled a patio heater next to our table.  He apologized for any slow service and explained that they just underwent a management change and this was reopening day.  Within a few minutes, our server, Rose, came out.  She was great!  Very friendly and cheerful!  The menu itself made it hard to decide what to order, everything sounded delicious.  We had mimosas and coffee with our Pear & Brie Omelette and TABLE Sandwich (tomato, avocado, bacon, lettuce, egg).  The food couldn't be better!  Despite the weather, the restaurant has an amazing view of the St. Augusting fort and bayfront.  This is definitely our new go-to spot for brunch next time we're in St. Augustine!I have to give the manager, Amanda, huge props! After having been given the run around around by a few other B&B's in town I was loosing any hope we'd find a room, but Amanda went above and beyond to help my husband and I get a room at the Inn during the GOTR Stopover this past weekend.  Big thank you Amanda!!! This was our first B&B experience and we really enjoyed our stay. The room we stayed in was cozy and comfortable, almost like we were staying at a relatives home. The bed was a sleep number bed and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in while at a hotel. We had a semi private porch with comfortable chairs and a love seat outside as well. Oh and almost forgot to mention you have actual KEYS to your room. When is the last time you had a key to get in your hotel room!? We just thought that was really cool. Breakfast in the morning was served buffet style with fresh fruit, muffins, eggs, home fries, sausage, blueberry pancakes and a few other things. For beverages you are offered coffee, tea, water, OJ and mimosa's. They have seating on the porch overlooking the bay or inside as well. The staff and chef were great and made you feel welcome to be there.The bonus feature to the inn is the martini bar on site and as a guest you get a $15.00 credit per night, per room to spend at the bar. The bikini martini was my drink of choice during our stay and WOW was is good. They have a huge list of martini's, there is sure to be one to please everyone. If martini's aren't your thing, they also have a good selection of beer. Again, just like everyone else, the bartender and waitstaff at the Tini Martini bar were wonderful. Thank you to everyone at the inn, you have customers for life!
review_content_20: Great location. Great views. Awesome holiday decorations. Amazing customer service. Great value. Delicious breakfast buffet included, plus TWO Mimosas per person, in addition to the $15 drink credit at the in house Tini-Martini Bar. Great art. Good clientele. Very quaint, cozy rooms. Must stay place! I would return.The Inn is on the bay; however, since we were staying one night, they would only rent us the room in their back building. The ridiculous thing is the rooms in both buildings are the same price. Then we got a table at 11p New Years Eve 2014 at the Martini Bar attached to the Inn. Waited 45 minutes to only get attitude from the bartender when we asked if we can order directly from him. Left in time for another restaurants awesome countdown. Since we're staying at the Inn, it made sense to enjoy the martini bar attached but everyone we spoke to for service was standing around saying the same thing, "someone will be over shortly." Interestingly, the Casablanca gave us free drinks as part of our stay. Little did we know the joke was on us, you won't get served. The bartender would only serve the seven ppl sitting at the bar and would ignore everyone else. Definitely the last time we stay here and we come to St. Augustine often.My first B&B and I was quite impressed. From TV shows, I thought they were meant to be boring and very much like staying at your grandmother's house. At Casablanca Inn, it was not what I had expected. My husband and I stayed in the room downstairs and we had our own porch. We had a gate that opened and closed so we had privacy. It was neat to just step out on to our porch and walk on to the streets. Also, our room was very nice and spacious. Our bathroom had a jacuzzi and stand up shower. Also, TV with cable in all the rooms.  Overall, I loved the location for this B&B. I like having the convenience of walking to the nearby shops and bars.Found our stay no better than average.  The location was awesome which was definitely a plus.  Had a beachfront balcony room which was quaint and comfortable.  Had to let hot water run for about 5 minutes in the morning before getting any hot water.  Wifi would not work at all in room 7.  All in all a good stay. Staff was polite.  The biggest plus here is location, location, location. Venue was chosen so as to be with a wedding party.  Would stay again if in the area. But might also shop around as there seem to be many attractive places to stay here. Good visit and I couldn't otherwise berate anything at the Casablanca Inn.We made our reservations here months in advance, two separate stays in one week staying in two different rooms. Our experience here was fantastic both times, but most of our time was spent in what turned out to be our favorite room, room 10 (second floor, southeast corner of the main building).  It had a huge private balcony with chairs and a couch directly above the front patio and overlooking the water. The bedroom is separate from the living area, so if one of you wants to sleep in longer than the other, you can close the door and not need to worry about making too much noise.We were pleasantly surprised by a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us on the day after our wedding.  Free parking for the duration of the stay was also a great benefit considering the Hilton next door charges you $22 a day to park a car there.The Tini Martini Bar downstairs is great as well (I've reviewed this separately). Every day that you stay at the Casablanca, you get a $15 credit at the bar.If you're looking for a great place to stay that's right in the middle of everything, but isn't going to set you back as much as the Casa Monica and still feels more personal than the Hilton, it's worth your time to check this place out.And if you don't mind plunking down the extra cash, the two rooms on the second floor facing the water are the best rooms available.I heart B&Bs!  It was very lovely to stay the night here.  My friend and I drove up to St. Augustine and we read about this place in a guidebook of hers.  We decided to park on the street and then popped in to see if they had a room available.  We stayed in one of the rooms in the carriage house facing Charlotte Street with our own little patio, which we used to people watch, read and write post cards.  The bed was comfy, the bathroom beautiful, very cute room with nice paintings.  Breakfast was tremendously good with eggs benedict and french toast.  Yum!  Parking was included and helpful in a city where a parking spot can be difficult to find.  We didn't have to use the car again until we left the city.  The staff was courteous and helpful as well.  I would definitely love to stay here again with my fh.I normally stay at the St. Francis inn but they were sold out this time, so I went with Casablanca inn. Overall, I enjoyed it. Our room was cozy and they had a sleep number bed that was very comfortable with very high quality bedding making for a good night sleep. We got a bit lucky in that the room next to us was empty two of the three nights so no noise. The final night it was booked and I found I could hear all of their conversation and it was annoying, especially when they started the hot tub at 7 am. I give the Casablanca props for their location and the bar. The location is extremely central and has a great view of the bay. The bar is a fun and lively place for St. Augustine, though I found the price of their martinis a bit high for the quality. A woman next to me ordered a makers mark manhattan, and maybe the seemingly new cocktail waitress was confused, but she said it would cost $17.50 bringing a look of horror to the woman's face. A manhattan at a Manhattan price I guess. The one glaring gap at the Casablanca is food. With the exception of a fairly modest breakfast they really don't make food for their guests. Other B&Bs I've stayed at like the St. Francis really try and excel in this area to create more of an experience for their guests like that of being pampered. The Casablanca didn't show much interest in this area. I had a pretty funny moment at the Casablanca that I got a chuckle out of and its kind of  indicative.  i walked up to the front desk and noticed a tray of cookies next to the clerk. I assumed they were meant for guests since at the St. Francis B&B  there was always something out for guests to treat themselves to, so I asked, " may I have a cookie." The young lady looked at me - paused - and said seriously " oh, I guess you can have one." Detecting her sincere reluctance,  I told her no need if she is that reluctant.  I expected her to correct herself and say, "oh I'm sorry but of course you can have one." instead she remained silent. I'm sure it was all harmless, but I found it pretty hilarious. Personally, I prefer to stay at places like the St. Francis.We've stayed here a number of times through the years and have always enjoyed it very much. This is our first visit back since they've added The Tini Martini Bar. I love everything about this B&B and the staff is so courteous you feel as if you are friends, but I was completely disappointed with the bar staff. I found most of them to be rude and indifferent when we came into the bar a couple of times. This was a surprise to me because we've never experienced this while staying here. I will continue coming to this beautiful B&B because it is simply a lovely place to get away so close to home, but will stay out of their new bar, not a pleasant environment.We stayed in the #30 Secret Garden room & we loved it! I wasnt sure how the lay out was before I stayed here but the Secret Garden is 3 rooms hidden behind the inn & carriage house, you back up to Pizzaleys which is a yummy italian place with great specials & allows dogs to sit on the porch with you as you eat! I liked the seclusion of it all and I'm glad I chose this room. Its more of a small apartment then a hotel room & has beautiful old wood furniture & a huge sleep number bed. I happened to really enjoy the art & like to read so having the porch furniture outside & the sitting area in the room was very nice. The mini fridge was a nice side so we could store our yummy leftovers [the restaurants tend to close early here Sunday-Thursday which is when we stayed].The help is very friendly, the rooms are kept up well, theres maid service every day &  a beautiful martini bar in the front of the bed & breakfast. I'm not an early riser so I didn't get to utilize the breakfast & mimosas they serve in the morning but the snack at 5 was awesome! I was expecting a couple cookies on a table but it ended up being yummy little ham & cheese sandwiches + tuna salad sandwiches, pizzas cut up into small bite size chunks, popcorn, chips & candy.... but the cookies were still my favorite! The only downside I found with the whole place is that the wireless does not reach the secret garden rooms... We rectified this by turning my boyfriends phone into a hotspot but I could see where that might be a nuisance to some... not me though!Room #3, great little place to stay in a town with lots to do! You get snacks at 5, breakfast with mimosas and a bar credit of $15 each night you stay!Stayed here for weekend because it is one of the only B&B's that is right on the bay. Overall our stay was great. The hospitality was superb and the room was clean and beautiful with all modern luxuries. Parking is reserved for you in a special lot they have a couple blocks away - not a big deal. The breakfast in the morning was fantastic. They give you so much food and also a variety of options to suit your needs. The coffee was also great and we also got suprise Mimosas which we didnt know were included. The view is brilliant when you are eating breakfast here. The one star deduction is because of the martini bar right on the front porch (same place you eat breakfast in the morning). Its is very very loud at night and if you are looking for a nice quite B&B to come home to after a long day of visiting attractions, this might be a pain to some. You do get a $15 credit at the bar each night, however we could people talking loudly from our room one of the nights. Overall I would recomend the Casa Blanca as long as you dont mind the noise at night. Ask for a room that is in the back and you will be OK.Stayed here two weekends ago (July 19th or so) and had a wonderful time!  We arrived from Winter Park around 9 pm and were trying to figure out whether or not we should stay at the Casa Monica.  We drove around and ended up down a narrow brick road where the back entrance of Casablanca Inn is located.  The vacancy sign was up so we decided to check out the prices.  I read about the Casablanca Inn on the interweb and went onto the website even before going to the Inn - the website said it was all booked so we skipped out on reserving it online.  Good thing we didn't completely take it off of our list as there were several availabilities when we actually walked in to inquire.  We looked at two of the carriage rooms and selected one of them - they were both set up pretty much the same with a sitting area that faced the cobblestone road where we could people watch while having a glass of wine.  We selected one of the rooms and got an awesome deal on it as we arrived late ($169 for the night - usually $199).  Melissa at the front desk was pretty awesome.The room was great - plasma TV, tub with jets, clean, cutely decorated.  We didn't have loud neighbors or anything so it was perfect.  The room came with a two course breakfast and drink tickets for the in-house bar (the Tini).  We had a couple of glasses of red wine in the evening and enjoyed an beautiful breakfast where we had a selection of egg's benedict, yogurt & fruit with free-flow mimosas while overlooking the bay.  The Casablanca is in walking distance to all the shops, bars and restaurants.  You can hear live music coming from the bars in the area and it's great people watching.  I really enjoyed the staff at the Inn who were friendly enough to stop by and chat with us when we were chilling out on the front porch of our room.  They are really relaxed and I anticipate going back to the Casablanca in the near future.We have stayed at Casablanca twice now. First stay in the honeymoon suite was the best. It's very romantic, comes with a sleep number bed, very cozy and clean. Great staff. The sheets smell AWESOME!!! It's rather expensive, but it's worth it for the romantic bed and breakfast feel. The bar downstairs gets busy at night, but it's never noisy. Definitely recommend this place for a romantic weekend. There is limited parking, so you might have to park a couple blocks away from the place, but they assign you your spot so it's not that big of a deal.Decent for the price. We stayed for 3 nights in a room fitted with a queen size "dial your number" bed. Very uncomfortable. It felt like we were camping on an air mattress. Otherwise, the double jacuzzi was a pleasant addition. Breakfast the first morning was decent. The waitress informed us that they had a supply of soy milk (as we had requested). We were thrilled. She offered us oatmeal, which we ordered with vigor, and then received a bowl of raw oats! The waitress said she had never heard of oatmeal before and didn't know it needed to be cooked! We had to ask twice for our mimosas, and never received drinking water at the table.Our second morning we opted to eat breakfast at a local bagel shop.Our third morning service appeared to have improved slightly, although we played it safe and just asked for Raisin Bran and toast.They seemed to have trouble keeping enough coffee going, as I had to hunt twice for more coffee.At checkin they we're very excited to tell us that we get a $15 credit at the Tini Martini Lounge located on premises. After checking out we noticed that they only applied the credit once, although we had been to the lounge  twice.The service at the Tini Martini lounge was very inconsistent. Our first night there we were greeted warmly and served promptly. Our second night there we appeared to be a bother to both bartender and waitress. Both ignored us and then finally served us begrudgingly. We were made to feel very unwelcome and decided to leave...but had to wait 10 minutes for someone to find the waitress to cash us out.All in all, the location is great...everything else is middle of the road...and avoid the Lounge.OK - first of all, a part of me says that you get what you pay for... Made a quick last minute trip to St Augustine and literally booked this the morning of our arrival after several calls to different inns and hotels who had no vacancy.  They had a few rooms starting at $159 on up to over $200... since we were only staying one night, we figured the small room for $159 would be fine since we didn't want to spend a lot for just one night on a quick getaway.  Well, it was 'fine' but a little 'blech'... we had the Gonzalez Sanchez room which was accessed outside and behind the inn with a small window fitted with an a/c unit.  We had to keep the shades down the whole time as people would have to pass our window to get into the back of the inn from Charlotte St.  So it was dark and cramped.. The carpet showed where water leaked in from the door... whether that day (it was rainy when we got there) or previously, I don't know.  In any case, we were afraid to walk barefoot on the carpet. The old fashioned glass doorknob on the bathroom door fell off as my husband simply tried to pull the door open - it wasn't latched or anything - but the knob fell off as he pulled.  The bed was a double so we expected to be a bit cozy, but it was so saggy that we kept rolling into each other at the center all night... That, along with the on-off compressor noise of the window a/c unit made for a very sleepless night.  Granted, we didn't spend a whole lot of time in our room, but I haven't been in a room like this since roadtripping in college when we'd book a $39/night room off the highway... On the bright side, we did enjoy the little martini bar and the view from the front porch over the bay... based on other reviews, their pricier rooms sound perfectly charming... so be warned - do NOT go on the cheap here unless you want a room where you might expect to find a dead hooker beneath the bed...

review_content: The BEST Best Western we have ever had the pleasure of accompanying. Sherrie was the manager on duty and was exceptionally knowledgeable about the area and places to check out. She was also very gracious in explaining the Best Western rewards program which we were unaware of although we have stayed in 2 locations since 2016. The second floor room was easily accessible from the parking which was also spacious considering the downtown location. The room itself was very clean, modern and overall just a great place to stay. I can't leave out the breakfast, the breakfast was delicious and full of options. Continental style but with a spacious seating area, the menu included cheese omelets, pancakes, sausage, roasted potatoes, a variety of cereals, muffins, danishes, juices and milks. I had more than my share of the chocolate milks and omelets. We celebrated my wife's 30th birthday here and because of the gracious staff and overall great upkeep of this Best Western we had a more than memorable time. Thank you Spanish Quarters staff!On a recent, last minute weekend getaway with my family to St. Augustine we stayed here. Since it was so last minute we couldn't get our normal room at Casa Monica. This place was not a great place to stay at all. I would say the only reason I gave two stars is due to the location. It was close to town, restaurants, historic monuments, and museums all within walking distance. Parking...man was parking terrible. The lot was tiny and it didn't even seem like it had the capacity to hold one car per room. We had three cars between the eight of us and they were not very helpful a the front desk. This basically looks like a hotel that use to be a motel with a slight makeover. That's part of the problem also. The furniture was much too large for the tiny rooms. There was no space between the bed and desk or the dresser and beds. Either way the furniture a size just added to the fact that the room was not very large to begin with. Overall, unless you're extremely desperate and need just a place your head I wouldn't recommend staying here. Plan your trip to St. Augustine in advance to get a better hotel than this in a central location.The staff was fantastic, after an issue with our booking they were nice to enough to give us a discount. The rooms were clean but small. We could never quite get it cool enough for our tastes. Be careful in the parking lot though, it is very narrow, thank goodness we drive a small car. Overall we had a nice stay!This place is great!!! Thank you Jerry! We had pre-existing reservations that fell through and the Best Western came to our rescue! Very clean rooms, the rates are fair and they give complementary breakfast. The location is very close to old town Saint Augustine, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone that wants to be close to downtown.Horrible place don't let the reviews fool you!  This place is terrible should be $29 a night! Tubs overflow cigarette smoke smelling filthy rooms old beat up rooms remotes don't work dirty carpets I almost forgot fridge didn't work either!Sherri is great, she makes it feel like a home away from home. Very close to the old city, and great restaurants.The only saving grace to this hotel is location and cleanliness of the rooms. They advertised free wifi and upon arriving the wifi was not working. They said they would get it fixed and never did. We had to take cold showers because they claimed they did not have an adequate water supply for a full house!! The only thing they were able to do for us was waive the 5$ daily parking fee. One of the worst hotel stays ever, which says a lot for us because we travel the country for 6-10 months out of the year staying in many different hotels.Where do I begin?Okay, we arrived around 4:30 P.M. on Thursday, and were greeted by the manager and desk clerk. They were both very outgoing and friendly, and promptly got us to our room. The manager explained that the hotel is newly renovated and painted and that there is a residual paint odor. When we arrived at our room, he was correct, Very strong smell from a freshly painted door...oil based paint, yuck, but he was upfront about it. The room was in Perfect order, very clean. After some time we acclimated to the paint smell. BTW, the man who painted all of the doors there is a Real Artist...beautiful work. All went well that evening.8:45 a.m. the wonderful sound of a 2 cycle gas blower right in front of our room, but, we needed to get up and get our day underway anyhow. Next thought...COFFEE!I head down to the lobby to grab a couple cups of luscious hot "C", walked up to a coffee "machine", placed my cup under the spout, poured and out comes Light Brown Coffee Colored Water!! WOW!I spoke to the manager about it and his reply was; "Yeah, that's the way it is. I don't drink that stuff either. I have a coffee maker in my office that I use". I couldn't believe it!So I asked, where can I find a REAL cup of coffee? Reply: " Well, there's a Dunkin' Doughnuts about a mile up the road".  Let me just say this: I was rudely awakened, NEEDED, NEEDED a cup of coffee and THIS is what I get???We stumbled out the door in a surreal manner, staggered down the sidewalk, and LUCKILY, right across San Marco Blvd., is a Very Nice french pastry shop with REAL coffee.Okay, so that was that...end of dilemma.We went for a walk in the historic district and had a great time.We came back a little later thinking we would relax and go online for a bit...NOT!During our entire 2 day stay (too long ), the internet did not work properly.I again, spoke with the manager and his reply was..as if canned.." Yeah, sometimes it's like that", but he did reset it.The ladies at the front desk were very apologetic after the next few times, and I believe that they did their best with what they had to work with, which was basically, nothing.We stay at Best Western quite a bit, and were staying this time on points earned from previous stays. I WILL say this, the general manager contacted us after hearing of our dis-satisfaction, and returned the points from the previous night's stay.The staff there are very courteous and try very hard to make your stay a pleasant one. We were basically told that the issue with the coffee machine was "How it is" and apparently they have no intention of changing that, so be warned...plan on getting your coffee elsewhere, unless you like hot water with a splash of coffee.SECURITY ALERT!!!   There is a gap in the curtains at this hotel. I noticed this when walking to our room; when someone is walking along the walkway ( upstairs AND downstairs), they can see basically everything in your room. There is a mirror which is perfectly located so that a person can look into the gap of the curtain and into the mirror and get a full position angle of the bed....NOT GOOD!I brought this to the attention of the night clerk on Friday night. She said she was noting it. Be sure to clamp your curtain so as to avoid this security breach.Again, the staff was awesome and the rooms clean. One can hope for some good coffee in the future, and a change in the attitude of the manager because in MY opinion....When there is an issue, That's just NOT how it is.  :)L.M.If you're looking for a place with a bed and a central location, all for one low & reasonable cost in St. Augustine then this is your place.  This review gets 4 stars simply for being in the right place and doing the simple things well.You won't get luxury but your wallet will thank you for it.  This place is right across the street from Ripleys and the tourism trams.  Down the street within walking distance you have the Fountain of Youth to your left and the Fort and storefronts to your right.There is a complimentary breakfast.  Nothing to brag about but it will save you from walking far and can do the trick if you're in a pinch or not too picky.  Waffle machine, yogurt, cereal, etc.Biggest complaint?  Parking.  The lot is small and kinda hard to find.  If you're coming past the Fountain of Youth into St. Augustine towards the BW and take a right at the light (to the BW), you'll probably think you should pull into the lot immediately to your right after you turn.  Don't.  Even though there is a BIG BW sign there, it's actually the tourism center.  Go down the road a short distance and you'll see the BW on your right.  Weird sign placement.Reasonably priced, and only a block away from the touristy stuffs. Plus their newly remodeled rooms (2013) are clean and comfortable. Would stay here again.Stayed here for 4 nights. Clean room. Very close to the tourist attractions. Nice pool. Great high speed wifi (most of the time). Only negative thing was the tap water smelled pretty awful...had a sewer stench. I'm not one who usually buys bottle water, but I certainly did during my stay here. Regardless, I really liked this hotel and would certainly stay here again if I came back to St. Augustine.One of the biggest reasons we chose this motel was the proximity to the Historic attractions.  The other big draw was free breakfast.   Turns out that the location is good, but the breakfast is not. The area available for breakfast is TINY.  I felt like I was taking tea in a miniature playhouse with seven of my closest friends and neighbors from the other rooms.  The selections for breakfast are awful, with the best thing going being the waffle maker.  Unfortunately, the other customers are waiting in a tiny little line in the tiny little room to use the waffle iron.The parking lot next to the pool is very small and difficult to maneuver in.  (although it is bigger than the breakfast room).Overall, this place will do.  Next time I visit St. Augustine, though, I'll be looking for something better, unless this location has some REALLY special deals going on.BEWARE!  This hotel ends up charging your credit card AFTER check out for "incidentals" that they said they wouldn't charge you for - AKA parking etc...  When I called, the general manager answered and wasn't helpful at all.  He was very rude on the phone and wouldn't even hear my story and continued to say that no matter what I said they were still going to charge my credit card.Just beware that your stay will be more than you think.Pros:1. Walking distance to everything downtown, only a couple of blocks from Castillo and shops.2.  Room was clean and as expected of a Best Western3. Front desk service was friendly4. Free wi-fiCons:1. We were in front of the pool and kids were noisy early in the morning.2. Smokers not smoking in the room congregated outside the pool deck which was outside our room.3.  Breakfast was OK, had a waffle maker and some french toast in a pack that could be toasted but no hot items (I think we got spoiled in Provo, UT)4.  Pool area was very small and hard to maneuver aroundI think one of the best places to stay in the City. It's near everything and there is no need to drive and pay for parking in the city. The rooms are always clean and well stocked. The pool is clean and the staff is very friendly.After staying at this location the past umpteen times I feel like they treat us like family. Also a plus is free wi-fi, in the office the coffee flows till 10pm. IN the morning they have breakfast till 10am, and as many little coffee pods as you can ask for.Downside, no in-room movies, or HBO. Stuck watching very basic cable till the wee hours if you don't bring a portable dvd player.This is a 3 star hotel, but the location is super.  It is right on the train line (both of them) and is within walking distance of the ripley's and the fort, and even the shops.  Staff was courteous and friendly, but maintenance is not there in the evening and night.  We found our phone pulled out of the wall and it wasn't fixed until mid morning the next day. Breakfast was ok.  Facility was clean.  But if you want wifi, forget it.  We were in the room right over the desk lobby, and signal was very weak, and available only about 5 percent of the time -- it was luck to have a signal for 5 consecutive minutes, and then you could spend a long time trying to get it back -- I usually gave up after many failures.  No one in the evening had access to the router to try to reboot it

Fantastic for families!!We stayed with Cap'n Conrad and Crew for 3 nights and loved every moment. From the decor to the pancakes to the game room filled with books and boardgames. The place was quiet, the guests were pleasant, and the price was right!Parking is limited, but that is only because the Pirate Haus Inn is right in the middle of old St. Augustine near the Castillos de San Marcos where the restaurants and shops are. Watch the video!youtube.com/watch?v=HUXT...Pirate Haus Inn is a good choice for staying in St Augustine. I really think the key thing is to be able to park your car and for the most part, not drive anywhere in the downtown area. The Inn is very centrally located so almost anything is within a quick walk, and you can just use the car when you want to see the beach, lighthouse, or maybe a great meal at Back 40 Urban grill.Driving to the place is an interesting experience in itself. I was not clear on the parking situation and when we arrived, everywhere was very crowded with no parking. So we called and were told that they would have a parking space for us. $10 a day is great. Driving down Treasury Street is interesting. Good thing we had a small car.The first experience in arriving the staircase. It is both kinda whimsical and scary, it seems pretty steep. Our daily cardio was going up and down this staircase. We got room 6, the Jungle room. It is quaint. As others have said, you come here for different reasons, and if you are looking for a pristine modern place, you should keep looking. This is really more a hostel turned into a quasi-BnB....sort of. :) It certainly retains a feel of a hostel, I would assume more so with the rooms with shared facilities. There is a cute common area with books and games. An outdoor deck with table and chairs, and a kitchen. The place reminded me more of places I have stayed in Europe.Our room had the bunkbeds, perfect for the kids, though we were initially confused by the bedding. There is a refrigerator. Free wifi that worked well. Limited outlets, so if you want to run something on the bunk beds, bring an extension cord. No tv of course. Bathroom is a bit old but still charming. The tap handles on the tub/shower seemed barely attached. But we had plenty of hot water and everything worked. The owners and staff we very friendly. The guy who runs it (Conrad?) seems a great guy with some interesting stories. We also enjoyed meeting people from around the world, and if we were here without the children, I would have liked to have spent more time socializing. Pancakes were good, Conrad enjoys exploring his creative outlet on the griddle. :) If you do not like pancakes, you may be out of luck, but I think they try to be open to working with you if you wanted to make something else. Coffee is available.We did notice some extra free entertainment from people on the street, but it was not too bad and seemed to get pretty quiet later at night. The AC worked well enough to keep the room at a good temp, specially with the ceiling fan.We could not have been happier with our stay here! Truly a gem! Such bang for your buck! Comfortable, clean, AND CENTRAL! Right in the heart of St. Augustine!.. We didn't have to drive anywhere during our visit! And cheap parking for the 3 earliest birds! The pancakes are good and the bourboney(sp?) makes them even better! We even had what could be considered a tame, little ghost encounter hehehe. But most importantly the staff was great! SO friendly and SO helpful! Oh and they leave chocalate coins on your pillow :)Captain Conrad made us pirate pancakes and gave us grapefruit his neighbor picked and won our undying affection because of it. The place was comfortable and nice and they had community spaghetti dinner night. There is a cute little libraryish living area and people gathered there and played guitars one of the evenings we were there.I loved the location too - right in the middle of everything. I'm going to Florida for spring break in a month, and I was really pushing for us to go to St. Augustine moooostly because of Pirate Haus...The positive aspects of the other reviews of Pirate Haus are accurate, as are the warning that this is a hostel and not the Hilton. While we were at first very tickled with the place, two negatives have bothered us enough to be wanting to record them here.First off, we are long distance cyclists, and we phoned Pirate Haus to find a place to stay, while being blasted by wind and rain out on the trail. The person on the phone did not seem to appreciate our situation, and not only made me pull out my credit card to read the numbers, out in the rain, but warned us that the street was closed in front of the establishment - irrelevant for cyclists.But what we really did not expect was when the same fellow refused to allow us to store our bikes on the large and empty sun deck for even one minute after the rather chintzy 10 am checkout time. We asked if we could do this, the night before, and the refusal really ruined our enjoyment of the remainder of our stay.Finally, the rate we paid for a private room was the same as for some nearby standard motels, and of course here there is no TV, micro, coffee maker, etc. in the room, since there are the communal facilities.We just thought overall that "communal" would include some little consideration of the special needs of some visitors, like us cyclists. This town, after all, is the major start/end point of the well known Southern Tier cycle route. Although breakfast is stated as being available from 7:30 it was still not ready by 7:45. Since we like to make an early start this was a bit disconcerting' The same fellow as from last night was making the pancakes, and had a "what's your hurry" attitude.Pros:1. The staff are awesome...friendly, accommodating, funny, and down-to-earth.2. Family-friendly: quiet times are enforced, staff are great with kids, and place is safe3. Location is in the heart of the downtown area. You can walk almost to all the major attractions and certainly find great food and fun.4. Rooms are large4. Basic essentials are provided5. Great price6. Good wifi7. Hang out room with TV, books, and games exists, but we did not try it out.Neutrals:1. Looks and feels like a hostel. We had a young child (less than 2) with us, so we were not looking for romance at a B&B. So, no big deal.2. Pancakes, coffee, and fruit on one of the mornings were all great, but this is all the breakfast is comprised of. Adequate (if you like pancakes), but nothing fancy.Cons:1. Parking was stated as free on the reservation, but only a few pay spots existed on site and $8/day parking was available across the street (which is pretty cheap for the area). This would have not been brought up, except that our reservation said it would be free.2. Location is in the heart of the downtown area. (Yes, I already wrote this in the pros section.) Harry's restaurant and bar is located a block away and plays loud music all night. One of the nights we were there, they played until 2am. The windows do not block the sound of the music or the people walking by as they leave the area. With a small child this is not the greatest thing to put up with.The staff tried everything to accommodate us (even called the police), but the reality is that this is the downtown area and the bar is allowed to play loud music until they close.Luckily, Harry's doesn't have music every night. Primarily on the weekends, holidays, and school breaks. So, keep an eye on that and you will be okay. If you do not have young children and/or you don't mind staying up late, then this may be a non-issue.Great place, great staff. Second visit here and loved it. Like other reviews, if you are looking for a Hilton, stay at a Hilton. If you want to pay $20 per night and hang out with people from around the world, this place rocks!!I'm sitting in the fish/underwater room right now, kind of sad about leaving this place. It's like staying with your uncle, who's really into pirates. It's comfortable, welcoming, and fun. If you're looking for a chain hotel experience, and you're going to be mad because you didn't read about amenities, don't come here. If you're going to be uptight, don't come here. Do come here if you're into rad pancake breakfasts, hanging out with pirates, and being centrally located, but not broke from just your hotel rates. Do take up Gold Tooth Dave on his Walking Ghost Tour.. Because not only is he a super nice dude, he's very knowledgeable about the history of St. Augustine. I highly recommend this place if you have kids, because they will love it. Thanks guys, we will stay here again!Listen, if you're looking for a Hilton, go to a Hilton and not a hostel. Everyone will be happier! If you're looking for one of the best hostels in the States, go to here! It's location in St. Augustine is ridiculously convenient, firstly. But also, staff has always been super nice and helpful the couple times I've been, guiding me in to find their location (that bit was tricky for me. Thanks, "smart" phone). Last time my partner and I woke up there, a staff member was there, eager to make us pancakes and coffee, even writing my partner's name into hers. I mean, personalized pancakes?! Furthermore our private room was clean clean and really cozy. The pirate decor is everywhere, and each room has it's own theme and really cool mural. Ours was an underwater coral reef scene.Our mattress was ah-mazing. Having worked in two hostels, I can say good mattresses are not typical. Our private bathroom was nice and clean, shower was piping hot. Pirate Haus is a great stop for me every time I head Souther than South, and I've never been disappointed.Either you're going to like this place or you aren't. Used to staying in five star hotels? Head somewhere else. Are you more laid back and just looking for a place to crash at the end of the day? Take a chance on the Pirate Haus.The rooms were huge, the management was friendly, the beds were comfortable and the price was right. Two friends and I stayed for two nights and enjoyed ourselves.The best part of the Pirate Haus is the location. You're within a five minute walk from everything there is to do in the historic district. Cab rides to the beach were $10 for three of us. I would recommend staying in the historic district and cabbing to the beach, not vice versa. The food in the historic district is delicious, and there isn't too much to do by the beach (except, of course, swim). Management was happy to answer any questions and point us in the right direction for food and drinks. I'd stay here again.Located in the heart of Historic St. Augustine, this Inn definitely has character. You can literally spend hours just examining the miscellaneous pirate paraphernalia randomly displayed on the walls. Three of my girl friends and I shared what is known as the "Jungle Room" and man, that's not just a catchy name. As soon as we opened the door we were greeted with a 360 degree jungle mural. Awesome! The room contained a bunk bed and a double bed. When split four ways, it ended up costing each of us $25 - not bad at all!The website boasts an all you can eat pancake breakfast but us ladies weren't ready in time. Also, shirts are for sale! (No, not ours... the Inn's, of course!)FYI - Although this place has a sort of "hostel" feel, it was made very clear to us that it is a family-friendly inn. The walls are paper thin and saying things like "pissed" will get you a talking to (or maybe the manager just didn't appreciate us). Overall, a great place for a very reasonable price!I never stayed at this inn, however I have been inside and I have also experienced the management who owns this establishment and I must say, why go anywhere else, the owner is one of the most laid back but serious guys you will meet. He takes the "Pirate Haus Inn" very serious and it is truly for those who have a pirate in them.It is built in Saint Augustine in the Historic part of the city and this place truly has character.Must warn you though, this place has stairs when you first arrive, it's on the second floor of an establishment, there is a rail that goes up the stairs, so you can take your time to get up the stairs but that is the only way in or out!Loved this place! Family and solo traveler friendly in Historic Downtown St. Augustine. Enjoyed meeting other guest in this relaxed & friendly inn. Cute seeing kids at breakfast wearing their Pirate Pajamas and enjoying Capt. Conrad's famous pancakes! Great coffee and excellent location. Don't miss this place."Arrr!".... almost. Frenchie and I came here while on our extended roadtrip this summer. It was pretty sweet- even though the owner pirate was having phone company issues when we arrived... we got settled.The guys who live and work there are the chillest bunch I've met in awhile and we would sit in the kitchen drinking our "pirate rum" and talking.Eveyone has got that chill attitude.. that surfer-like chilltude.The best parts? Free pancakes- all you can eat. It's right in the heart of St. Augustine.The worst parts? Fleas.. I think. Something bit and itched- and I've heard there's a lot in Florida.Other than that the place was super sweet... complete with Pirate decor and the "arrr"tastic staff.Appreciate the Captain's hospitality and look forward to the chance to give the Haus another chance. All the fundamentals are there for a great experience, location, facilities, fun theme.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites St. Augustine I-95
review_content: Nice hotel, brand new, nice clean rooms AC works a little too well, bathrooms are big and nice.One bad thing, not all the rooms have an in-room safe. I did not care to leave my things at the safe by check in desk.It has an small pool and offers free wifi and breakfast with your stay, wifi works very well and it is fast. The breakfast buffet is really good, it offers warm and cold items, but the dining area is too small for the amount of people that goes to eat there.Overall a nice hotel next to I-95 and very close to St. Augustine.$175 for the night is way to much for this type of room a old mattress and a small room,Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. You saved us from our initial reservation at a seedy "resort" hotel  that looked like it was a scene straight from Cops...We were in town for the Gentlemen of the Road festival and amidst the literal town-takeover, you all kept your cool. were super duper friendly, and offered up a nicely appointed hotel room with all the amenities that we could ask for in an affordable price range.You can clearly tell that this is a newer property and that it is very well taken care of. TIP: There is a small business center located across from the lobby that is a nice spot to print out any agendas, send emails, or hop online. TIP2: This location is also right down the street from an upscale outlet mall that included Kate Spade, Gucci, and Saks.This is a top-notch hotel and great value for the money!  The whole place is pretty new and clean and very classy decor.  The rooms were comfortable and very quiet with firm beds and spacious bathrooms.  There is a small fitness room which was nice.  The hotel is situated next to a cute lake where you can take a stroll around and if you walk 3/4 of a mile you can walk down to one side of the outlet malls.  The hot breakfast was excellent--would probably get a bit boring after more than a couple of days but there is quite a selection--boiled eggs, omelettes, 1 protein that rotates (we saw chicken sausage, turkey and bacon on 3 different days I believe), a hot waffle maker, juice machine, breads and bagels and muffins, cereals and fruit.  The service is friendly and everyone went out of their way to be friendly.  Even the patrons were really kind.  Great stay and great hotel overall!  The only downside is the location--it is off the beaten path if your goal is to hang out in the downtown area of St Augustine as it is a 10-15 min drive but if you don't mind not staying in the heart of things, this hotel is a great deal.Very comfortable, clean and close to the beach and the outlet malls.  Staff very nice.  Rooms small, but adequate. Breakfast like and other for this lower end stay.I would have no problem staying here again.Was a last min vacation and was great the check in was fast and easy. The beds was a great sleep and breakfast was goodGood hotel for the price and location. Clean rooms, the king suites have a fridge, microwave and two TVs. Good use of space. Fast check in. Free breakfast which is standard hotel breakfast fare. Some fruit, breads, oatmeal, and some hot meat/egg items. Coffee is decent. Pool looks private.This location is brand new.  It passed the initial smell test and the smell test in the room.  No odors.  Clean rooms, clean hotel and an awesome breakfast that is included in the price of your stay.  Scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, Fresh(make'em yourself) waffles, sausage patties until you burst.  A great way to get the day started if you are sightseeing in St. Augustine.I was very impressed with the cleanliness and the decore of this hotel and our rooms. It was really great. My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary as we went sight seeing and the bed was super comfortable. We had a king size bed and our room had a little seating area and they also had two tv's in the room. The best feature we liked was the iHome that you can plug your iPod into or in our case oir phone so that we could blast music if we wanted to. Breakfast was great as well! The only reason I didn't give it five stars was because our room was very warm most of the day even when we set the temperature to its lowest setting before we left to go around town. It took all night for our room to cool down as the a.c. unit is controlled by a wall control versus the regular way. So if you don't  want to be hot than I suggest setting the a.c. to low and watching to make sure your room is cooling.LOVED the king suite.  Memory foam mattress was so awesome, my husband and I totally want to buy one now!  Also, the suite was split into two separate areas with a half wall.  Area one was an office desk and sofa bed and chair with a TV, and microwave/fridge.  While the bedroom area had the bed, small closet, and another TV.  The hotel was brand new and decorated in a modern style with shades of green and orange.  The pool and gym looked nice, and made me wish I'd actually packed a bathing suit.  And the free breakfast was fabulous.  Breakfast area as well stocked with a waffle maker, sausage gravy, assorted breads (including bagels and muffins), Jimmy Dean prepackaged breakfast sandwiches, cereal, oatmeal, grits, and toppings for oatmeal (nuts and dried fruit), fresh fruit (apples bananas), light yogurt, regular yogurt, milk, juice, and fruit salad!  GEEZ!  Also, the Wifi is free, and actually quite fast!Will definitely stay here again, as it is close to the I-95, outlets, and only 5 miles away from historic St. Augustine and the beaches.Were very disappointed on our fourth visit to this motel.. The bed was as hard as a board,, pillows like sandbags,, chair and couch in sitting area , very uncomfortable and hard.. what happened??  did you change mattresses since last fall????  we always loved this place....Excellent - hotel must be brand new.  Nicely decorated, clean, and the receptionist was friendly and knowledgable.  Great find for a very reasonably priced hotel!It isn't a top of the line luxury hotel by any means, but thats not what I was expecting of it. You really can't get any better for a mid level hotel. The staff was phenomenal. We didn't get to the hotel until 4 am and even then the guy that checked us in was friendly, helpful and willing to answer questions. My wife has some medicine that needs to be refrigerated, so I originally asked about getting a fridge. He didn't think they had any available. Later, when I explained what it was for they immediately said they would find a way to get us one regardless. Within 10 minutes they had brought one to our room. The rooms are spotless and very modern looking. There is no question of cleanliness or bugs. I couldn't have asked for a nicer, more convenient stay. We also got a room here close to spring break for only $55 a night through Priceline!! The next time I am in the area I will definitely look first at this Fairfield Inn & Suites! No problems or complaints!

Beautiful hotel close to the beach and great places to eat. The room was huge with 2 comfortable queen size beds. The bathroom was so big that it was perfect for 3 adult women to get ready in. Each room has a Keurig but additional coffee is available in the lobby. The hotel was newly renovated with free parking. Only wish was that the pool would have been warmer. The ocean was warmer than the pool. The weekend front desk staff was friendly and accommodating!The hotel was physically appealing. The area is nice as well, although it's a bit out of the way to downtown St. Augustine. Publix, and a couple of restaurants are in the same area, so you can walk to them. The staff was friendly and helpful.It was $160 a night and we were upgraded to a suite for free (Hilton Honors Member). The suite was large - a seating area, desk, TV, sink. A hallway lead to a large bathroom. The tub was peeling a little, but overall the bathroom was in good shape. The bedroom was fine, but the cooling unit was in a small closet in the bedroom and it was very noisy. They have adjustable beds, which allows you to have a firmer or softer mattress. I don't feel that my bed was working properly.Having a balcony was nice, but there was no view from our room.I liked that there was a hot tub, but the pool area and pool itself were small, so it became crowded very quickly.We were so excited to finally be staying in a place with a spa, only to find they have dish towels for beach towels. We weren't too impressed with the maid service, they kinda made our beds? They did the bare minimum. Great location, just right across the street from the beach. Use the flags to cross the street, it's fun! The front desk people were very nice.We had a great time at the Hilton Garden Inn!  Although I can't comment on the breakfast or gym, I found the front desk staff very friendly (Lamar) and the room was great!  We were upgraded to the birthday suite since it was my birthday weekend. I was impressed with the towel animal (like a cruise ship! :P) and the cleanliness of the room in general.  The location was across the street from the beach too which was very nice.  Overall, I would stay at this location again.The fitness center is only cardio machines.The breakfast is probably the worst I've ever had at a Garden Inn. The location is great and the staff is friendly but I'd recommend trying somewhere else.Today I noticed my DL was missing so I called the Hilton Garden St. Augustine Beach where I stayed a few weres ago on Sept. 1, 2015 and recall being asked for my DL at check-in.  I asked for a manager but was told I could only lv a voicemail today for a manager.  Dustin is the person who answered the phone this afternoon.  I told him I believe I handed my DL at checkin and asked whether it was there.  He immediately said "no."  Then he went on to say he wondered where it could be and eventually asked for my LAST NAME.  I told him my last name and wondering how he could say "no" before adking for my last name I cpmmented "that would be a good place to start with my Name."  He broke into bold laughter and I reminded him sternly that "It's NOT funny.  I don't have my Driver's license."  To that he continued laughing and argued with me, "well you're Yelling at me and you accused me of STEALING your Driver's License."  I neither yelled at him or a cused him of Stealing.  I had, though, reminded him of the seriousness of my situation and asked how he could say "no" to it being there b4 getting my name and/or looking for it.  He said he never said "no," yet it was what he answered to me up front and through his constant laughter he carried on another co versation apparently with someone other yhan me in which he further confused things for me by stating (to whoever else, "it's right hear underneath."  Realizing I was trying to talk to a kid I said I had better talk to a Manager (at Hilton Garden).  Maybe it is not there but I did not expect to be treated like this as a Hilton Honors member, etc.Room was clean. Location is ok not great.Front desk was very nice.Con (which we knew before we booked) is there is no breakfast. Continental costs $5 and full made to order $9. Not bad, but...We recommend you head into town and go to Georgie's Diner for a nice breakfast. 3 stars is accurate for this place.This place was just ok.We spent a weekend in the area since we would be heading to Jax for a football game. My husband had hotel points he could use for a free room and so the Hilton Garden Inn was it. It's about 15-20 minutes from the Historic St. Augustine area along A1A which seems to be a long strip of restaurants and non descript restaurants. Reminded me of a deserted beach town.   Anyways, for the most part, the hotel was fine. Only thing that was a semi pain was that our room was on one end of the hotel but the elevator was on the other end. It wasn't a big deal . We ended up finding the stairwell that was closer to our room so we would take that to go downstairs which led us straight to the back exit door where we parked.    The back door of the hotel was secure and entry wasn't allowed without a hotel key.I did think it was odd that there were a trillion throw pillows on the bed. I would probably not stay here again unless it was free or if I was only going to be in town for a night. I'd rather spend a little more for nicer accommodations if it was an extended stay.I know when I book at a Hilton property I'm going to get a good bed and a clean room, and this was no exception.I booked on the Hilton website, which is cheaper than any of the travel sites, and there was a "bed and breakfast" special that was worthwhile.  Breakfast was very good, unlike most of the "free" breakfasts at other places.  I used the hot tub after breakfast.  I had checked it out the night before and didn't see where the jacuzzi button was.  When I went to the front desk to ask, the man behind the counter said, "I'll come out and show you."  That's hospitality.I stayed here for 3 nights and found the accommodations to be fine. This hotel is right across from the beach and about 10 minutes form downtown Saint Augustine. To me, this is the perfect location. Upon arriving we were greeted and were able to get to our room fairly quickly. Sometimes when staying in hotels the elevators take forever, but not here; the elevator was working just fine and I didn't have to wait long at all. Our room was easy to find and when we walked in it was cool and appeared clean. We had to ask for extra towels and they were at our door within minutes. The housekeeping staff were friendly and did a great job. We stayed for breakfast one morning, but I wasn't a fan. I think they had a nice idea with the buffet, but there isn't that much to choose from. I would have preferred a continental breakfast. The service was fine and the food was okay, but I was not that impressed with the choices for a $9 meal. Overall, this is a nice hotel with good customer service. I would stay here again if needed.Bad check in experience had to wait an hour more for a room.  No fans in the bathroom and the beds are rock hard.Customer service is clearly not the manager's strong suit.  Don't waste your time or money here.I'm here for a wedding and the bride is about to wring the managers neck.... You would think a with multiple room rentals that they would have a little courtesy and accommodation.... Ahh no!First, I find the reception room stuffy.  There are about 60 of us stacked in here with a buffet line and dance floor (best description for the blank space in the room). Second the ventilation sucks. The caterer had Sterno for the buffet and we had to open the doors to the parking lot the vent the room. Sterno is a clean fuel, it's should not stink like that.... God forbid someone farted in there... we'd all be dead!Bathrooms were equivalent to a truck stop.  I washed the sink before I washed my hands.  It was gross. TP on the floor as if it was Hallows Eve.We cleaned the reception room up so all the staff had to do was take the trash out and deal with the tables and chairs.
