It seemed that wasn't good enough for them. and that this wedding reception was a burden on the staff.Parking for visitors/reception guest is limited and to the rear of the property due to hotel guest parking..I am surprised by this place as it is a Hilton and for the area. Though this is a tourist area to a specific clientele... this isn't  Orlando and low/middle class tourist trap. For the aristocrats that come to the area, this place is a dump! There is now an ATM.  Thought I saw hot tub, but it didn't look operational.The bride did say she liked the room they had as it was very large and had a full size fridge in it for her and the kids.  And the room the bridal party used seemed spacious BUT, I was surprised by a full bed and a twin...I hate that I have to give this place a two star but ill explain.Ive stayed here before and loved it. Its relativly inexpensive rooms are big and it has lots of amenaties. Its right accross from the beach (5 minutes walking) right accross from the pier ( 5 minutes walking) and right beside the  South beach grill.  A pool and hot tub, fitness room and computer room. so with all these awsome things going for it why could i possibly rate it a two??? I had the worst nights sleep when i stayed there the last time because they apparently switched the beds they use. They now have a bootleg version of the sleep number. After turning the nob all the way down to what should have been a soft matress i still felt like i was laying on the pool patio. It was terrible and i didnt sleep a wink. Myself and my fiance' were both sore the next day and were very tired from a night of inturrupted sleep. im not saying everybody is ganna have this issue but i did. It kinda makes me angry because I like this place so much but now I cant stay there because these new beds suck somtihng awfull. So if it werent for the beds it would be a four star for sure but i cant discount the fact that I woke up feeling like I went two rounds with Mike Tyson.Nice rooms. Terrible service overall. Clearly understaffed and under trained folks working here. During breakfast there was a Person that appears to be management helping clean tables, but doing nothing to aid in customer service.  Our stay here was a gift from our dad. He booked in advace and took great lenghts to ensure we would mot he charged for te rooms, yet the hotel screwed this up and had no wayto fix it.  I've stayed at a number of Hilton Garden inns, but this one seems to be the worst run one I've stayed at.  Hopefully someone in Hilton upper management reads these reviews, as this location is in need of as segment change.  There is no appearent team work going in here and little accountability for customer service. (Even though the elevator has a sign guaranteeing  the experience).  Maybe stay here for the rooms, But patronize one of the local joints for you meals. And certainly look for alternatives.A great value. Great rates, right across from the beach, clean rooms, free bottled water, fantastic & fresh all-you-can-eat breakfast for 8.95, courteous staff.What more could you ask for?We stayed here 3 nights.  If it wasn't for the fact that we have an 8 month old daughter and packing up and moving would have been a hassle, we would have left after the first night.The room itself was nice though uncomfortably hot. The AC is one of those big ones that is super loud and stays on for a few minutes until it reaches the desired temp.  Just went from hot to loud to hot again.  The housekeeping not so great.  We came back to our room the second day, dirty tub, coffee not replenished.  There was shattered glass out by the stairs from the day we got here until the day we left.  The elevator ride up to the third floor on day one smelled as though someone had just thrown up so we used the stairs ever since.  My husband did use the elevator the day we checked as we had a couple of suitcases and yes, still smelled of throw up.  The $9 breakfast is a joke and they actually forgot our order one morning. The cook was actually digging through tickets on the floor to find ours.  Needless to say we didn't stay that day and didn't go back for breakfast the rest of our stay.  The staff are nice enough and good location- restaurant next door is amazing!  But this is the worst Hilton I have ever stayed at. I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member and have stayed at many Hiltons around the world.  This was by far the worst.

hotel_name: Best Western Seaside Inn-St. Augustine Beach
review_content: Melissa at the front desk was so accommodating, going above and beyond to open the pool just so I could drink my coffee outside and not wake my family in the room.  She was friendly helpful and just the best.If sheer lace curtains that do not have an option of closing and cramped parking are your thing,  this is the place for you! The parking situation is that of a college keg party at your rich uncles house in the villa  with construction workers intermingled. The room was cleanly and the bed comfortable but the curtain situation.....if you're into the voyeuristic lifestyle or a serial peeping Tom  then this is your spot because the lace curtains do not close and with the lights on, you can see all goings on in the rooms. The check in staff was friendly, courteous and made an effort to help with the parking situation, the cleaning staff however was overly noisy and almost pushy as far as check out times goes. Who wants to hear the cleaning lady cart  pull up 30 minutes before check out with a hangover? Not this couple. The location is great for tourism, biggest plus. The noisy workers who started what sounded like full room demolition at 8 a.m and the incredibly noisy cleaning staff was off putting. We moved down the street to the next Best Western (Spanish Quarters). We will give this a shot again. (No hangover pun intended).We just returned from a 4 day/3 night trip down to take care if some personal business/ vacation.  The room was spacious with a King size bed, chair with ottoman, desk, dresser, 2 night stands  & a mini fridge in a nice piece of furniture.  The bathroom was large with a pocket door.   The shower had very nice European style tiling in it. The only thing I felt was missing in the bathroom was a hand towel rack closer to the sink for convenience.   The towels were tied in a cute bow when we arrived.   In case you are like me and unsure of where to find your hand towel, it's the bow part :) The staff was very friendly  & helpful in many different ways that made a big difference.( they had a corkscrew for our wine we bought forgetting that of course we don't have one, very helpful with directions multiple times). The free "continental" breakfast included eggs, sausage and/or bacon(if u get there early enough) & waffles, not to mention the usual muffins, Danish & cereal.   It was a very nice spread. The rooms were very clean & cleaned well each day!   My only issue really with the room was the bed was too soft for me.  I have back problems and the bed truly made it worse.  I am a unique situation though. If you are looking for an ocean view, it may be on the second floor.  I personally didn't see an elevator but that doesn't mean that there isn't one as our room was on the main floor near the pool. We would absolutely return here (hopefully they have a firmer bed in a different room so we can )Nice place. We had a king bed bottom floor. Jon greeted us and was efficient and well knowledged of the area. He made recommendations for dining. The room was clean. The floors was a laminated  hardwood appearance with an area rug. Pocket door between bathroom and living area. Definitely will be back on our next visit.Nice room, but an off smell, not bad, but like old/stale water. Breakfast area is cramped space, but negotiable. Staff was polite. Parking is available, but only one way in & one way out. Thankfully staff let us check-in early without an issue. Rooms do block out considerable amount of outside noise. Great places to eat within walking distance. If I were to stay in this exact area again, I wouldn't argue staying again.This place is not worth the stay. Upon arrival the exterior looks nice and  clean. The lobby is also very nice, clean, and friendly staff. Now let's get to the not so good stuff, the room hit us with a nasty musky, damp, and moldy smell. We asked for a room transfer and the new room was worth than our initial one. Since we had already paid, we decided to deal with it. The next day room service cleaned the room, it was clear they did not care about there job, beds were a mess, towels thrown on bathroom counter. Based on the smell alone, we will avoid this hotel and best westerns in the future. The breakfast spread is decent and did have a very nice attendant working it.This place was close to perfect, the best on St Augustine Beach for the money. Reasonable priced, and the staff was great. Especially Cameron. Very accommodating and helpful at check in. The bathrooms were recently updated and clean (always a plus) and the bedding, pillows and beds were great! I highly recommend.This Best Western motel confused me.  Everything in the room was nice but the room itself was not so nice.  Like putting lipstick on a pig, if you will.  I don't have a lot of negative stuff to say other than the fact that the parking lot was tight and I had to Austin Powers my way out.  I guess the front door seemed cheap as it had no heft to it and the walls were very thin as we could hear all of our neighbors.They offer a warm breakfast which is nice but the wifi was abysmal. My wife and I couldn't even update our blog or do more yelp reviews.  We got to spend a lot of time in the hotel since it was raining and it was fine for a night.  I'd recommend the hotel if you aren't looking for anything fancy.  I give the Best a Western Seaside Inn 3 Doubledays.I give 'em a three and a half.  They have hot breakfasts, even tho they're not a Best Western Plus.Extremely dissatisfied. The room smells like a cross between mothballs and mold. A bra was lying on the floor when we checked in (hours after it had been "cleaned") and a used hand towel and wash cloth hung over the hangers next to the sink. The final touch was that the air conditioning unit didn't work and there was no way to circulate air through the room. Front desk staff were friendly and apologized, but said there was nothing they could do.  Because we booked through Orbitz, Best Western said it couldn't even cancel the reservation so we could try to find a better place to stay. Stay somewhere else. This hotel is not even worth the discounted price.This hotel is run by some of the nicest people we encountered during our recent road trip so for them alone I give an extra star. The actual hotel itself for me was probably a 3 star kind of place. The hotel rooms themselves are decent - clean and comfortable and along the lines of what you'd expect from a well-kept Best Western hotel. The location is also pretty nice - in St. Augustine beach, across the street from the actual beach, with a pool, and near several restaurants and bars. But, there are several places right on the beach that you could choose from. And the walls here are fairly thin so if you are a light sleep, or probably even a medium sleeper, you might not get much sleep if you have noisy neighbors. Luckily the nights we stayed no one was noisy past about 10 PM.The do have a regular continental breakfast and free Wi-Fi so those are two more pluses if you needed them. All in all Sir Nicholas and I had a pleasant stay here, but next time I'm in town we would probably be inclined to try a different spot that's right on the beach so we can hear the surf as we fall asleep.Stayed at this BW this past weekend was surprised at how nice the hotel was. The place was very clean and the staff here was great. When we arrived our room was all ready for us and we were able to check in and hit the beach right away. The beach is right across A1A from the hotel, so the only negative to that is the traffic, but people were more than happy to stop to let you cross the street. The hotel itself is pretty nice with a small pool that was perfect for a quick dip when coming back from the beach, the rooms were very clean, maid service here does a great job at cleaning your room and refreshing the supplies, front desk staff is great at making sure you are satisfied and recommending places to go for dinner and other attractions, the location is close to the historical district with a short drive across the bridge to go into town, and of course there is the beach right across the street.In the mornings they have a pretty decent selection for a continental breakfast of juices, coffee, bagels, pastries, waffles, fruit, and boiled eggs. The breakfast area and dining area do get really cramped, but you just have to deal with it. We just grabbed our breakfast items and walked across to the beach for a breakfast picnic. I'll certainly keep the BW in mind next time I visit St. Augustine Beach.I was extremely pleased with this hotel. It was clean, comfortable and located just across the street from the beach. Also, it's in walking distance of several restaurants, a nice gift shop and ice cream shop. The market on Wednesday was a real treat too! I plan to visit again soon!Avoid this place. You can do better. Trust me. Hot tub is broken. Waited for hours to check in and our room still was my ready at 3pm. The manager just shrugged her shoulders. Indifferent staff.  Bad service. They just don't care.While this place doesn't earn top ranking for housekeeping or maintenance, I give it an "A-okay" based on value and the supremely friendly, knowledgeable front-desk staff!  Debra is especially helpful and gives great recommendations for dining out and sight-seeing.  Hotel is walking-distance to beach and near some great eateries!The travel brochures state the hotel has a whirlpool, do not believe it . It has a small round hole next to pool that leaks , is cold, and has two jets that are just regular pool jets. Room was ok. Could not get Internet or cell coverage in our room during the nightMy mom and I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a spontaneous road trip and couldn't have been happier with the result. We had a late checkin and the front desk was very nice and accompodating. Out first room was having problems with the air conditioning (and when you're in FL during July you need AC) and were immediatly given another room. The pool was very nice, a little small, but when you have the Atlantic Ocean right across the street it's not really necessary to have a huge pool. The room was very clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The beach itself was awesome, the water was the perfect temperature and there are entrances every block which makes sure that the beach doesn't get to congested in just one area. The visitors to the beach are all spread out so you're not completely surrounded by yelling kids and cuddling couples. My mom and I forgot our beach chairs and the front desk was nice enough to let us borrow an extra pair they had in their office.Each room has a fridge and a microwave and the shower is very nice. Over all I would highly recommend this hotel.

So I just checked in here, let me just say YES!! Great location and the room is very clean with two queen beds both very comfortable with four pillows each. Large flat screen TV on the wall microwave fridge coffee maker iron blow dryer desk AC free wifi and free breakfast in the AM. It's quiet despite being near a busy road and the staff have been extremely nice and very helpful. Will definitely stay here again!The rooms were absolutely beautiful. Hardwood floors throughout the room and tile in the bathroom, it wasn't what I was expecting at all . When you drive up it look like a generic Days Inn or Holiday Inn, but the similarity ends there, because inside the rooms is where this hotel shines. One top of the great rooms they have a complimentary Country Style Breakfast, and it was amazing. Eggs, french toast, biscuits and gravy, bacon, and sausage. I was expecting your normal continental breakfast you usually get from hotels, which was also available. You will never need to look for breakfast when you stay here. The only down sides, was that the shower head was low flow. Also on the bed there wasn't any quilt or comforter. I like to keep my hotel rooms a bit colder, which is amazing after a long, hot Florida day of sightseeing. But in the middle of the night I had to wake up and turn the temperature up. I know it's kind of my fault but the room was in need of something more than two sheets on the bed.Also you can get pick up by a shuttle for the Old Town Trolly, which I suggest you take. Which is amazing because the parking situation in St. Augustine is atrocious and expensive. I will book this hotel for any future trips to St. Augustine.We stayed here from Wednesday 24th to Friday 26th June. The desk staff were extremely nice and very helpful. Our bedroom was clean, and nice. My only complain is that the beds are NOT Queen sized, but full beds. The breakfast buffet was a hit with our sons, and the banana bread was delicious. Southern Oaks Inn is really good value for money. It's near restaurants, supermarkets and the town.I'd give this place 5 starts, but hey, it's old. The room was very tidy but not quite spotless, and the breakfast was ok but not stellar. I did enjoy my stay though, and you absolutely cannot beat this place for the price!This was my first trip to Saint Augustine and this was the best rate I could find in such a short time (same day, that morning actually). I do travel a lot whether its a friends birthday celebration, vacation in other states, or even for my rugby teams when we have tournaments...I have some experience. For the amazingly low rate, we had an awesome room! Super clean and organized, a mini fridge, a microwave, a mounted tv, and wooden floors! I felt like I might've somehow got an error in my booking by how great the room was. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Also, the complimentary breakfast was more than just a muffin (like my boyfriend expected); they had the works set out for us. I was even happy they had coffee cups with lids to go. I found that to be thoughtful. I am definitely staying here again.I read reviews for this place before I booked it through TripAdvisor and it was absolutely the best bang for your buck. The rooms are up to date with lovely furniture and a flat screen TV. It is right outside downtown St. Augustine, about 2 miles away from all the main attractions. It also includes free wifi and free breakfast buffet (which was delicious). This place is great for families and I highly recommend staying here for your next trip to St. Augustine. I agree with the other reviews, when you look at the outside, it looks like your average cheap motel/hotel, but it really is beautiful inside.Stayed here several times. The rooms are clean and upgraded, staff is very friendly. It was a bit noisy in the room we stayed in this time, but not usually. It's in walking distance from downtown if you don't mind a bit of a walk. They also offer free breakfast, which is nice. I would say this hotel is a good bang for your buck in a decent location and no parking fees!We chose to stay here after reading all the great reviews. I was concerned after finding out all rooms are dog friendly but was pleasantly surprised that the room was extremely clean. I watch hotel impossible and always worry about the cleanliness of the room. I gave this room the hotel impossible clean check. I even checked the filters which look new. The hardwood floors make the room look great but off course also means no dust or even dog pee in the carpet. The pillows looked nice although I will say the white sheets had a few stains from possibly someone's mascara. The bathroom was one of the best I've seen in a hotel. However, We found out the first morning that the awesome complementary breakfast is no longer complementary. They will serve free coffee but none of the food is free. This place is someplace I would definitely stay again especially if traveling with the dogs because they have a fenced in area to let your dogs potty and get some run around time which is great!The BEST place in St. Augustine for anyone on a budget, who appreciates a great continental breakfast, and that doesn't mind biking down town or taking the trolley. 1. It is completely updated with contemporary decor and it is still very clean and neat. 2. You can have your pets here and they have a pet park. 3. There is a trolley stop there which is great, and it is a short bike ride to down town. 4. Breakfast is PHENOMENAL and the best complimentary breakfast I've ever had. Hot eggs, with biscuits and gravy, fresh coffee and people there to serve you. Banana bread, hard boiled eggs, waffles and more. Missed the bacon though. :(5. Quiet...except when people drag suitcases by your room. 6. Downside: It is a bit far from downtown unless you want to bike or take a trolley. It is not walking distance to much so it's a bit far out. I have now been here twice and love it! Great for the person on a budget. The best you'll find for a fair price.I love yo travel and visit hotels. I've always said my dream job would be for someone to pay me to travel around the world visiting hotels and going to concerts. If you know someone willing to pay me to do this holler. Anyways I am here to tell you about my most recent adventure. I had the opportunity to stay at the Southern oaks inn in the beautiful St. Augustine Florida recently. This hotel exceeded my expectations. From the outside it doesn't look like much but oh my the service is top notch.On entering we were greeted by the sweetest ladies who made check in easy and got us directed to our rooms so we could start exploring. Our rooms was wonderful very spacious and clean. Plus it came with two queen beds which was awesome. The room was fully stocked with all the amenities one could need. From towels, to bathroom supplies to my much needed coffee. Plus the bathroom was clean with no mold growing anywhere. that truly impressed me. It's all about the little things. The outside area was also clean with plenty of parking space. the pool was nice it even came handicap accessible with chair lift something most hotels don't think about. also because this hotel is pet friendly they had a dork park for walking your dog.In the morning you are offered a wonderful breakfast. Kimberly our cook and server rocked. The breakfast is better then I have had anywhere it was a full course breakfast of eggs, meat, potatoes, grits, bread, bagels, cereal, coffee, juice and lots more.I have to say this was one of the best places we have stayed at in St. Augustine. Everything was of high quality and the staff was very helpful and friendly. If you ever stay in St. Augustine look them up and oh ask for Caroline at front desk she can tell you where to eat and what to visit she really knows the area. This is definitely on our must return list of hotels.Great price for a very nice room. Great service and great breakfast as well. Highly recommended!Great hotel and very affordable! Our room was very nice and clean. Everything looked brand new. King size bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Mini fridge and microwave in the room was a big plus! The free breakfast in the morning was way more than I expected and was really good! The location was great. Very quiet, not very close to all the people and noise, but a 5 minute drive to everything! I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back on future trips.My husband settled on this hotel after reading many reviews on Trip Advisor and hotels.com. First, if you're thinking of booking this hotel, book it straight through them vs. Hotels.com. We've had numerous problems with hotels.com not booking the correct room (ie had reserved two double queens when we clearly requested king).Beautiful laminate floors, comfortable bed and a very decent breakfast for 'free/inclusive). The room was very clean & comfortable...the Ac was working almost too good. Hubby loved the temperature, I was freezing.The front desk staff was extremely helpful, courteous and genuine. This hotel does allow pets, so if you have allergies you might want to ask for a non pet room! If you want luxury, you're not getting it in a room at this hotel. If you're looking for a 2 - 3 star room you will be very happy (as we were).How is there only one other review for this wonderful little motel! We decided to do a quick escape from the city and drove up to st. Augustine's and landed in this motel by chance. What luck! Is is immaculately clean, and recently remodeled. All the decor is updated and new and the floors are wood. Sooooo wonderful! No stinky old motel carpets! It's run by a lovely local family and they are extremely helpful. They also cook a giant breakfast! Eggs, pancakes, bacon, sausage and so much more! This place was way more than we expected to get for the money and while not on the shaft of downtown, close enough to be convenient! Highly recommend.I don't recognize this place from the rave reviews I've read. Look, it wasn't awful, but it's no 4-5 star place. Our brief interactions with staff - front desk and breakfast, they could not have been nicer. Very courteous and helpful and not just due to training but they seemed to be genuinely nice people. And they're dog friendly. But the room was cold and spartan. Basic. Nothing on the walls, fake wood flooring, minimalist in most every way. This is not to say not to stay there. It's cheap and not a bad location and let's face it, you're not in St Augustine to sit in a hotel room.Speedy and friendly check in. The room reminding me of our apartment at home. It was spotless and was stocked with everything needed. The wood floors were very clean. There was a love seat in the room that was very modern. The location is great, only about .6 miles from the downtown distict. We were very pleased with the price and room. Will be booking again when we plan another trip.The hotel is great for the price and accepts pets! It includes an awesome cooked breakfast. I would recommend it to anyone traveling w pets for an affordable but nice location.If you're a college student on that college budget but still want to go on vacation, check this place out for a wonderful stay! Southern Oaks Inn is awesome! Cleanliness everywhere! Complimentary breakfast every morning - which was amazing, by the way! People working here were extremely nice! I'd definitely return :)My husband and I like to take long two week vacations once a year and we travel by car. So we stay in a lot of hotels. We have found that a lot of the ocean front hotels are very "gross" and just old and not very clean. So this hotel (is not beach side) but about the cleanest I have stayed in so far on our vacation this year. For the price I think it's great. Very clean. And for those pet owners, very pet friendly. It's not much to look at as far as fancy goes, but I'd stay here again.This is the best place I've stayed in an extremely long time. I didn't have to worry about anytihng. When I got there, one of the women were waiting on me (she thought we might be related). Everyone remembered my name and I'm not sure why but it definitely ade me feel great. I booked through travelosity and when I got to the hotel, they charged me at the counter. It turned out that I'd gotten charged twice, When I found out about the charge and called the hotel, the front desk was already taking care of it. I was instructed to call the front desk and speak to a manager the next day. When I called, the manager listened to me and took care of the problem. I got a call back from the manager. He'd fixed the problem. This place was awesome. They made sure everything was great. I didn't have to worry about anything. The floors are made of wood. The air feels cleaner in the room probably because there was no carpet to hold moisture, thus no mold. The shower is awesome. It's a shower only, no tub. The room looks like you'd pay for a more expensive room, which is great because all rooms should look nice. I'm never going to another hotel room ever again when in Staint Auguatine. In fact, that wa the only one I'd been to...as I've never been to St. Augustine prior to my trip. The breakfast is home made. It was a southern breakfast. Eggs, sausage, oatmeal, cerial, home made biscuits (they were so good), milk, orange juce, yogurt...country breakfast. I think this place put a lot of pride into the appearence of their place and I appreciate it a lot.
review_content_20: I needed to book a hotel room for the Gentlemen of the Road concert September 13-14, 2013 with in walking distance.  Most of the hotels in the area were already booked or charging FIVE TIMES the regular rate for the dates of the concert. I always stay at a Holiday Inn Express no matter what city I am in but there was not one close enough. I was pleasantly surprised with how well put together this hotel was being that it was not a major chain! The rooms were well decorated and CLEAN! The flooring in the rooms made such a difference! It was the only hotel that I have been to with a dog park! The reviews I read before booking put me at ease. We checked in after 10p and were met at the door and kindly told what room we could find the service desk person if we needed anything. I ran into the housekeeping staff on several occasions and chatted for a bit, They were a pair a great ladies, very helpful! I noted just a few things that could have helped. 1) there was only one lock on the door. Being that all rooms are accessible from the outside there should be at least a security bar inside or an additional lock that cannot be opened with a key card. 2) There was only one curtain and NO sheer. If you wanted to open the curtains anyone walking by could see in the room. We left the curtains closed the entire time but if a sheer curtain had been there we would've used  some natural light. 3) The water kept going from hot to cold when showering and the hot and cold knobs were installed on the wrong sides. 4) There was no ice machine. This was not a big deal as the housekeeping staff pre made bags of ice. These four things did not effect my stay or impression on the hotel at all. They are just small things I am suggesting for the comfort of future guests. All in all I enjoyed my stay there and would recommend Southern Oaks Inn!

review_content: Location is just a few blocks from the old city, staff was friendly and eager to help, room was clean and spacious. We worried about notice in the Halloween weekend, but it was quite (we express our concern about noise ahead of time, so they put us on the end of the forth floor).One downside: charging $10 a day for parking is lame!Horrible experience with this hotel group. I called late one night to see if they had a room available as I had not yet decided if I was going to be staying in St Augustine that night. They had a couple rooms left. They told me to give my credit card number to hold the room, and I asked if anything going to be charged and they guaranteed me no. Later I called to cancel (and we are talking within an hour of the first call) to tell them I didn't need the room, and again asked if my card would be charged anything, and again they assured me no. Well ten days later I get a charge for the room that night! I called to speak with management multiple times and I was told there only there Monday, Wednesday, and Fridays and they're in and out on those days. I still have not got a call back. Horrible customer service!Stayed here for 4 nights during Thanksgiving. I can't tell you how wonderful the staff was there. Not a sour face. Everyone made us feel so at home. We got to know their names! Their rooms are clean and maintained. Huge thanks to Waneta who was our housekeeper. This amazing woman works so hard every day and hopefully gets all credit she rightfully deserves. Amazing. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to all shops and historic sites. I would not hesitate to return. Oh, and price was spot on! Very pleased.We checked in on Wednesday around 6:00 pm , we got greeted right away and we had no problem checking in and I booked our stay through PRICELINE, and YES there is a $5 a night for parking but it's worth it .We walked into our room and first thing I saw was that the room was clean and updated, my girl told me that the toilet inside could have used a little more scrubbing but it wasn't that bad.We have outlets every where where we can connect what we want and they have two USB connections also where you can charge your cellphones as well.People have been nice, cleaning lady always asks if we need more towels and if I have trash ( like empty boxes and wrapping paper) she tells me to leave it that she would take care of it .Haven't had breakfast here yet, we keep waking up too late but the breakfast area looks clean .Over all our stay has been nice and quiet just how we like it ...I will stay here again for several reasons.It locates at the downtown historical area that all must-go places and restaurants are 5 to 10 minutes walking distance.The hotel is reasonable priced accommodates for family and families. Breakfast is included and parking cost you only 5 dollar a day. ($ 189 before tax for two-beds room. Price vary depends on seasons)Room we stayed was on 4th floor and it was recently remodeled. It is clean and very quite. Bed is soft. Room equipped with mini refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer and free Wi-Fi.Fitness and swimming pool on site. The hotel is not fancy but has all features to ensure a comfortable staying at an economic cost.Stayed here for a 24 hour trip to St.Augustine with some friends (Nov 2014.) The room was clean, comfortable and updated. The staff was friendly. We happen to be there when there was some kind of large, all weekend pirate festival just one block over, and never had any issues with noise or anything despite many drunk pirates residing in this hotel too. :) Plush bedding, upgraded cable package, comfortable layout, plush towels. Nice, comfortable lobby with a large TV, and decent continental breakfast. I don't like that they charge for parking, but in that area, you'll pay a lot more to park in city parking, and staying at this hotel, we never had to even use our car. Location location location. It's a 2-8 minute stroll to several really neat historical sites, as well as St.George street with all of the pubs, wineries, shops, and great little cafes.St. Augustine is really a place where you should stay at a bed and breakfast. But if you are going the hotel rout for whatever reason this is not a bad place to stay. Sure otherwise is a bit over priced if you think of it in terms of what you know about hotels in general, but considering a stay at a B&B in this city is upwards of $175/night (I have only seen a few rooms at that price) and usually with a 2 night minimum, this place is definitely nicer on your wallet. Aside from not being able to get a better deal at other hotels in this area, we also thought taking a 7 mo old to a B&B would be a disaster. Toting a stroller up and down the stairs and crying baby bothering other guests was out of the question. What we didn't want to compromise on was location.The reviews I read about this hotel were all pretty standard. The staff is friendly. The rooms are decent. The towels and sheets are clean, etc. (The only thing I might not try is the whirlpool. While it looks nice, tubs are harder to keep clean in general, and ones with jets even harder. ) What most people might not know is that it is a family owned and run operation. The father owned a hotel on the land and now it has been past down to the son. The staff talked about them fondly which was refreshing.Everyone that stayed there when we did were really really nice people smiling and very courteous. Families mostly on vacation from other states and some international guests as well. Since the town is small, we saw the other guests in town and it was a nice feeling, like we were regulars and knew people. Breakfast is served daily usually between 7 and 10 am. The most modern part of the whole hotel is this breakfast room. This location offers eggs, sausage, and waffles in addition to the usual continental fare. I'm not talking omelettes and grade A meat, but this isn't the Ritz and I didn't see anyone throw their food away and the place was packed. You might also complain about the hours being early, but as previously stated I went with my baby, and he is up by 6:30 like clockwork. While it is fantastic to be in a town where nothing is commercialzed, this also means there isn't a Starbucks open at 6 am, so an early place to go for me was a life saver. Also, the place is full, so whether everyone is an early riser or they just want to take advantage of the food, no one here was disappointed with the quality or offers.My favorite part about this hotel is the location. It is a brief 8 minute walk to the center of the town, across the street from Riley`s, and around the corner from the public parking garage.Overall, this is a good hotel option for anyone looking to vacation in St. Augustine. Just north of the Historic Downtown area, including Castillo de San Marcos and all of the food, drink, shopping and entertainment stores, you can easily drive or walk to all of these from the hotel. The hotel itself isn't the best but you don't feel that they've skipped out on the important items like cleanliness. Because the location is very close to the Historic Downtown area there is a daily parking charge but it's $7-10 depending on if you're staying on a weekday or weekend. Book through one of the online sites like Expedia, Priceline or a membership like AAA and there are discounts. I would stay at this hotel again.If you are looking for a cheap decent place to stay within walking distance to all the fun that is St. Augustine I would definitely recommend this hotel. We had a group of 5 staying overnight and the room easily accommodated our group plus a few others that came to hang out with us for the evening. I arrived earlier than our check-in time and they had no problem allowing me to go ahead and receive my parking pass so I could wander around while I waited for everyone else to arrive. They also allowed our friends to park there while we went to dinner even though they weren't staying the night. I will definitely remember them in the future when I want an affordable place to stay for an overnight getaway.Wow! Moldy smell to our room. When we complained to the staff, they did apologize and referred us to the owners? Email. Never heard anything from the owner, of course. Won't stay there again.Clean, comfortable bed, new, even has a kitchenette! Great price and walking distance to everything. Even served breakfast til 1030am I think. Loved it!! Will stay here again.At the last minute we decided to stay an extra day. $125 AAA rate for a room with a jacuzzi, which we thought was very reasonable considering the location. Very close to downtown. Right next door is a bicycle rental shop, which we availed ourselves of. Lounge chairs for sunning and a pool. Continental breakfast was par for this type of establishment. The jets on our jacuzzi were broken. We asked them to fix it, but didn't get around to it. The gentleman at the desk at check-out was helpful and reduced our rate to a normal non-jacuzzi price.Comfortable, clean, reasonably priced with good service in a convenient location. Good choice for those who don't want to shell out for a B&B.found out about this place through our AAA service. Got a good price with the discount, so I was willing to take a risk.Good:--good price--good location (within minutes walk to main downtown sites)--clean rooms--parking (only $5/day)Bad:--not well decorated in lobby or rooms--very basic--do continental breakfasts always have to be so lame?--I could hear the water pipes all night...oh wellI actually discovered this hotel through their 3D building model on Google Earth. It's a typical new and clean hotel like you would see on the side of I-95, but with an outstanding location within easy walking distance of the Castillo de San Marcos and downtown St. Augustine. (1/4 mile) Free parking, and decent breakfast. I was very satisfied with the room and price, which was only $85 through hotels.com.We have stayed at this hotel about 7 times. While there are down sides....the walls are thin and the breakfast is predictable and average but free, overall it is very much worth returning again and again. We love to walk and it is about a half mile from shops, restaurants and bars. We have almost always been able to check in early and the management is very accomodating. Price varies.....we have paid $75 and $160....just depends on the time of year. Give it a try. Ask for a high room facing downown, the view is fabulous.Clean, comfortable hotel. Walking distance to Historic downtown shops and restaurants. Friendly staff and nice hot breakfast. Pool was small but was not planning on using during the trip.Clean & no bugs! Helpful staff. Breakfast offerings good as well. Close to an old town trolley stop as well as area attractions. I will come back.

I found this bread and breakfast in Trip Advisor and it was listed as the #2 best B&B in St Augustine.  This is our first trip here and as we walked around we noticed a ton of B&B Inns.  There are something like 33.  The owners of The Inn on Charlotte also have a B&B next door called the Hemingway House.  We would have liked to get one of the rooms with the front balcony and Jacuzzi but when we booked there was only one room left.  We were not disappointed. We arrived around 1:30 pm and our room wasn't ready until check-in at 3 but we were able to park in our spot behind the Inn and explore.  The Inn is located in the hub of the city and has restaurants right around it.  It has a large porch to relax on and they always have available water and ice tea along with pretzels and chocolate chip cookies.  They also offer a happy hour around 5 p.m. with wine and beer.  We were immediately welcomed with southern charm and made to feel at home.  We enjoyed the fabulous breakfasts offered at the Inn each morning at 9:15 a.m. and appreciated having our own dining table.  Breakfast can also be ordered and put on a tray to take up to your room.  The time for breakfast worked out well for us, even though we are early risers.  We would get up early and go out to watch beautiful sun rises over the bay and have a refreshing walk, come back for a shower and then down for breakfast.  Coffee and hot tea is available around 8 a.m.. if you wish to sit inside in the living room or outside on the porch or take up to your room.We felt total comfort while staying here and the owners were friendly, accommodating, yet not intrusive.  Our king size bed was very comfortable and the huge spa shower was wonderful.  Our room was clean and comfy with adequate plug ins for laptops and cell phones.We parked our car when we got there and did not move it until we left.  Everything is within walking distance or a trolley ride away. We were there during high season with the Festival of Lights making night walking around town a spectacular light show and festival atmosphere with trolley cars filled with guests singing Christmas songs and having a grand time.We were at the Inn for three nights and are already trying to pick dates for next year.You can not beat the location and if you like people watching get a room with a balcony. The staff are very friendly and helpful. If you like B and B's this is the place for you. The only thing I can nock them for is when breakfast is served. It is served at 9:15 which is good for most but I happen to be a early riser. The food is 5star quality.We stayed in the Anna marcotte room.  This room is perfect.  It offered quietness and your own private entrance.  The location of this inn is in the heart of the historical district.  We will definitely return.We were down visiting family and decided to stay at a B&B in St. Augustine for our first night. One couple had a room inside the house and another had a room out back. We knew what we were in for, since we had booked based on the room pictures on the website. Parking was fine, we never ended up moving the car, as everything is already within walking distance. We all enjoyed the complimentary cocktail hour, light snacks and breakfast! I'd come back just for another breakfast! Hospitality was at its best here.They just purchased the house to the left and will be adding on more rooms soon, so that's a plus!Just got back from a weekend at this wonderful B & B. We were here for a wedding and friends of ours stayed all over town. Throughout the weekend many of them ended up visiting our little bungalow. Needless to say everyone was envious of our quaint room, with whirlpool tub, convenient parking and delicious breakfast and happy hour.  Rodney & Gerry have a great thing going here and we can not wait to book our next trip with them.  Our most difficult decision will be staying here or next door at the sister property they just bought; Hemingway House Bed & Breakfast.Charming. Great front porch. Excellent location.  We didn't get more than 2 blocks away our first night. Rooms are not very large but the living room and covered porch offer space to relax. Breakfast was good both days. Parking was very convenient.The staff is very friendly and the location is excellent. I would definitely recommend the bungalow for anyone wanting a little privacy. Our room wasn't huge but had a whirlpool bath. No complaints.My husband and I stayed here in May of last year on a whim.  It was his first experience at a bed & breakfast and thus began his addiction to B&Bs (he still counts this as his #1).  The owners and staff were very sweet and welcoming.  Breakfast was delicious.  My husband still speaks of how delicious the breakfast was and he's the biggest foodie I know.We stayed in one of the rooms on the second floor with a balcony looking over the street. I highly recommend staying in one of those rooms (the room next to us had a fireplace- perfect for Jan/Feb). It's lovely to sip a glass of wine and just watch the goings on from above, especially during a thunderstorm.  Very romantic B&B...and right in middle of all the action in St.Augustine.  I highly recommend.My wife and I recently stayed at the Inn On Charlotte and it was fantastic.  We stayed in Anna Marcotte's Hideaway and the privacy was wonderful.  The room was very clean and quiet.   The location provided easy access to many restaurants and attractions.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back again.My bride and I decided to take a weekend getaway in San Augustine and thought this was the perfect location. In the middle of downtown St. Augustine, the Inn close to everything. The service was top-notch and the staff provided everything that we needed. The complimentary wine or beer before we went out for the evening was an especially nice touch. Sitting out on the quiet patio in the morning made my morning cup o joe and paper that much more enjoyable. The Marjorie Rawlings bungalow was particularly quaint and made for quiet stay with comfortable beds. The breakfast may have been the best part. Thanks again to the wonderful staff, my wife and I will definitely be back againIt was my first time in St. Augustine, my wife and I decided to get married in the town due to its grace and beauty. We ended up spending the night in the B&B after our wedding. I found all of the rumors my wife was boasting about this place to be true. The beds are like clouds, the rooms are super clean, and the shower was heavenly. But nothing beats the breakfast in the morning. The sausage and eggs make you feel like you are having sausage and eggs for the first time. The orange juice is so delicious. I gotta say that the pancakes with the banana on top was a deliciously nice touch. And the staff is phenomenal, they really make you feel at home.  I recommend this place to anyone. I fell in love with the town, but more so with this place. Thanks guys, I will see you soon.I was just thinking about places in St. Augustine worthy of my time to review and the Inn on Charlotte definitely fits the bill. My memory is hazy and at this point, I can't remember if it was December 2011 or 2010 that my wife and I stayed there. In any case, the Inn is absolutely beautiful, nicely decorated, and in an excellent location. The owners were very nice and liberal with the complimentary wine! Lastly, the breakfast was incredible and they even discussed their homemade pecan syrup with my wife. We'll be coming back here if we can escape town without the baby.We recently stayed at the Inn on Charlotte for a friend's Bridal Shower and Bachelorette weekend. It was the perfect place for a weekend with the girls! The location is central to Old Town and a perfect walking distance to everything! We had the entire Inn to ourselves, and Rod, Ann, and Jerry made us feel comfortable and right at home! When we arrived Friday, we were greeted by Rod & Ann and beverages, light snacks, and cocktails (mandatory for a Girl's weekend!). Rod (a true Southern gentleman) even let us decorate for Bridal Shower games on Friday night! Rod & Ann were helpful and friendly without being overbearing or intrusive, and had great advice on where to go and where to eat in St. Augustine. Breakfast every morning was to die for - the egg souffle our first morning there? UN-believable.  While we found the Inn to be perfect our purposes, it is also perfect for couples, anniversaries, or even small family reunions! Each room was private and luxurious without feeling like we would break something at every turn, and the showers & tubs were truly relaxing. We would definitely stay at the Inn on Charlotte next trip to St. Augustine! Thanks Rod, Ann, and Jerry!We walked into our room and said, "WOW"!  We stayed in Tiffany Suite and the room was beautifully furnished, super clean, really comfortable bed and very quiet.  The breakfast was served at our own table in the dining room, and was yummy!  Oh, and homemade chocolate chip cookies in the cookie jar all the time!Hospitality at it's best.  Our stay at the Inn on Charlotte was outstanding in every respect.  The room (Anna Marcotte's Hideaway) was beautifully furnished, rich with character and charm.  Great location puts you within walking distance of shops, restaurants and experiencing St. Augustine at it's finest. After a good night's sleep in a very comfortable bed, it was great to wake up to delicious breakfast (makes you want to stay another night).  The innkeepers and staff were gracious and made us feel very comfortable and welcome.  We will definitely return and would recommend it to anyone.

Going with 3 stars on this visit. And I'll get you the facts first: 1. This is not an upscale place, but will do if you need a location within walking distance for everything in the downtown historical district.2. Rooms are very small, so if you've got a family, or plan on spending a ton of time in your room, you may want to look elsewhere. 3. Yep, the rooms smell pretty "Florida-y." If you've ever lived by the beach, you know this smell: a little damp, combined with sand and salt. (Even though the location is on the bay.) It didn't bother me, but if you are sensitive to this type of thing, bring some air freshener. 4. Bed was a little hard, but I prefer them a bit firmer. And no down pillows here, so bring your own if that's what you like. 5. The internet connect is like everyone says.... not reliable and in and out. I think I had to log in again probably 15 times during our 2 day stay, so if you've got work to do, bring an air card or a router from home. We attempted HBO GO one night, and it was pretty much a disaster. Ok, now to expand of some things. This hotel has a DEDICATED PARKING LOT! In this area, this feature is HUGE, no fighting for street parking, running out to feed meters, or parking blocks away, as some locations in this area will have you do. Yes, the rooms are dated, but definitely not the worst I've seen. The bathrooms are also small, but have been redone.They have a pool! After being in a super hot bridesmaid dress all day, and dancing up a storm at the wedding we were in town for, a cool dip was the absolute perfect way to cool down after a long day. (Pool is open until 10 PM.) The customer service was super, super friendly! The doors are pretty sturdy and heavy, so when we accidentally locked ourselves out, twice in 15 minutes, they were really awesome about getting us a replacement key(s) pretty quick. They do offer a continental breakfast, but we didn't partake. If you want an awesome continental breakfast, stay at a B&B. They do offer coffee and tea, so we did take them up on that. All in all, is it glamorous? Hell no. Will it do in a pinch? Yes. Would I stay here again? Yup, especially due to that designated parking lot and proximity to all the things you'll probably want to do/and see in the area. And the pricing is a little bit more reasonable than other options in the area.I was hesitant to book this hotel based on reviews but was in town for one night for a wedding . This hotel was booked solely due to the location because it was around the corner from the wedding venue.  I will be honest. Upon seeing the hotel for the first time, it made me think of a glorified Days Inn. The definitely pros to this Inn are the location and a dedicated parking lot which is complimentary so I will give them that. The hotel room itself is small but has all the necessities you will need. I personally wouldn't stay here longer than one night but that is my personal opinion.   Also, don't expect to get any peace and quiet. The walls are paper thin. I could hear children screaming and running outside . And someone peeing upstairs. Grosssssss. Don't be fooled by the website. The beach is across the street. You're not on the beach. My view was the asphalt parking lot. Now for the "highlight" of my stay. After coming back to my room late after attending the wedding, I noticed that there was a gurgling sound coming from the sink. I really didn't think anything of it until I walked over and noticed water coming up from the drain and it kept going and overflowed . I had to race to move all my toiletries and makeup. And the water was murky with brown particles. NOT COOL. Disgusting to be honest.  I called the front desk and the poor guy that came out was great. He cleaned up the mess and checked the sink, toilet and bathtub but he wasn't a plumber so I didn't really get any solid answers. Except that they are having plumbing issues and having work done . Which basically infuriates me since this room should never have been booked. And to add insult, they didn't have any vacant rooms to move me to.   So I sucked it up and stayed. But was leery about using the sink/toilet, etc for fear that water would come up out of nowhere.  The next morning, upon inspection of the shower I noticed hair in there. The attention to detail with cleaning was not up to standards. I met other guests at the wedding who stayed here and had similar stories (thankfully no flooding issues). I think for a hotel where I am paying over $200 a night, this is unacceptable. And to add insult, the poor woman at the front desk could only offer me a $30 credit to my card (plus tax). Yep, not satisfied.I wouldn't recommend this hotel and if you do want to chance it, bring Clorox wipes and don't have high expectations.HORRIFIC!!!!! NOT KID FRIENDLY!!!!!!!!Place is outdated.....made out of straw. You cannot walk around after 10pm because the downstairs tenant will complain.. Offered free breakfast but the breakfast lady was very angry whenever you would approach the breakfast counter. If you even think of going for seconds you will be charged for the breakfast.. We had to check out early because they completely made us feel out of place. DO NOT GO HERE IF YOU HAVE A LARGE FAMILY. We booked a 2 room suite with 1 master and 2 queen beds and the complaints were unbearable.. Completely ruined our Christmas vacation. Update: I had the displeasure of speaking to the owner of this place "VIRGINIA" I can truly see why the staff is very rude and non-caring. It begins with the owner. She was not accepting to anything i had to say. Virginia, dont ever argue with a customer about your cheap continental breakfast when they just paid you $750 dollars for 2 nights.We checked in here - looks like a dated / standard motel but stayed at their off property - sea turtle cottage - see that review,Still giving it 2 stars, but more news... *The breakfast was okay. There is now hot meals along with the typical cold breakfast. *The Internet is awful. I think we got maybe 10-15 minutes of wifi for the entire stay. We were two doors down from the front desk.Great location. Was in walking distance to all the attractions in St. Augustine. Old, small rooms but very clean.  Front desk was very helpful. Served its purpose as we only used the room to sleep.We stayed off site at Charlotte's Cottage for the weekend and it was great! The cottage had everything we needed for nice little weekend vacation away from home. Definitely enhanced the historic feel of St. Augustine by being in an old carriage house. The cottage is on the south side of most of the restaurants and bars but we brought the beach cruisers and it was not more than a 10min bike ride from everything. Also note, that it is on the same property of a larger house about 40yards away, but we never saw anyone there.  Has a great patio to eat outside in. Only 1 bed and 1bathroom, both upstairs and the bedroom doesn't have a door. No WIFI either, which didn't matter to us cause we were there to get away, but just thought I would mention it. Overall, a fantastic, private spot for a couple or small family to change it up a bit rather than staying in a hotel for the same price.We weren't impressed & would NOT stay here again. It's not upscale at all (as another reviewer claims). And definitely not as glamorous as the website makes it seem. Cons:- Every room has a view of the parking lot and NOT the waterfront (as the website says). Across the street from the parking lot you can see the water, but you wouldn't want to "sit outside your room & relax" (as a reviewer says), because you'd just be looking at a crummy parking lot. - We stayed in the queen room, which was small, as was the bathroom. - - The room was mostly clean, except for a large white stain on the carpet and some long hairs in the bathroom (Eww)! - The room also had a very strong chlorine smell. - The continental breakfast, although free, is worth skipping. It had dry cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, toast, oj, & coffee. Not even worth it. Pros:- Very affordable & cheaper than other hotels in the area. - Walking distance to the downtown area. - Free parking.Very up scale decor for a small place, Rooms clean and quiet. Clean pool and two story out door deck for relaxing.Walking distance from most attractions.   Have stayed here before and will again.Clean, large room. Direct view of the bay & light house. Nice folks. Average cold continental breakfast. Great location, easy walk to center of Historic District.stinky room, horrible breakfast, crappy dirty old place... don't book it!!!!Wonderful location, good price, nicely refurbed rooms, close to what's happening in St. Augustine.  They have a great second floor balcony for sitting and pondering life.  I prefer this to the Casa Monica; more casual, simple and exceptionally clean.  Good place to meet a stranger on a Harley, who offered to give me a "private tour".  Four hours later and lots of info on the history of St. Augustine, this kind gentleman dropped me off at my door.  Thank you stranger.  Loved the moonlit walk on the beach.

Great inexpensive hotel in St Augustine Beach. The hotel was just across the street to their private beach. The hotel and room was very clean. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. We had a jacuzzi right inside of our room. It came with breakfast. Only a few minute drive to downtown. The only issue was that the bathroom door didn't close all the way. We definitely would stay here again.Nice and friendly staff! Which was the best part of our stay. Very good location and nice private beach access. However, not worth the money. Carpet in hallways were filthy like it hadn't been vacuumed in weeks and wasn't vacuumed the whole time we were there. FYI: there are no elevators. It wreaked in the halls and in the room. Air didn't work well and was humid in the room and building. What topped it all off was the room...... Dust everywhere, crumbs everywhere (night stands and floor included) hair all over the bathroom, dirty toilet, and the bed had sand all over it even though it looked freshly made. My husband is an HVAC contractor and specificity had this to say, " This complex very obviously has a humidity problem. The first things noticed were humidity bags in the stairwell, a dank odor and small amounts of mold growing on the caulking in sections of the complex. The real give away was the fact that the room was not comfortable until the temperature came down towards 70 degrees and lower. A properly dehumidified space should be comfortable even at temperatures between 75 and 80 degrees. This probably has a Lot to do with the dank musty odors we experienced." If the price was lower they may have gotten a better rating as the staff and services provided were excellent.Clean.  Quiet.  Nice-enough amenities, and a sliding glass door that we could park right outside of.  ...a nice touch on a raw, rainy day!A lot of folks here seemed to come for the beach (right across the two-lane blacktop and over the dune) but we were just on our way home after a couple of weeks on the road.  My wife wanted to see St. Augustine, and I was along for the ride.  St. Aug's was well worth it, but that's for a different review.As for the OSB Inn, everything in our room was well cared for, if not brand new.  The staff was nothing if not gracious and helpful.  The breakfast niceties were all there, but they also had WAFFLES.  Yeah.  Good ones, that you had to make yourself.  If they'd have had real maple syrup, I might have gone with that fifth star.  I'm not easy, but hey:  murple surple IS murple surple, after all.  We'd gladly stay here again.There are soooo many things about this place that made our recent stay wonderful!!It was referred to us by a friend, and recommended we book our room on the 2nd floor to see the ocean over the dunes.  We got a room with a king sized bed and huge/deep jacuzzi tub to luxuriate in.  If you want to go into town and not have to worry about parking, simply ask the front desk to have a shuttle come pick you up.  The breakfast served was typical of hotel fare these days and included with the room.  They do need more room though for their guest seating.  If more than four people come, it's crowded.I would definitely book there again....and again....and again.Our room was clean and the bed very comfy!!  The staff was very helpful and friendly too.  Thank you my friend for the referral!!!Room on the second floor on the corner (224 I think?) ocean view king was totally worth the extra $24 Dollars a night. Our room was $124/night.Room was clean and the front desk staff was very helpful.Having the beach right across the street was really nice and the air conditioning worked incredibly well.The pool is small, and the love bugs were out of control while we were there but not crowded and pleasant enough.Would totally stay here again in St. AugustineOcean Sands Inn made our vacation! We booked through HotelsTonight to find this gem. The Location you can't beat! The staff there was awesome the evening lady who checked us in was so kind, she upgraded us to a room with a jacuzzi tub, when I asked about a spa, recommended a great pizza place, even helped me print out some papers I need for work. All with a smile : ) . The morning front desk management was just as kind. They told me how to look for sharks teeth, even gave me one when I couldn't find any! The complimentary breakfast was perfect. The hotel is slightly worn but not enough to complain about. Living in Miami is was very refreshing to be surrounded with southern hospitality. They really made us feel welcome. Thank you!I've stayed in a few hotels around the Saint Augustine Area and would recommend this above all others. Clearly the best thing about Ocean Sands Beach Inn is the location, you are right across a tiny street from the ocean and you get to hear the waves all day, you have a stellar view if you are on the second floor/ocean side and the beach there is calm/relaxing. The other big plus is that it's a smaller place, so not noisy or crazy and there really is nothing on the street next to you that will keep you from relaxing.The room itself was simple, clean with a fridge/microwave/keurig coffee maker and normal TV. Nothing exciting but certainly had all the basic things you'd want in a room.As far as amenities, you don't really go for that, the pool seems small but clean (I didn't get in) and the breakfast location was TINY, that became filled up with only one or two people in there, I guess that's the only drawback.For the location, price and the fact that it's in beautiful Saint Augustine, I know that my wife and I will be staying here again next time we are in the area.I stayed here thru Hotwire so I had no idea where I'd be staying except the general area. I was very pleased. The lady at the front desk was very nice, the beds were clean comfortable and I had a great nights sleep before the half marathon, And, there was a keurig in the room! And a small fridge and a microwave. No elevator but it's only two stories . Had a great relaxing nightI have to say that the ppl that took care of us at check in and check out, were SUPER nice!!!  What a great way to end your night with kind courtesy and check out with a be safe on your travels, hope to see you back.   This little hotel was not the best as far as modern, or large rooms, but the staff and the clean rooms in my opinion make up for that!! It's right across the street from the beach and you can open up your sliding glass doors to hearing waves!  They do allow pets at 20 dollars extra a night, and the beach is pet friendly!!  I am so sorry, I meant to take photos of the room but next time we are there I will.  I have no doubt you will enjoy your stay here!!! The photos I have included are right across from our room !!This was not a fancy hotel by far. However, the room was clean with a microwave and refrigerator. The staff was welcoming and helpful. The best part, literally right across from the beach. We could hear the waves from our patio and get to the beach in 30 seconds. Hotel is just 10 mins from historic St Augustine. I would stay again!You get what you pay for, and Ocean Sands Beach Inn doesn't charge much.The Mister had an emotional attachment to Ocean Sands Beach Inn after a trip here with the previous future ex Mrs Mister and insisted we go back on a recent trip to St Augustine. He told me three things: it was not upscale, it was right on the water and there might be a hot tub in the room - the middle of the room. Um. Okay.The hotel was, by our DC standards, ridiculously cheap. We had an ocean view room on the 2nd - and top - floor. The keys were super old school and the thread count on the sheets was about equal to my body weight. The towels were a little threadbare, but a note told you it was possible to buy your own at the front desk. Because it was literally across the street from the beach, it had that musty smell houses on salt water often get. The room had a coffee maker, tv, hairdrier. It was a little bit outside of St Augustine, but still a quick drive into Old Town. There weren't a lot of restaurants around, something we realized a bit too late at night. The best part about Ocean Sands is that you are just across the A1 from the beach. You can hear the waves all day and night long. We loved being able to come back from town and take a long walk along the water. For that reason - and strange dearth of upscale hotels in the area - I'd probably stay here again.My sons and I stayed here this past weekend and it was perfect for us!  Clean AND comfortable as well as convenient to everything.  Beautiful vistas from the oceanfront balcony and amazing sunsets from the pool overlooking the marsh.  The staff was nothing but professional and accommodating.  From Margie who answered the phone and filled us in on all the details about the room and area to the manager who checked us out and was very kind.  I highly recommend this quaint and peaceful inn to anyone who wants to enjoy a nice stay in St. Augustine.  Between all three of us you get 6 thumbs up!  Donna Thompson, Gainesville, Florida

The Staff at this location were friendly and very helpful. Its a great location based on the fact that you are not too far from the historical district, which is about a mile away. They have an awesome hot breakfast that includes Waffles, Oatmeal, Yogurt, Potatoes, Eggs, Assortments of Fruits and Pastries, and egg bagels. Coffee and Tea are available 24/7 and they have Cucumber Water which is very refreshing. The hotel rooms are very nice and modern, and Wi-fi and Cable are included. Also if you are an honors club member you are greeted with extra snacks that are provided at the front desk and bottled waters. Also they offer complimentary toiletries. Which was great because I totally forgot my toothpaste and toothbrush. Also the products they offered for Shampoo and Conditioner were by Neutrogena. Overall my stay was pleasant!We did not stay here because they were fully booked. But I will in the future upon returning to St Augustine because of Robin & her fantastic customer service. We arrived unplanned on a Saturday night. She took the time to call other hotels to see about vacancies when she was very busy. Offered us coffee, water & cookies while we waited. She found us two king size sweets at another hotel at a very nice discounted rate. Just for her being super friendly & going out of her way to help us we will return there to stay.I stay at Hampton s all up and down the east Coast ... NEVER NEVER have I been in a room where another bed was put in the room I assume for more money.. You just about had to crawl over the bed to get to another one. ( See pictures) so the story is..A few nights ago I stopped at the Hampton Inn on Ponce de Leon in St Augustine. I asked the rate and because, the rate was reasonable I said great 2 nights please . Later that night I checked my bank account and I saw that I was charged much more than was stated lets say about $120.00 dollars more per night. I called the front desk placed the phone in the room on speaker so that my wife could hear . The front desk Associate said  " I have no problem correcting that" . The next morning I checked the charges again and nothing had changed . I walked down to the front desk and spoke with a Associate that said " he was not working and he would" check on that" later that day I stopped by the desk and was told that he "spoke with everyone concerned and they knew nothing about that rate"  Not to mention this but the room was so small that you had the crawl over the bed to get to the other side of the room. I have stayed at Hamptons for years near have I seen a room like this. So far I am being cheated out of over $100.00 a night and had a cracker box room. If they are doing this to me they have /will do it to other Guests.?STAY AWAYI'm a loyal Hampton customer. Unless I am looking for a resort, boutique, or other special property, I will almost always choose Hampton over other brands. I rate almost every hampton 4 stars. The nicer properties, or ones that stand out in any special way, I rate 5. The ones that fall short, like this one, 3. We chose this property because of it's location. Not exactly in downtown area, but a very short drive. Best of both worlds...save a little money, have a quieter place to stay. Had the service been better, this would have been a great choice. Checking out at this property was very annoying. There was only one person at the front desk, and he did not call for anybody to back him up when he ran into a delay with one guest. He saw that we were in a panic for time, after waiting there almost 10 minutes. He could not have cared less. Either he had no back up, or just had an attitude. In either case, he handled the situation terribly. A couple of people walked away from the counter in frustration. He pretended to be oblivious to what was going on. This property is not one of Hampton's newest or nicest. Had this experience not happened, it would have been a tough call whether to give them the 4th star or not. The bad experience made the decision much easier. One positive note: the lady working the dining room at breakfast went above and beyond and was so helpful and nice. I wish I could remember her name.This Hampton Inn gets the benefit of the doubt for that third star because even though my stay was leaning toward a 2-star stay, it wasn't really their fault.Problem is, apparently we stayed here on a busy weekend. When I booked the room, there were only two options left: a smoking room, or a non-smoking room.  The non-smoking room was $100 more (a suite, I think), putting it in the price range that we were trying to avoid, and actually in line with the much nicer Historic District Hilton.So, reluctantly we chose the smoking room thinking that at least they surely deodorize it or whatever.  And they do.  The bad news is that the window doesn't open so the room is caked with a stagnant, stale stench of a million smokers mixed with a million bottles of Febreze.  If you find yourself in a similar situation, don't underestimate it.  I'm generally not even remotely offended by cigarette smoke, and we've stayed in smoking rooms before without much issue.  But this, it knocked me back when I opened the door.  I could taste it in the morning, ick.Anyway, as I said, they get the benefit of the doubt because it's not their fault that I'm too cheap to spring for the suite (our upcoming wedding necessitates our frugality). The breakfast was standard Hampton Inn fare, and the employees were generally friendly.  The water pressure in the shower was actually above average.  Otherwise it was nondescript except for another odd smell in the hallways, not as bad as in our room but it was there.It's a Hampton! Pretty much the quality you'd expect from the brand name. Great location if you don't want to stay in the down town area but not too far away either.As Honors Club members this was the worst experience we have had at a Hampton inn no Love for members and free bugs.We were there off season when the place was half empty and were given a room the was smaller due to the vending and ice machines in the corridor.But it got worse after returning from dinner the desk on the internet center was crawling with bugs.We quickly asked for another room on a different floor.Will never stay at this Hampton inn againThis hotel is fine if you are looking for a cheap option close to the action of St. Augustine, and if you aren't looking to spend a ton of time in your hotel. Technically, you could walk to the downtown area, but it's a bit far. The staff is friendly and the check-in process is easy (and there is free coffee, beverages and cookies in the lounge). The room was about what I would expect for a Hampton Inn. It was pretty clean and had everything you'd expect in a basic hotel room, except the pleather couch in the corner really looked gross to me. There also was kind of a weird odor in the hotel. We had a lot of Hilton Honors points, so the hotel only cost $34/night. We spent the night out on the town and probably only spent about a total of 9 hours in the hotel itself. They do provide a basic continental breakfast in the lounge in the mornings. My advice is, stay here if you are looking for something cheap and basic, but don't come here if you're looking for a romantic or classy stay!This place is a find.  Small, it is clean, the people very courteous, rooms nice and Old St Augustine is a 5 minute drive.  I ohVe been to St Augustine many times before, but the first time here.  Will definitely stay again.Not the best Hampton Inn I've been to, but out of all the "Inns"  Hampton Inn is usually consistently the best.  Clean sheets, comfortable beds, nice service.  I wasn't displeased with this Hampton Inn at all, but not wowed by it either.

We just returned from our stay at the Cedar House Inn. The first of many visits to come, I'm certain. Right in the heart of historic St. Augustine, the inn is a meticulously restored Victorian gem, beautifully furnished to create a romantic old-world experience. A great night's sleep in our four-poster bed fitted out with sumptuous linens. Breakfast was simply delicious. And Cyndi and her staff ... we feel as if we've known them forever. The loveliest people, welcoming you into the loveliest home imaginable. We've had the good fortune to stay at some high-end B&B's, and the Cedar House is absolutely on par with the best of the best. We loved it. Loved every minute of it.This B&B has everything. The owner, Cyndi, is very friendly and sweet and made sure we had everything we needed to make our stay comforable and enjoyable. She truly made us feel like we were at home. She even encouraged to help ourselves and have a glass of wine from the living room/lobby whenever we wanted to. Every room is beautifully decorated in Victorian style and looks very refined and welcoming. The breakfast is a real experience: prepared from scratch, beautifully presented, delicious, and fresh! Thanks Cyndi for your warm welcome and for making our stay so memorable!I've stayed at five St. Augustine B&Bs now, and while you can't go wrong with any of them I think, my experience at the Cedar House was truly excellent. Breakfast was to die for and everything was just so lush and lovely and still grandly decorated for Christmas. Cyndi knows exactly what she's doing and will make you feel 100% at home. I can't wait to go back.My wife and I recently stayed at the Cedar House Inn. It was our first time at a B&B and we stayed here because the reviews on trip advisor made this the number one in St. Augustine. It was everything the reviews claimed it would be and more. The location was perfect (walking distance from everything), the food was gourmet quality, and the owner (Cyndi) made EVERYTHING the best experience we could have ever imagined.  We stayed in the Sanibel Room. Private entrance (which was nice) and very clean inside and out. Free cookies and wine 24/7.  We highly recommend this B&B to anyone going to St. Augustine.This place is so amazing. My husband and I stayed there this weekend and I can't express how wonderful it was. Cyndi (the owner) made us feel like family. I just wanted to hug her the minute I met her. Everything was very clean and beautiful. Breakfast each morning was honestly the best breakfast I've ever had in my life. I would stay there again just to have breakfast. Apparently she is actually releasing a cook book soon which I am super exited about. If you are going to saint augustine definitely stop by. You will love love love this place.
