She said ''because I woke up today"!Amber informed us that their homebaked cookies served at 7pm is a must have, so we got there to have the cookies!! They were super yummy like she said.Breakfast is included and it's very standard, eggs, sausage, waffle maker, fruits, coffee, tea, yogurt, muffins, pastries, bagels, cereal, oatmeal.It's right by the beach so if you get an ocean view room, you will see the beach (with swimming pool, and maybe a small parking lot in between), but it is nice to leave the balcony door open to listen to the sound of waves.Overall, a good experience and would go back again.Off to a bad start, 1 hour check in delay. No fans in the bathrooms.Location is great! The beachfront description is true. We stayed in room 201, which had a beach front view. While the location should be enough to give this property 2 thumbs up, being a Hilton Honors member and frequent guest of other Hampton Inns across the country, this room needed a lot of improvement. Please change the bed! It is hollow in the center. Almost felt like sleeping in a hammock.Well, I just really like this place.  Not super cheap for a Hampton but it's on the beach so it's to be expected.  Front office staff very friendly.  Let me upgrade to the jacuzzi room.  Mostly I wanted to be beach side rather than street side.  Having the jacuzzi in the main room, not in the bathroom just made me think that my room had seen some action if you know what I mean.  Liked having a pool and the ocean right there.  Ate across the street so didn't need to drive anywhere.  Breakfast was fine.  We got a table but it's not a huge area so some had to eat in the hall.  Will stay here again when I come back in the fall.So let me start by saying in the end this was a great hotel... However in the beginning when we first arrived after our 7 hour drive I had to take a pretty significant dunkus. I went into the lobby bathroom only to find to my horror blood vomit and fecal matter all over the place. OMFG! Well needless to say I took my dunkus elsewhere! Okay now that I got that off my chest I can talk about the room. Our room was large and clean it faced the street but still provided wonderful views. Our ac was cold and the sheets were clean. The location is great you can walk to just about any beach attraction that St. Augustine has to offer. The frat boys had the hot tub outside on lock down the entire time we were there I take this as a sign that it was a decent tub... The complimentary breakfast was good. Not great but good. The elevator didn't eat me which is another plus. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. By the looks of some of the exteriors of the competition  I think we made the right decision. Oh I just remembered the wifi is free however we had to connect with our code way too often. Free is good but this was a pain in the butt.Pretty good place!  If you haven't been here for a while you'll notice the beach is about 7-8x larger since Feb. 2012.  The city spent $49 million re-sanding the beach.  This happens every 8 years.  Fabulous beach!
review_content_20: Just had a short stay here but it was comfortable and convenient.  I checked into room 222 which had just had the carpet replaced and the odor from the glue was really strong.  No problem as the front desk moved me to room 118.  The only thing was the free wifi worked in 222 but not at all in 118. After checking in I walked right across the street to the Sunset Grill and had a great meal.  I would stay here again even though my comforter smelled like cheap cologne.Good location, hotel condition is nice enough and fairly clean.  Staff has potential but could use an etiquette brush-up, they were a little unfriendly and inflexible compared to every other Hampton Inn we have been to.  Overall the hotel just needs a few tweaks.  Good is fine, but great is better!  May return, not sure though.Stayed here when I was in FL for Christmas. My husband and I had a nice room with a king size bed. Some rooms overlooked the beach and we were in one that overlooked the street. I was impressed that there was no noise that we could here in the room from S A1A. My in -laws had a view from the 3rd floor of the beach. They have a nice spread in the morning for food- one rotating hot item (while we were there- omlette one morning with hash browns, one morning sausage and egg patty, scrambled eggs and bacon one morning and I can't remember the other one) In addition there is the waffle machine that was oh so popular, bread varieties, fruit, cereal and yogurt. The standard continental breakfast at a hotel. the only thing I didn't like is that matress and pillows were not the most comfertable- so 1/2 a star off for that but overall great.I went again last weekend - it was fantastic again!cannot access wifi from inside rooms (not strong enough)beach access is nice, but only when it is not closed off during beach/sand reconstitutionrooms smelled like mildew which is fairly standard, but drains were all clogged with sand (slow to drain)the pool is ok for its size, but there are too many people in the pool in the eveningthere is a playground in the back, but the debris in the sand makes it dangerous to play on without sandalsbreakfast buffet was good, but only one person runs it so it is kind of small and slow (always a long line for making waffles)the view is great when the skies are clear, good places to eat at (across the street), overall it is good, but misses the last two stars because of all the negative pointsDelightful.  On beach.  Reasonable price. Not deluxe, but we wanted to be on the beach at a reasonable cost and we got that.  Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn & Suites St. Augustine - Vilano Beach
review_content: Love staying at Hamptons for the reasonable prices and free breakfast. The room w/ 1 king was huge!Breakfast was great, beach in walking distance, nice/large pool, fitness center really nice,  and Publix across street incase you forgot anything or wanna grab some snacks.Great look inside of the rooms and I was very pleased with the bed and room size. Hotel staff has no respect for the Hilton brand or proper procedure. The idea that a paying guest is always right escapes the staff at this location. Having worked within the Hilton brand in the past it was extremely disappointing and turned me off of the brand. Maybe the 'Make it Right' campaign didn't reach this location. Interesting this Hilton brand experience because the Hilton downtown in St Augustine does a wonderful job.You get what you pay for regardless of association.The hotel was pretty busy when I stayed there earlier this week. The hotel is very nice and has a nice touch. The room was very nice though the A/C seemed to not work at all and was constantly on cold. Overall a very nice room and nice hotel with great service at breakfast. Though the gentleman that checked me around midnight was pretty unprofessional. It seemed that he was quick to judge my friends and I that we were pretty young and thought we'd be a rowdy bunch at the hotel. (We literally are just a bunch of guys that wanted a quick get away for a night before hanging out in St. Augustine in the morning). But literally when we walked in, the gentlemen (which I should've grabbed his name) took a look at my ID, said okay you already e-checked in, tossed the keys at me and said "have at it". I thought that was pretty unprofessional of him and should probably have some training in professionalism.This part has no affect to a negative review, but the morning of check out there was a fire that went in the hotel. The staff seemed very prepared and professional in evacuating the hotel. So bonus points for the morning staff from putting up with the ordeal.Super slow check in, waited 30min. In line as customers were helped and received rooms, only to be told my room  was not ready.  A friend that booked after me got his room and booked a day after me. One person working the front desk is a joke for such a popular spot.  Obviously not well managed  people off the street got rooms before we did, with no reservation.  finally got a room onsite from the elevator and vending, every time the elevator was used a loud electric surge noise could be heard.  Not to mention the ice noise and people making noise at the elevators.  there were no pillows for the pull out sofa bed and the bed was missing all the springs that held up the end of the bed. I used to love this place, it is in the best location but has gone down hill, will not stay here again.An OK place but be prepared to deal with the paper thin walls. You can hear the kids in their rooms from down the hall and the stallion next door going at it with his philly loud and clear at 7amPassable. The room was clean and the food was breakfast food was okay. The staff was very friendly. But the owner is clearly a cheapskate. Apparently he/she hadn't heard about the environmental damage done by styrofoam. Although that seemed to be the case in most St. Augie's establishments. There were no towels available in the pool area or on the way to the beach, for the duration of our 2 day visit. We mentioned this several times. Pool is too small for more than few people at a time. Despite being clean, everything smelled odd. But you got used to it. The television reception was inconsistent. Free wifi!Breakfast area probably too small for the number of guests. Will not return. The place has great potential if the owner actually spent a little money.The staff members are excellent - very responsive and caring. I was very impressed with the service. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The location is fantastic - right across the street from the beach. Some restaurants and bars (and a grocery store with an excellent beer selection) are within a few blocks of the hotel, which is very convenient.I had one small issue during my visit with some noise from a school group, and the front desk was very responsive to the issue. The next night I didn't have the same issues. When I mentioned this in the review Hilton sent me, I received a personal email from the manager who was very polite and seemed genuinely concerned.Overall, this hotel is nice, but what makes this place truly excellent is the staff.I'll start with this review is preferences with it's a hotel in Florida - meaning I'll give it a pass on the water - it's all bad in Florida - and the dampness - everything is damp in Florida.  The room was clean; staff friendly; and can't beat the location.  The only real complaint is the pillows - they were the worst Hampton pillows ever.I had a great stay at this Hampton. We had a third-floor room overlooking the ocean. The room was clean and fairly-well appointed. Service at the desk was good, and breakfast was passable. The location is really what makes it special, though. It is within sight of the Atlantic, and has a nice stretch of beach to play on. It's quiet at night, inside and outside. Also, it's a few minutes from the rest of St. Augustine, close enough to enjoy the attractions but far enough to forget you're near a city. I'd stay here again.Can't say enough good things about the location of this Hotel. Close, but not too close, to the Old City touristy area, while also being nearly beachfront, and essentially tucked away quietly in its own little corner.  The rooms probably could have been a little cleaner, but no serious issues. The breakfast was pretty solid for a free small-hotel breakfast. The pool, though small, was empty most of the week and beautifully lit in the evenings. We appreciated the fridge and microwave in the room. Most of the guests staying here were friendly and respectful, though a bit noisy at times. The beds could use a serious upgrade, but we are young enough to deal with them. Overall a great stay.Booked a Kingsize oceanfront balcony suite with hot tub.   The room was nice BUT all I could see is the pool and a grass field from the "Not" at all private balcony.  The ocean is way too far to even see from the top 3rd floor.This really is one of the nicest Hampton Inns in Florida. The location is right on the beach.  The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are huge.  The pool area is very nice and there is a small bar where you can get a couple of adult beverages while you take in some sun.  It is a short drive to Old Town St Augustine and not far from I-95.  My only tip is everything on the Island closes at 10:00 PM, so make sure you have everything you need before then.Great hotel. Really cool outdoor area with fire pits. Walking distance to the beach. I'd definitely recommend staying here.What has happened to this place?  I Love this place I love the location I Love the Hotel until..... my stay 7/5 thru 7/14   Everyday there was something else that was not the quality that it was the last few years. From a elevator that was broken for 3 days ? Days well.. you press the button and press and press and wait and wait  .     for 3 days ! Look I know that elevator Company's work 24/7  so what gives? So what is up with that?         Then we see a sign saying the elevator works but, you have to press harder or firmer ? Come on The Hulkster would break his fingers.... The dammm thing was broke.         Then the tub... nice paint pealing come on this is not a 62.95 a night place you would expect that from a place like that.Hampton are you reading this?Wonderfully relaxing experience. I adore all the outside paces, the location is literally steps from the beach, and just minutes from the historic district. The staff was super friendly and our room had a balcony. In terms of what was available at this price point, Hampton Inn was a great deal. Recommendable.Excellent service, rooms, atmosphere! This is my third time coming here and always had a great experience.Second time around... Awaken at 5:45 Am (Fire Alarm) someone burt the bacon in the kitchen....  Fire department arrives...  The best mangement could come up with ....  Folks go back to sleep.   Love the location, but the management and staff could careless!  Managed by college kids, who really, really really could care less!   Stay in St. Augustine!I was impressed with this little hotel in an area of town where there isn't much going on.  The ladies at the front desk were very helpful when looking for things to do in the Old Town area - which was very charming!  It was a well maintained and clean hotel with a very friendly staff.  The pool is very clean and, again, a well maintained area.  It is a short walk to the beach from the hotel.  The rooms and bathrooms were very clean with fresh towels and fresh bed linens.We ran into one issue but the responsive front desk addressed it immediately and had a solution for fixing it.  The air conditioner worked which is vital to a comfortable stay during the summer months in Florida.  However we noticed Friday night that it was leaking and the carpet in front of the unit.  We called the front desk and (because it was late at night) they sent someone up in the morning to fix the AC unit.  The maintenance guy also left an industrial fan in our room to help expedite the drying process of the carpet.The breakfast was good - the food was mediocre but the coffee was great.  Also the cookies were a nice touch in the afternoon!Nice accommodations. Updated from other Hamptons I've stayed in. The room descriptions are not accurate. Their idea of a city view are the front yards of the homes seen from my balcony. The AC had to be replaced, and the front desk attendant was "stuffy." Not your typical warm greeting and service I'm accustomed to at Hilton properties. Over-priced as I've stayed at much nicer locations and never paid what I did here.Convenient location to I95.  Clean, about what you would expect for a Hampton.  Staff was very friendly.  Breakfast was EXCELLENT!  I would definitely stay here again.
review_content_20: Very nice and well maintained Hampton Inn.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  This is easily one of the best Hampton Inns I've ever had the pleasure of staying in.  The location is excellent if you want to be close to the beach.

review_content: Beautiful and convenient. Most importantly, customer service was absolutely outstanding. We were traveling and were delayed, but the innkeeper stayed late to check us in. We left an item in the room and they had called us to let us know they found it and even offered to mail it to us. Room was neat, clean and beautifully furnished. Within walking distance of everything. Great experience for couples and families.I stayed two nights at the St. George Inn in St. Augustine, FL on 4/20/2015 & 4/21/2015. It was my 1st time there. The old saying location, location, location applies here. St. George is a pedestrian street full of shops and eateries. The Castillo de San Marcos National Monument is just across the street. Trolley's which you can pick up near the Inn can take you to farther locations. Besides all of this the staff is extremely helpful. Sherry, showed me to my room when I arrived and all the staff helped me with any of my needs. I had planned on staying only one night but added the 2nd because it is so nice here. I stayed in one of their Santa Maria rooms. the price was $219.00 per night. With all the additional taxes, my two night stay came to $492.40. Plus, I took photos.Great Place to stay. We stayed upstairs across from the fort, so we had a great view off of the deck .It was nice to sit on the deck and enjoy a glass of wine at night and look at the fort and the water. The rooms are very comfortable with lovely decor, a homey feeling. Also the staff is very helpful and accommodating.I wold definitly stay here again.This inn is in the perfect location. It's right off St.George St. where you can find tons of tempting boutique shops and restaurants. The courtyard of the Inn features a beautiful fountain shaded by large trees where you can sit and have a late night drink or enjoy your satisfying complimentary breakfast. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and many offer eve lent views. My room had a view of the fort and the ocean. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing vacation, especially for couples!Great place to stay in St. Augustine. Outstanding location, nice rooms, convenient parking, and a very friendly staff. We stayed during Labor Day weekend on the City's 450th Birthday celebration.Location, location, location. That's what you pay for at this inn. The rooms are nice enough, with tile floors, faux antique TV cabinets and faux antique chairs with no support (like the horrible doctors waiting room chairs). The linens and pillows were fairly nice quality. The room is nicer than a Days Inn or Motel 6, but not as nice as a Hilton or Marriott. But the wraparound decks are fantastic! You have a birds eye view of the variegated street scene of St. Augustine's tourist downtown while you relax on a rocking chair with a smoke and a cool beverage!The checkin was a little odd. We couldn't figure out where to park, so we called the lobby. The nice young man on the phone told us to stop on the yellow traffic markings right on the middle of the street. When we did, four young people trotted out the door, grabbed our bags, escorted me inside, and gave my husband a chit for the parking garage a block away! The staffers were laid back, asking if we wanted things most places do automatically, like clean your room and make your bed while you're out. The guy who showed us our room didn't get us a bucket of ice, which I kind of expect at a $200-a-night hotel, but okay. They were super pleasant and polite, like almost everyone we met during our pleasant anniversary getaway. The cold continental breakfast included with the room was unexceptional: packaged bagels, Costco croissants, cream cheese, and cold cuts, coffee and OJ. But, again, you eat it under oak trees by a fountain in an old Spanish courtyard, before the mad tourist throng has even begun to arrive. Location, location, location!This was truly one of the best hotel experiences we've had. The service and the room were 5 star! We stayed in a Castillo Suite, #43, and were in amazement over the comforts the room offered. They even had umbrellas in there in case of rain, which came in handy. There was also an ice maker, plenty of pillows, a comfy bed and lots of towels. We had our 2 year old son with us and upon our arrival they already had a pack-n-play in our room along with a baby gate to block off the spiral staircase.You should know that there are bars and night-life going on around the Inn, and if this is not something you are ok with, then rethink staying here. For us, we really enjoyed sitting in the rocking chairs on the balcony and listening to the live music going on next door. When it was time for us to go to bed we could still hear it, however it did not keep us awake. It was well worth it to be in the heart of the historic district. The room was on the 2nd and 3rd floors of the building, so there were some stairs to climb (the 3rd floor part was due to our choosing a 2-story suite). However we did not mind the stairs because upon our arrival the staff whisked all of our luggage out of our car and right up to our room for us. They did the same upon our departure.The Inn offered a continental breakfast and the staff was very knowledgeable when we asked questions about the area. We didn't think housekeeping was going to come on our second day since we spent quite a bit of time in our room. We were ok with hanging up our towels and making our own bed. However, we did find that they had left us a basket outside of our door that contained fresh towels, coffee, toilet paper, tissues and a note that said they did not want to disturb us. While I was more than satisfied with this service, we came back from an adventure later in the day to find that they had actually come back and still serviced our room for us.All-in-all I can wholeheartedly recommend the St. George Inn and I would like to extend a warm "thank you" to them for making our trip so memorable.Just checked out from a wonderful stay at this place. All the rooms are well appointed and spotless. Their toiletry selection is nice quality Rusk products, so this place does not skimp. Perfect location to all the old town sites, but very quiet and our stay was perfect. Out room also included reliable wireless internet and a well appointed breakfast selection. It was beautiful to enjoy coffee and a croissant in their beautiful courtyard. The staff is friendly and available without being overly intrusive. We hate to be interviewed and questioned when we travel (even when we kno the staff is just trying to be friendly) so we loved the professionalism this place and staff offered. We had a wonderful time at this place. We felt it was worth every dollar and would not hesitate to come back to St George Inn.Awesome all around could not ask for anything else. Super comfortable beds, great layout, great location, great prices, great everything. This our second stay here and will be our next stay when we visit St Augustine again. Also St. Augustine is our favorite place to visit and we live next door to Mickey and Harry Potter so that says a lot.The St. George Inn is located right by St. Augustine's main point of interest which is the Castillo de San Marcos! It's right across the street! It's also on St. George St. which has lots of cool shops and other points of interest like the Pena-Peck House, the Gonzalez-Alvarez house, etc. The Inn's staff are all really nice and helpful. When we got to our room one of the hotel personnel came up with us and gave us many tips on what to do and where to eat, etc. Other reviewers claim that the Inn is noisy and that it is hard to get a good night's sleep. This is simply untrue. I never heard the noise from the nearby Oldest Wooden Schoolhouse and noisy passersby were not a problem either, nor were passing cars, etc. My MAIN complaint is that I heard the neighbor's bed banging against the wall and also heard it creaking frenetically haha! Ewwww! This doesn't mean the walls are paper thin, it just means that on this night we had clueless and/or rude neighbors. It didn't last long though hahaha! They have complimentary wifi but the signal isn't the greatest. My other complaint is that our room did not have a safe for my laptop. I guess it's time to get an ipad mini haha! We were given a room on the third floor that faces an old cemetery (which is by the Visitor's Center)! Spooky! The room was very nice and had nice furnishings. The bed is comfortable as are the pillows. In the morning they serve a simple complimentary breakfast (bagels, pastries, yogurt, juice, coffee, granola bars, etc.) in the lobby. They have an elevator. When you get to the Inn you can make use of the painted yellow triangle in the middle of the street right in front of the Inn to unload your luggage. Their parking is in a nearby structure right in front of the Visitor Center. The structure is just across the street. They will issue you a card that allows you entry into the structure. Don't forget to swipe out with the card every time or you may need assistance from a parking attendant. The structure doesn't have one of those arm things that go up and down that keep you from driving out so people forget to swipe out. What happens is that the system thinks your still in the structure and doesn't allow you entry if you forget to swipe out. Parking is cheap and the structure is pretty big. The structure has elevators. I highly recommend the St. George Inn. It's quaint, has really cool staff and is at an insuperable location!!!!We stayed two nights, and the staff were consistently very friendly and helpful. It was also great that they provide parking in the public lot for a $10 fee, because normally it costs $10 *every time* you enter the lot, so if you take your car out to use it during your visit, the money can add up. With the hotel pass, you can go in and out as many times as you want during your stay, and you only have to pay that one-time $10 fee. We found that very convenient, since we weren't just leaving our car there during our entire visit.Every time we had a question or a request, the staff were wonderful and bent over backwards to help us. We used one of their inflatable air beds, and I was pleased to find that they provide the high-quality kind, so that it was just as comfortable as sleeping on a normal mattress. I've slept on some that weren't nearly as good.I liked their continental breakfast more than I expected. The bagels were wonderfully chewy and fresh (even though the desk clerk told me they buy them from Dunkin' Donuts!), and there was good quality cheddar cheese and thinly sliced ham, in addition to the usual croissants, breads, cereals, juices, coffee, tea, etc. So it isn't fancy -- it is a *continental* breakfast, after all -- but it was better than many. Also, there is always bottled water available in the office during the hours it's open, which I appreciated.The location is wonderful, right on the quaint pedestrian St. George Street shopping area (and therefore footsteps from several restaurants), and it surrounds a beautiful little cobbled square with a tiled fountain. There are lots of attractive metal tables and chairs scattered throughout the courtyard, so you can sit out there and relax anytime you like, and it's a lovely place to enjoy your hotel-provided breakfast in the morning. The courtyard contains many stores (e.g., a chocolate store, a knick-knack store, a coffee place, a clothing store, a jerky store, etc.), as well as a drink machine that is accessible at all hours.One problem: our room was almost directly above a cigar store, and a man frequently sat outside the store smoking, especially in the evenings. The smoke completely permeated our entire stairway, so we often found ourselves walking through a very thick, stinky cloud in order to get from our room to the courtyard or vice-versa. There's nothing the hotel management can do about this, obviously, but it was very unpleasant.Another problem: the hotel has no ice machine. I use a lot of ice, and so all by myself I completely depleted their supply once or twice, and when other guests came to request ice afterward, there was none to give to them. Also, this means that you can't get any ice during the time when the office is closed, between 8 p.m. and 8 a.m. We were able to work around this, but it was slightly inconvenient, and it meant I was constantly in the office bugging the staff for more ice. They were nice about it, but it would have been better if I could have taken care of it for myself, rather than having to always ask.On the other hand, I forgot a brand new pair of earrings in our room, and phoned almost a week later to ask if they'd been found, and it turned out that the person cleaning the room had found them and turned them in, and the management is sending them to me (on the other side of the country) right away. I thought it was great that the person cleaning the room was so conscientious and that the woman at the desk was so obliging in offering to send them.Oh, also, they provide free wifi. Always a plus.Excellent location right across from the Castillo De San Marcos fort. Parking is available at an additional $10 a night, 1 block away west on Orange street, near the old drugstore. Lock your car up tight and take our any valuables. It's very safe in St. Augustine, just don't like having my car parked in an unattended lot so far away. The St. George Inn is divided up into three sections. All the rooms are above businesses. The central fountain area can stay fairly noisy until 9 to 10p. Just an FYI in case you want quiet. But you can't get a much better location when it comes to being able to walk the town. We stayed in the 'St. George' room style. Very nice. There are many B&B to chose from in the St. Augustine area. But we would recommend the St. George Inn. stgeorge-inn.com/stgeorg...This inn was perfect! The room was great. Nice and clean. Great service from the staff! You can't beat the location :-)What a great place to stay in the Historic District! The staff is great- very friendly and helpful with loading and unloading the car. Our room was the Santa Maria- overlooking the fort, city gates, and cemetery. We had a long, private balcony with rocking chairs. We came here for a couple of days to celebrate my husband's birthday, and were so glad we did. The room were very nice with a small refrigerator. The parking was close by, and only $5 per day. Breakfast was European style- meats, cheese, toast, croisants, bagels, peanut butter, coffee, juice, sweet breads, yoghurt. We sat outside to eat and watched the squirrels play- what a nice way to start the day. The Inn offers beach towels and ponchos for inclement weather which is nice. We were in walking distance of everything in the Historic District. Do drive down to Crescent Beach for lunch at the South Beach Grill, and then to see Ft. Matanzas.This place is in old St Augustine right on St George st.. Park your car in the public garage and forget about it. The inn keepers are very friendly and helpful. The place is very clean. Beds are comfortable. all the amenities you could ask for. The location CAN NOT be beat. there was some noise from the street and the bands playing at some local restaurants but that just added to the whole experience for us.DO it!! Parking is kind of a pain but they have fine tuned the process so that we double park, they take our bags to our room and give us directions and a pass for free parking in the public lot. The great thing is we were able to leave our car in the public lot after we checked out till the end of the day, but it is two blocks away. The room was located overlooking a quaint courtyard, with a back balcony view of a private garden. Really cute but the best thing is the LOCATION. We were close to everything, and the owners have great suggestions for tours, shopping and dining. We actually saved money by following the owners suggestions.The St George Inn is one of best hotels in the St Augustine Historic area. It is located at the original entrance to the original city. Our room balcony look right out over it. (see picture). I believe there are only sixteen rooms in the Inn. The rooms are very nice and the hotel staff were great. The continental breakfast was very good. You can get it and sit in the courtyard (see pictures). I would highly recommend this Inn if you plan on making a visit to the St Augustine historic district. The only draw back was most of the better restaurants and bars were located three blocks away but it is a very pleasant walk through the old town.Outstanding! Return visit - just as great as first time! Innkeeper and staff very helpful. Rooms huge, stone tile floor, clean and two balconies! Location perfect! Recommend highly!This is THE place to stay if you are visiting St. Augustine. Nice rooms, very friendly staff and even their Continental breakfast is better then others!Where should I begin...We had a great visit to St Augustine, it was our first time in the Old City. Not sure of what to expect, I did a little research and happened to find a place called the St George Inn, so I booked our stay.Making a reservation was super easy and the inn keeper answered all my questions when I was making the reservation. I asked to make sure they were a family friendly location as I was traveling with my 4 yr old. ;)When we arrived we were greeted by the staff- all very friendly and accommodating. (You unload your bags in the middle of the yellow median- center of the road, and are issued a parking pass for the parking garage- about a block away.) Our hotel stay included the historic package- so it had tickets already printed for the city trolley as well as tickets for some other points of interest. That was an added value!Our room was really great. We over-looked the Old School House and were right across from the Fort and next to the Old City Gate. There was hardly any noise, which was a pleasant surprise. Below our hotel room were many unique shops. The hotel provides a really nice selection for the continental breakfast, and the complimentary bath products were a nice touch. We were having such a great time walking through out the city, that every day was an adventure to find yet another great restaurant to get lunch and dinner. We were having such a great time, that we extended our stay an additional night. Our room was previously booked- but we were able to switch rooms with such ease! Anyone wanting a really nice, relaxing and friendly experience and place to stay should look into the St George Inn... The rooms are all non-smoking, super clean and spacious!**note: make sure to pack comfy walking shoes- you'll want to explore the city and walk the side streets!
review_content_20: If this place had better soundproofing, I'd give it 4 stars. We checked in at 4pm and the front desk guy was REALLY nice and helpful. After an hour of being in the room, I was no longer relaxed. I could hear every footstep in the room above ours and the noise from the street was non-stop. The worst part is that we paid over $300 a night for the Castillo Suite that has a beautiful porch, but the old schoolhouse was across from our bedroom window, and the mannequin's recording was played loudly on a continuous loop from 8am to about 9pm every day. That just ruined it. I understand that it is in the middle of everything, but I've stayed in Times Square and heard less noise, it's called "soundproofing".  For the price, I'll never stay here again. The room was beautiful and spacious, but the noise level was too high to sleep or enjoy the porch/balcony.  Save your money and get a nice place a block or two from the action.The St. George Inn is a lovely place to stay in the heart of the downtown tourist district. The third floor room we enjoyed had a view of part of the walking street, yet it was completely quiet at night. The room was cozy and comfortable while also being updated and extremely clean. Even the complimentary toiletries were high quality, and plentiful.Convenience is one of the best amenities. The street festivities begin at the bottom of the stairs, just a few yards from the room.The mornings got off to a great start with an impressive continental breakfast including fresh breads, pastries, cakes and fruit. There was also cheese and deli meats for sandwiches, as well as yogurt, juice and coffee. With the outdoor courtyard seating, breakfast was delightful.The staff was tremendous -- friendly, personable, and very helpful. We had a rainy day, but they offered us umbrellas and help running to and from the car. All of this service was delivered with a smile and plenty of enthusiasm.My mom and I stayed here.  I picked this inn because of a room that overlooked the old cemetery.  We were there in mid October so we had signed up for the ghostly getaway.   Was very pleased when we arrived not only did the balcony overlook the cemetery but the city gates from 1700's.  Irving, santi and Carrie were friendly and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable.    This in is within walking distance to most all shopping and attractions.   The inn also provided us free trolley tickets that lasted throughout our stay which got you around the city with the drivers as tour guides filling one in on the very beginnings of this beautiful city.     The rooms were large and comfortable. Wish they had microwave.   There was a dorm size refrigerator and coffee machine with various coffees.  They made sure there were extra pillows and blankets.     I highly recommend this inn for the price , location, size and the friendly wonderful people who run it.

hotel_name: Casa Monica Resort & Spa, Autograph Collection
review_content: Romantic, exotic, ideal location, walk to shopping, eating, Flagler college and Lightner museum.  We had a view of the park from our window.  We had a drink in the lobby after check in and service was a bit slow but nice people.  We stayed in the one bedroom suite.  It has a four poster bed with sheer curtains around the bed.  Pretty sexy.  Linens great, robes, great shower.  Valet, front desk and bell service really exceptional.  Another nice touch was the Bose system beside the bed playing some nice background music when we arrived.  We think it was a good value for the $.Screw this place. They fired an employee for wearing an American Flag. That should tell you what kind of people own this flea bag hotel. Want some bed bugs with your anti american bed? 26-year-old tells reporters that he was released from his front desk supervisor position after he refused to take off the pin, which he had worn to work every day for two years."I've actually gotten probably more compliments about it than any of the service I've actually done at the hotel, which is an interesting concept," May told a local station.The Casa Monica is stating behind their decision, claiming that they were only enforcing a company policy--not taking a stand against the flag itself."The property reflects its pride in America and great patriotism by flying the Stars and Stripes high over the hotel," a spokesperson said in a statement. "However, our employee handbook clearly states, 'No other buttons, badges, pins or insignia of any kinds are permitted to be worn.' No matter an individual's national preference, political views or religious affiliation, it is a standard regulation which ensures equality for all."May suspects that the decision was a result over the company coming under new leadership, under the parent company Kessler Enterprise.Really overpriced, and this hotel has seen better days. The ambiance is lovely in the lobby, and furnishings are pretty in the room, but expect musty smells, poor wifi, stopped up sink, and tattered shower heads. It felt like staying in a fancy retirement home. We also opted for breakfast at the hotel; both times it took an extremely long time for our food (despite a half empty dining room). First day, poached eggs were totally cooked through in eggs benedict, so we asked that they please make sure it was runny (as a poached egg should be). It took over an hour to receive our food, as our waitress pointed out that they had to keep redoing the eggs. Um a hotel kitchen that doesn't know how to make poached eggs?? Scary. Then the benedict itself was prepared poorly (vegetables not cooked, English muffin not toasted).We went back for drinks to spend some time and also ordered appetizers, which again took forever. We ordered soup, salad, and cheese board -- not items that would take a long time to prepare. The server informed us they had lost our ticket. The location is good if you're interested in doing toursity things. It's walking distance to most interesting sights in St. Augustine and right across from Flagler College.But like St. Augustine, it is kitschy, overpriced, and desperately trying to stay relevant in the new millennium. Because of this stay here, I'm hesitant to stay in any other Kessler establishment. With such a high price point, I expected high quality amenities and service.Beautiful place. Good location. However, ants in the bedroom. No water pressure for the shower whatsoever. So much noise anywhere in the hallway, even just someone talking comes right through the door. Someone sang the theme to "Green Acres" down the hall and it was like a personal concert in my room, OY!!  Whenever someone upstairs flushed the toilet... the sound of Niagara Falls in our room. Pillows completely flattened as soon as we laid down so asked for 2 more and they brought old crumpled pillows which felt like the material inside was balled up.Edited review: mentioned above problems to manager who without a blink apologized and gave us a substantial discount on the room. Great management customer service.Absolutely beautiful hotel with old world charm that you can't get enough of!  Check was effortless ... Location superior ... Looking forward to the Spa!While it's a Marriott Autograph collection, it is part of the Kessler group which sets the bar for outstanding hospitality and decor.The Casa Monica has the perfect location in St. Augustine and the fact that it is a historic site really made my visit special.  I checked in and found my way to my room (trust me- harder than it sounds with the labyrinth of hallways)The room was just okay, small but adequately furnished and overlooking the pool.  The main areas of this place fare so much better like the impressive lobby, the bar and just the overall Spanish style architecture.Customer service was quite good.  They quickly checked me in and made sure that since they didn't have a concierge level that I would get Marriott points instead.  And at the pool, there was no bar, and the pool area was packed so I called room service and they sent a server out right away to take care of me and all the other people who were melting in the courtyard pool area.  Really surprised that there wasn't a working bar out there!Staying on the pool for a minute- know that if you have kids- the pool offers no shade and the deck is super hot on the toes as it bakes in the sun all day.  There are towels by the door and iron chaises (again- watch anything metal as you are likely to fry a limb off!)The restaurant off the main lobby was terrific!  The servers and food were great and the decor- well I will just have to write a separate review about the wonderful lighting arrangement over one of the tables.My final proof point of exceptional service came from the valet and engineering staff.  When they pulled my car around in the morning- I somehow had a flat tire.  I mean like flatter than a pan cake.  So the valet worked together with the engineering staff to put air in my tire and give me directions to a local tire store to get me on my way.  So appreciated!So really high points for this Marriott hotel and it's staff.  And the location can't be beat either!Casa Monica is the nicest hotel in St. Augustine.  This was my first stay here.  It is located along the main street in town a short walk to everything.  Valet parking is very convenient.  Three rooms are well kept with essentials. I stayed in a small room near three gym with a good business rate.  I expect there are larger rooms.  The gym is very small, but since I was the only one there both times it was fine. There is a bar and restaurant of the lobby area.  There is also a Starbucks at the hotel. This its a Marriott hotel.I have revisited the Casa Monica since the new management.  The new face lift in the bar area looks great and the service is 100% better.  We gave them another chance after a bad experience in 2014 and they more than redeemed themselves.  All of the staff from the front desk; the valet the waitstaff and the barstaff were exceptional.  We were sad when things went sour in 2014, Casa Monica St Augustine was home away from home.  They have truly apologized, they sent us a really nice gift, gave us a weekend stay all inclusive and have been so very accommodating since.  Our daughter got married and most of the bridal party stayed at Casa Monica 1-23-16 and we all had a great time.I loved the hotel and the service. It was a perfect location for my wedding night and getting ready with my bridesmaid. The spa was my only disappointment. I trusted the hotel to find someone to do my formal hair and makeup for my wedding. The makeup was wonderful, but my hair was terrible and I had to return to my room to redo it myself. I paid over $200 for this service and it included a 20% tip that I had no control over. It was my only regret of the whole day. I emailed the hotel and they didn't even respond with an acknowledgement.The supervisor for the front desk is not smiling at all ( name Rhan ) Not a good image for this hotel. .. Nothing special in this hotel I paid $399 a night and services and room quality is no different the holiday inn hotels.btw I found human hair under the sheets.. DISGUSTING..Will never return.One of my all time favorite hotels. If I'm in St. Augustine, I always try to stay here. Customer service is 5 star, ideal spot and beautiful property! It's the quintessential St. Augustine experience.Beautiful OLD hotel.  Likely the most expensive place to stay to be in the center of the city.  You can get a better experience at the B&B's in the area.  The architecture is nice to look at and wonder around the hotel but you do not have to pay for a night to look around.Amazing hotel and really the only 5 star in St. Augustine Pros: - nicely decorated, very regal and gothic with big chairs from a castle - suites are amazing, Anastasia Suite is worth it- service is very good and friendly - they cater to whatever you need - location is perfect right in the center of St. Augustine worth paying for if you want to walk around the city at allCons:- Pricey $$$$- some of the rooms need to be updated and cleaned (drains backed up and cleanliness) - Parking is very pricey at $35 a night. If you stay and pay a lot, parking should be free Such a great hotel with a few caveats that if corrected would give this hotel a 5 star review in my book but for now it only gets 4. Still a great hotel.As always, you get what you pay for. I have stayed at this Autograph location 2-3 times now, and they never disappoint. Valet is $24 a night for guests, which is expensive, but there is little to no parking anywhere in St. Aug, without paying for it, so it is definitely convenient. There are always bellhops available to unload your car and bring your stuff upstairs. I always happen to be here for a wedding so we have a ton of stuff. The rooms are all different, no 2 are the same. The building used to be an old government building, before they converted it. The front desk people are nice and helpful and they are usually always able to accommodate you. The rooms are always spotless and the bathrooms are clean and organized. On the days that we got ready for the wedding, the guest services was running back and forth to our room maybe 100 times and they were so nice and helpful about it. I felt bad having them come up so often, but they hold so many weddings there that they are used to it. The restaurant downstairs is delicious. I have only have tried the crab cakes but they are so good. The wine list is mediocre and the prices are jacked up pretty high but it is nice just to sit down there at the bar and relax. The ballrooms are absolutely gorgeous when they are done up for a wedding reception. The staff are all so nice and will get you anything you need. They are a lot of fun too! The food was delicious at the reception. We had the choice of filet or salmon. I did filet and I was in heaven. It was one of the best filets I have ever had! Overall, the hotel is amazing. Yes, it is expensive, but you are paying for such a wonderful experience here. If I can afford it, I will stay here again and again.Beautiful but a bit pricey. Nice for special occasion. Was not really happy that parking was $24/day and that was really the only choice.If I could give it less stars I would!!!  Came here for my 14 year anniversary and Paid $465.00 for a nasty, old, moldy, makes motel 6 look like the ritz room. Found two roaches in drawer.Got food poisoning from room service which cost $200 ended up checking out early to go to a Marriott down the road. Which we were able to get a 1 bedroom sweet for more than 1/2 the price. DO NOT GO!!!Had a great time. Everyone from the valet to the lounge bar tenders were extremely nice. Extra bonus was the Starbucks in the lobby.My husband and I decided to stay at Casa Monica because we would be getting married across the street in the Lightner Museum Courtyard. The location of the hotel in general is really excellent. It's centrally located and so easy to walk to everything in downtown St. Augustine. It was an amazing location especially for us during the week/weekend as we could just pop across the street for our rehearsal, meeting with the wedding planner, doing photographs, and anything else that we needed to do to prep for the wedding. The customer service at Casa Monica, I have to say, was top-notch. Attentive, courteous, friendly. We had a weak shower head and alerted the front desk. We were headed out, but they had someone up to fix it immediately and even left us a courtesy card apologizing for the inconvenience and to grab a small coffee (on them) in the cafe downstairs. The common spaces are gorgeous. The rooms themselves are a bit outdated and could use some TLC. They are also not that big. It kind of rubbed us the wrong way that we had paid top dollar to stay there (the weekday nights were more affordable but the weekend/prime nights broke the bank), while they charged for bottles of water and internet in your room. We decided to splurge for parking because we did not want to worry about street parking/meters, and that was another hefty charge (about $25/night). All in all, I am so happy we stayed there as it was a once-in-a lifetime, but for the cost we will probably not splurge to stay there again (unless we go on week nights).I just got into town visiting my mom, who is in poor health. Never been here before and since this was an emergency visit I had no clue about the restaurants and what not. So, after closing down the visiting hours and schmoozing like only I can I needed some food. First going by the condo to drop things off I headed down town. Confused I was, clueless and with no planning. Never being able to find a place to park I saw this place from a distance. I say. Looks higher end, as the town had many beer halls and college places but I wanted something better and more mature. So I entered into an adventure, after a long day and I was taken back by the place.Sitting at the bar, good live jazz was playing. Ordering a wonderful martini, from the terrific bartender I got both their bar menu and higher end faire. So, I had these little fried fish buttons as an app. Quite good, very fresh and pure of good fish taste. On the seafood kick, I had the salmon sandwich, which was really good and fresh. Looking around at this small plates place, I can see they knew what they were doing and with some great trumpeting in the background and after a long and truly miserable day they place lit a little candle for me as we will need it.Beautiful hotel, prime location.  We were so happy with our stay here.  We had canceled out reservation due to a possible change in our plans, but when we got to St. Augustine, we knew that we had to stay here!  The front desk was able to give us our room at our original price, plus upgrade to a larger suite.  We have stayed at a few hotels from the Autograph Collection and this one was by far our favorite.Our room was very quite, comfortable and had a view.  The Bose was playing when we arrived, nice touch.  We didn't feel bad about the cost of valet, so worth it while staying in the area.  Lots of great restaurants within walking distance.  Plus, we were even treated to a free breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Great stay!
review_content_20: We stopped here for two nights on the drive down to Miami from Virginia and absolutely loved this hotel. The hotel is beautifully decorated with lots of old Spanish touches and the room was spacious and comfortable.Customer service was top-notch and the restaurant downstairs had lots of delicious choices. At night, there was live music at the hotel restaurant.The location is great- walking distance to all the major St. Augustine tourist attractions, shopping and dining.  The hotel offers valet parking for $24, which is great, because parking is not easy in the area. The only disappointment was the pool, which isn't in great shape and which didn't have enough shady areas to sit under.  We spent about an hour there with the little ones, but the steps were small and the pavement was burning hot, so there wasn't really space for them to hang out and play.Great location and one of the nicest places to stay in town. I would go back. It only gets three stars though because the "preferred view" room we stayed in had no view at all unless you get down on your hands and knees.  The window started at the floor and was only about 30 inches high and a balustrade further obscured the view.  If you reserve a preferred view room ask for one with a normal window.Great location but way over priced. Try the Hilton instead - but they have less than 100 rooms and often sell out on the weekends. We paid $500 for one night (Friday, the most expensive night). The room was nice but not any nicer than other hotels we've stayed at for far less. Our "preferred view" was anything but ... not worth the premium. If you have to stay at the most expensive place in town, and paying an exorbitant amount for it makes you feel important, than Casa Monica is your place. Otherwise there are many other options to choose from. Also - hope your neighbors are quiet. Ours weren't. The walls are thin. It's hard to get in the mood with Marge yapping non-stop next door.I was a little concerned about the hotel given the mixed reviews. It's definitely got an older feel to it...the rooms are small and just ok. However, the service I received more than made up for it. I just slept in the room...didn't hang out much at the hotel. Breakfast took forever to be served but it was clear they were short-staffed and those working were doing their best to be gracious and attentive ...I had the continental as a Marriott member...juice, berries, Greek yoghurt, muffins, toast and coffee.  All good. I changed my reservations several times and each time the hotel staff was pleasant and accommodating. Concierge handled my meal reservations...including getting me into a booked restaurant...which I fully appreciated. I would definitely return to Casa Monica...it is so convenient...and the staff was so lovely. I was tempted to help wait on tables myself when I stopped in for a drink early evening before bed...the staff was clearly struggling to keep up with all of the demands. But they smiled through it all. Shout out to Matthew at the front desk...thank you!  You are a great hospitality professional!was in the bar....whew pricey for St. Augustine.The best thing about this hotel is it's prime location.  The 16 foot ceilings are nice.  But I was expecting something really special for a Marriott category 8 property.  The hotel is average, though wearing a fancy veneer.  The A/C in the room is LOUD like being next to an idling truck and since the windows do not open there is no other way to get fresh air.  The ceiling fan squeaks.  The bed has a soft foam mattress that is comfortable enough when I'm sitting up reading, but killed my back when I tried to sleep.  Balky WiFi doesn't work most of the time.  Free continental breakfast (see picture) wasn't worth the price.  Even though I paid a rock-bottom price and was upgraded to a suite, I find myself wishing that I had stayed in one of the many quaint B&Bs I passed during my evening stroll.All has been very good over these past two days here with one exception...the restaurant.  The dining room has felt like it was ill prepared to handle the Christmas crowd they've had.  The wait staff is excellent but apparently under-manned.  That, however, isn't the group who's underperforming.  That distinction goes to the chef & his staff.  The last two mornings breakfasts have been both slow & poorly prepared.  Over-cooked eggs both days & this morning's was so bad they comped a whole meal for six guests. I'd estimate that cost the hotel right at $150.  An establishment of this caliber shouldn't be let down by the kitchen when all other departments are exemplary.  Valets are spot on; front desk is efficient & extremely accommodating;  housekeeping does a great job & I was told engineering took care of a problem within minutes of notification.  C'mon, Chef!  Get up to speed with the rest of the hotel's staff.I am a fan of Casa Monica.  First of all, I acknowledge that my experience at the Casa Monica is probably slightly different than most people who stay at this hotel.  Maybe that made my rating and experience a bit biased.  We were there this past weekend for our friends' wedding.  The first night there, we joined the bride and a few bridesmaids at the Kessler Suite, which is their large 3-bedroom suite.  Then for the next two nights, we stayed in a regular room near the Kessler Suite (since I am helping out with the wedding).So several reviewers pointed out the negatives, and I have to say, they are true.  The wifi does cost extra, which in this day and age, is a bit ridiculous.  The parking does cost extra, but given you are staying in a prime spot in St. Augustine, I fully expected it.  The hotel rate is expensive, yep, I agree.  The hotel is old and not everything is shiny new, yep, check.  When it rains (one of the days we were there, it poured), some areas smelled a little funky... that's an unfortunately yes as well.Ok, aside from all that, and I know it's a long list.... We had a great time and experience at Casa Monica.  First of all, the hotel is GORGEOUS.  Every details, every corner, from the lobby, the hallways, the guest rooms, the ball rooms... beautiful.  So it isn't one of the very contemporary shiny type, definitely don't want to stay here if that is your thing.  Appreciate the theme, the look and feel of staying in a historical building, and you'll enjoy your stay.  Our first night was at the Kessler Suite and then we checked in to Room 517 for 2 nights.  The Kessler Suite was beautiful.  Three top stories in that high tower when you look at the building itself.  It's hard to believe how spacious it is because when looking from ground level, it seems to be a tall and narrow tower.  The suite has 4 levels, the foyer, the living area, the master bedroom, and lastly the two bedrooms on the fourth level.  It was beautiful and spacious.  The only complain I have is that you have to climb stairs... lots of stairs, especially on the top level/floor.  We enjoyed it and it was perfect for the bride.  She had plenty of space and invited her bridesmaids to join her at the suite the night before the weddingFor the next two nights, we checked in to room 517.  If you are planning or helping out a wedding with the bride staying at Kessler Suite, I strongly recommend you to take the only non-suite room on the fifth floor (517), which is what we did (assuming you don't want a suite yourself).  I didn't want to spend too much and stay in another suite on the fifth floor, and 517 was the only non-suite choice.  The front desk warned me that it is one of their smallest room in the hotel, but in this case, convenience wins.  I am glad we picked that room because it was very easy to go back and forth between 517 and Kessler to help out on the day of the wedding.  And really the room wasn't so small that it would be an inconvenience.Overall, the beds were very comfortable, the hotel was beautiful, the service was impeccable... so we really enjoyed our stay.  Will we stay there again?  Well, unlikely.  I don't usually stay in an expensive hotel and especially since it's so close to home, that the chance to spending a night in a hotel in St. Augustine is already unlikely as is.  But we were glad we had the opportunity to try Casa Monica at least once.Oh and the wedding coordinator, Courtney, was awesome!wonderful!! Great room   Great lounge.. Nice front desk people.  Parking stinks 25$ a Nite!!  Great area convenient to all!!  JUST an UPDATE  AS I WAS CHECKING OUT THEY  wanted to charge me $20 because I asked for a refrigerator in my room!  I called and told them YOUR KIDDING RIGHT!! I $400 a Nite hotel doesn't have a mini fridge !! Then I want to charge me.. don't think so!!Very beautiful hotel. Extremely disappointed in the fact we had reservations for a premium room with a view. We checked in and the window was the smallest window I have ever seen. It was floor to half the ceiling. The view was overlooking the roof of the old courthouse. Room needs 2 chairs.Team Vega made a stop here to not only admire the beautiful antiques within the lobby, but to check out the awesome art located within the hotel property. It was incredibly impressive and the staff was more than friendly, definitely check it out.Honestly, I'm not sure I understand the hype about this hotel. As a platinum Marriott member, I've come to expect pretty great service/accommodations especially from what they deem a Category 8 hotel. I think that's the problem I had with the Casa Monica: It's NOT a category 8 hotel. NOT. AT. ALL. We booked with Marriott points, so perhaps they gave us the worst room in the building (great way to treat platinum members). The shower would not stop dripping. The room was large, but had only one tiny window. It was SO DARK. It was laughable!! The bedroom area, which was almost like a secondary room, had no windows at all - it was a dark box. Just like our very own dungeon.  We ordered room service for breakfast each morning. $6 service charge, 27%+ tax, etc. It was insanely expensive. Especially considering it was cold bacon, sausage and pancakes. It was evident they either pull things off a buffet line where they've been sitting, or there's a vat of pre-cooked food in the back. Awful awful food.They charge $27 a day for parking which honestly seems steep for the area.The Starbucks inside is a great addition. Make sure you tell them you're staying at the hotel (they'll give you a 10% discount) I didn't find this out until the day we left. The pool was much smaller then we anticipated, and was pretty crowded.Wifi is $14.95/day - unless your a gold/platinum member. Then it's free. But it's pretty spotty and didn't work well. Had to keep logging in and out. On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable. And the bedding was nice.  The staff were very polite and friendly. That's about all I liked about the place. Marriott needs to re-categorize this hotel. 120,000 points for a three night stay. You can stay at the Ritz for that - which is a FAR CRY from this place.This was my first stay at the Casa Monica.  So disappointed that Marriott has changed the dining into an updated look.  The photos on the website are not of the new updates.  As a traveler, we wanted to stay here for the experience.  While we had a great room with an amazing view.  I pray they don't update the charm of the rooms.GREAT HOTEL, GREAT BAR & RESTAURANT, AND EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE! My husband left his brand new sports coat in the closet and Casa Monica found it AND shipped  the jacket back to us in Houston, Texas!  Casa Monica is located right in the middle of downtown and is within walking distance to all the cool spots! We LOVE this hotel and will definitely be staying here during our next trip to St. Augustine!Conveniently located in the heart of St. Augustine.  I recently stayed at the Casa Monica while attending a wedding.  For a 4-star hotel, I was expecting a little more.  Let me begin with some of the negatives.  Wifi is not free.  For a hotel that's already pricey to begin with, complimentary wifi would have been great.  Housekeeping looked liked they needed an extra push.  It didn't seem like they were in any kind of hurry to clean the rooms.  The gym needs a lot of work. They have all the basic equipment but it's entirely way too small.  Lastly, the showers are dreadful.  There is nothing more unsatisfying than taking a shower with low water pressure.  Now for the positives.  The rooms are very spacious and come equipped with an HD television.  The beds are very comfortable and will definitely give you a good nights sleep.  The hotel staff is very friendly and willing to help you out with any questions.  As for my favorite part of the hotel, it has to be the pool area.  It's a great spot to be able to kick back and relax.  The jacuzzi didn't hurt either!We have stayed in 2 other properties from the Kessler collection before (also considered a Marriott Autograph Collection hotel) and they were a step up compared to the Casa Monica.  We own property in the area but decided we wanted to stay in town this trip just to experience the city in a different way.  St Augustine is a terrific place to visit, the streets were full of life downtown so the location for the Casa Monica is perfect.  But that is about all that is.  The rooms are small, overpriced, a little musty, bathrooms are small and the rooms are poorly equipped.  My wife expects to see  a full length mirror somewhere in the room, not here, plugs are sparse which is not helpful in todays digital world.  We tried the bar/restaurant our first night and  ended up walking out, they were slow, understaffed and not the least bit interested in serving dessert and cocktails at 9:00 pm.  The hotel is old and loud, you can hear most everything said in the hallway, kids next door are like they are in the room with you.  The staff was somewhat courteous, but you can tell they have a script for every question so they were not helpful. We were there for three nights and not much changedLet me start by saying the staff were super helpful and attentive, and the location a destination every traveler should experience.  The Room we chose was their premium king with separate seating area, and upgraded room.  The room was clean but of average to small size from my experience.  We requested a early check in and a high room; we got a 2 floor room on the street SUPER LOUD ROAD NOISE! We looked forward to the Sunday brunch with carving station and seafood, we smartly choose to look before committing $35.00 per person,  this is one of the lows of the property.  The stainless buffet stand had food sloped down the fronts and all over the table clothes serving tongs with crusty old food on them attention to this would give the whole new perspective.  Now the best part is the architecture and the location, you can not any better location too bad they did not pay more attention to the small things and the cost is just way out of line with reality.Incredible place that's a once in a lifetime stay.  Have the five course  dinner with wine in the hotel restaurant downstairs and it was quite literally the best dinner I've  ever had.  Where normally I eat and run, I sat at table for two hours savoring an incredible meal, superbly matched wines and attended by an excellent waitstaff.  Definitely made our stay at Casa Monica trip to remember.It's a gorgeous hotel in the heart of historic St Augustine, lavish, beautifully decorated, and it's the only place I'll stay when I visit St Auggie.I went to a wedding there and was blown away, It was beautiful! The staff at all times were very polite and professional! The food was amazing! I would recommend this to anyone for any reason. The parking is not that great (no-where in St. Augustine is though) Valet was a bit pricey. The hotel is central and very convenient . They do have a bar and restaurant in hotel too. Love, love, love.
review_content_40: We have Marriott Platinum Elite status and have always been treated very cordially at this hotel (last stay was April 2015 prior to this stay in November 2015).  April was a wonderful stay but this trip was totally opposite.  Check in desk was ho-hum and didn't care about anything.  Given a small room that smelled extremely musty and had no tub.  Called front desk and we were given a room like ones we have gotten in the past.  Next morning stopped at front desk and asked if they could tell we had been there before - a man (all people working the desk during our stay were under 30 years old and not personable) answered 'no'.  I told him about the first room smelling really musty - at that time a short haired blonde female appeared and said rather curtly that "none of their rooms smell musty" - oh yes they do!  Asked about the tub situation and she said that if it wasn't on the profile or requested at time of reservation, they won't give it to you.  I said that we had always gotten it in the past and she said that they reserve those rooms only for "Platinum" members; I said we are Platinum and then she started saying something about that only Platinum Elite can get those rooms - hmmm, we ARE Platinum Elite as the profile shows.  She got very huffy and from her words/actions she insinuated that we were "lucky" to even get a room there.  The hotel was not full at all and only the bar area was busy, mostly because of walk-in traffic from outside. There were other things that had changed since April 25.  We will NOT be staying at this hotel again (had always done so any time we were travelling to south Florida).  On this trip in Nov. we met with several people whom we had highly recommended this hotel to in the past ; told them about our experience and said it's not worth the money to stay at Casa Monica where the customer is always wrong and management is always right.  Marriott/Kessler Group has done a real disservice by changing management.The Casa Monica Hotel in St. Augustine is centrally located in the heart of the tourist section of St. Augustine.  It is directly across the street from Flagler College and just a block away from St George Street.  It is an Autograph Collection hotel from Marriott and everything was very nice.  The hotel's restaurant was good and had a nice bar. Very nice pool and hot tub.  Great views of Flagler College from certain rooms.  Highly recommend this hotel.  Must valet but you won't need to get in a car because everything is within walking distance.hotel is very pretty and very centrally located.  unfortunately, it's an old hotel and the amenities haven't caught up with modern expectations.  they trade too much on the name and not enough on guest convenience:1.  internet is crazy bad.  no signal, and ridiculously slow and cuts out when you do get one.  insane if you need to access internet.  2.  shower was backed-up3.  got bounced around from housekeeping to bar, back to housekeeping when trying to order drinks at the pool. 4.  rooms are ok, but nothing great - flimsy shower stalls, single sink in a premier room when we complained, they tried very hard to fix things, but some of the issues experienced require investment.  lovely old property, but expensive and dated.  can't recommend, sorry. jwA true surprise. Excellent service.  Yet relaxed. Visuals oh so pleasant.Wireless, one device, per day?That's wrong.You are a fancy hotel and I paid a lot of fancy dollars. We have more than one person with more than one wireless device. Hell my 4 year old has an iPad.Otherwise, great location, beautiful building and rooms.We just finished a four night stay here and it was absolutely perfect.  Luis was very nice to upgrade our room and was also very considerate in providing suggestions for activities and dining options.Everyone at the hotel from the valets to the servers at Cordova 95 and Cafe Cordova were wonderful.  We were able to use the pool which was very nice and my wife loves the cushioned chaise lounges.Our stay was so nice we are already planning another trip to this hotel.I just wanted to pass along my compliments and point out Luis and the other staff members who went above and beyond to make our trip wonderful.A Florida classic play to stay.   I didn't run into any ghosts.   Had a few nice drinks at the bar.   Also it was great to have the coffee shop right in the lobby.    The valets were super nice, and quickly got my car when I needed it.   The location is perfect.   Stay in style!Ok, so I know it's a Marriott Autograph and some things are going to be overpriced, but $13 for one weak, single vodka and soda? I mean, c'mon...that's too much. As someone who enjoys utilizing the bars at hotels, I couldn't allow myself to order another drink when I can walk half a block and get one for less than half. This is St. Augustine, not Miami Beach. It's a beautiful hotel with a comfortable bar, so enjoy a drink and then go explore.What can I say? Booking was easy and the staff made sure I was welcomed and made it a special day for me on my. Big 5-0 !!! They even gave me a pretty birthday card and complimentary dessert! ;) It was very clean, beautiful, (especially the historic artwork throughout the hotel) nice pool and jacuzzi. Thank God they had a Starbucks lol and the valet was thoughtful as I was waiting for my family to all depart at the same time.    (Thank you Luis and all in your staff)It's those little extra touches that make you want to return! Thank you for also having a great online deal for what I know as the upper end of hotels in town.An outstanding and HISTORIC hotel in the heart of St. Augustine.  Great updated rooms in this classy old hotel. Some rooms are a bit small. Pool or water view are ideal.  Nice lobby bar and restaurant and PERECT location near restaurants, bars, marina, art galleries and sites. Hotel lobby can get a bit busy and traffic here on weekends Starbucks in lobby is great, albeit busy. Staff is helpful and it's a great overall experience.  Rooms can get pricey at peak times. BE sure to walk around Old St. Augustine town.Only stayed one night, and no complaints. Very beautiful, romantic, a lot of opportunities to for photos. Starbucks on site. Very comfortable beds. Exceptional Customer service. Clean, well appointed rooms. Public Parking lot around the corner that is free after 5pm M-F if you want to avoid the $24 valet. Didn't get to go to the restaurant or the pool, so this review excludes them.Beautiful hotel right by the water. Polite and professional staff with immaculate room and very comfortable furnishings. The art galleries and shops downstairs are lovely. We watched world cup at A1A restraunt when us was playing. Plenty of nice ahops and venues to visit and enjoy.  The tini martini room nearby is pretty happening for drinks on the patio. Stay away from the restaurant on the pier. Unless you just want some hushpuppies. There are a number of bums see wiki for definition of yhat word or urban dictionary and denizens of the street that will petition you for money and freely offer unsolicited negative attention. Check the weather before you go. Its fun in thevrain but beautiful when its clear.Amazing place. Katie was so awesome. We got a very cool room. The decor is beautiful. We are very happy staying here.This review is for the bar only. The bar in the lobby of the Casa Monica is very nice. However. It was filthy.  Crumbs and broken pieces of glass were on the bar and on the barstools.  Glasses hanging  above the bar were covered in dust and spotted. The very nice bartender put her fingers inside the glass to reach it and pull down from the rack.I booked a night at Casa Monica to take in the Xmas vibe in St. Augustine. Unfortunately I had a pet emergency that forced me not to make the trip. Now sure,  my fault for having a pet of course and being inside their generous 72 hour cancellation policy. I tried to move my reservation and not cancel it outright as to state that I understand I am in the wrong but let's work together so you can have my money and a happy customer. I was met with a resounding NO. So full charge for the room I will not be staying in. I suppose Casa Monica is in the money making business and not the hospitality business. There are a few definitions of hospitality and Casa Monica has not met one. Deplorable customer satisfaction. Enjoy the free money and I will not book Casa Monica or any Marriott ever again.We stayed here last week and it was a pretty nice time.  I randomly selected this hotel stay as a getaway weekend trip.  We had never even heard of St. Augustine, FL before so we were amazingly surprised at how beautiful the hotel is, the town, and the awesome history.  My boyfriend was pretty impressed since he lets me pick all of our vacation spots and this pick was random but turned out perfect!  I literally Googled Florida hotels and packages and Casa Monica came up.Keeping in mind that this is a historical hotel, it is beautifully kept.  Valet parking is available and you might as well use the valet because I think parking is the same price... about $20 a night.  Just remember to tip. Check-in was smooth and easy and the staff are friendly.  I LOVE the old cars they have parked around the hotel.  They are available for rent I believe.  We did not swim in the pool because its just too cool for me in February but I think its heated, if you're interested.   The grounds at Casa Monica are just lovely. The room was clean and they even made sure to fulfill my request for extra pillows and towels. Our king bed was really sweet. There's not much light in the room we had but we did have a view of the water fountain next door.  We booked the Romance Package ;)There was a bouquet of red roses and a bottle of red wine in the room upon our arrival.  Later that night the waitstaff delivered chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne to our room!  It was so sweet and romantic. We also reserved the carriage ride and we were promptly picked up at Noon in front of the hotel.  This carriage ride was EVERYTHING for me on our trip!  It was sooo amazing and sweet, and awesome! It was about 1 hr long around town and we were told the in depth and highly interesting history of the town.  It was just awesome. We had a really great time for a weekend, mini vacation. It was super relaxing, too. We will definitely go back.   By the way... they DO have Starbucks coffee in the cafe of the hotel! ;) The dining experience at the hotel's restaurant, 95 Cordova, is a completely different story so you'll find it in a separate reviewFantastic historic hotel in the center of the Old Town area.
